loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is married to Jaime D. C. and currently lives in Barangay Banganan, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. They are blessed with four children: Jojo, Joey, Jomar and Jovina. Their eldest son is a criminology graduate who works as a security guard in Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. The other children are still studying in tertiary and secondary level school.

Virginia used to help her husband plant onions on the farm, since this is their sole source of income. Financial constraints have kept the couple from expanding their farming, even providing some of the agricultural inputs (like fertilizers) needed by the farm. Fortunately, Virginia found a microfinance institution that would answer her prayers. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000, which will be utilized in maintenance and expansion of their onion farm to generate better income. Virginia said that she believes that through patience, hard work, and strong determination, they will able reach their goals in life.

loans.use: To maintain and expand an onion farm

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: La señora Bertha L. Q. y su esposo Esteban Gutiérrez, tienen tres pequeños hijos a quienes mantienen con su trabajo, mucha dedicación y cariño. Ellos viven en su domicilio de la Calle 9 en la zona Villa Tunari, en la ciudad de El Alto, departamento de La Paz. La señora Bertha y don Esteban se dedican a la venta de zapatillas deportivas (tenis) desde hace más de 14 años. Venden este producto en la Calle Sebastián Segurola (Barrio Chino) y en la Av. Ballivián de la zona, en la ciudad de El Alto; pero ellos no solo las venden, sino también, arreglan las zapatillas para su venta. El mayor deseo de ellos es poder darles a sus hijos una buena educación.Por esto y más la señora Bertha es considerada una cliente preferencial dentro de nuestra institución
texts.en:
Mrs. Bertha L. Q. and her husband, Esteban Gutiérrez, have three small children. They support their children through their work, much dedication, and affection. They live in their home on Calle 9, in the the Villa Tunari zone, in the city of El Alto, in the department of La Paz. Bertha and Esteban have been selling tennis shoes for more than 14 years. They sell their product on Calle Sebastián Segurola (Barrio Chino) and on the Av. Ballivián in the zone, in the city of El Alto. But, they do not just sell; they also repair shoes to be sold. Their biggest wish is to be able to give their children a good education. For this reason, among others, Bertha is considered a preferred customer within our institution.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 5 dozen pairs of tennis shoes

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en: Mrs. Estrelita C. is forty-two years old, married and presently living at Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She has two children. Her husband is a carpenter. Determination and hard work are what the couple believes in. She joined the Kiva partner, Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, in November of 2006, knowing they believe in offering true service and assistance to needy people like her. Abject poverty is inevitable if they don't work hard. Estrelita is motivated to raise hogs in addition to taking care of the household. She asked for a loan from Paglaum MPC in order to purchase pig feed. The couple’s aspiration is to have a fenced area for the pigs, and hope that someday they can send their children to college to earn a degree.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed

loans.name: Abdurakim

texts.ru: Эшонкулов Абдукарим заёмщик в Микроинвест с 2007 года. Он берёт кредит на увеличение оборотного капитала  бизнеса животноводства. Абдукарим  мужчина, который хорошо разбирается в породистых скотах. Он благодарен ,за  возможность в кредит поддерживать свой бизнес  и  осуществлять свои планы. По сравнению с  прошлым годам у Абдукарима улучшилась жизнь и увеличился скот.
texts.en:
Abdurakim E. has been taking out loans from MicroInvest since 2007. He takes a loan to increase this working capital for his animal husbandry business. Abdurakim is a man who knows pedigree cattle very well. He is thankful for the opportunity to be able to support his business in credit and realize his plans. In comparison to the prior years Abdurakim's life has improved and the number of cattle increased.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For feeding and selling of cattle

loans.name: Nzovwe Group

texts.en:
Lyoda is an animal-feed selller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Iringa. She belongs to the Nzovwe group loan. She currently earns very little monthly profit. Every day, she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania, a Kiva partner, so that she can buy more animal feed for resale to expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Lyoda is 45 years old, married and has six children: ages 22, 18, 17, 15, 10 and 9. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Patricia, who has her own small business selling animal feed in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more animal feed for resale

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru: Малохат – женщина 43 года. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Занимается продажей декоративной косметики на втором этаже рынка «Панчшанбе» города Худжанда. У Малохат очень большой ассортимент косметики и соответственно у нее много клиентов. Малохат закупает товар у фирм-поставщиков и индивидуальных дистрибьюторов. Сейчас современная молодёжь предпочитает дорогую косметику известных компаний. Поэтому Малохат просит займ для закупки партию декоративной косметики от Джордани Голд компании Орифлейм.
texts.en:
Malohat is 43 years old, married and has 3 children. She sells decorative cosmetics on the second floor of the Panchshanbe market in Khujand. Malohat has a wide assortment of cosmetics and, thus, has many customers. She buys her merchandise from supplier firms and individual distributors. Nowadays, young people prefer expensive cosmetics from well-known companies. This is why Malohat is requesting a loan to buy a stock of Djordani Gold decorative cosmetics from Oriflame.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of decorative cosmetics from Oriflame

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila B. is from the village of Salimpuno. She is 35 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Mila operates a family member's business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting corn for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,500 PHP a month. In 2006, Mila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to finance a corn production project. Mila is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will also be used to finance a corn production project. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To finance corn production project

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget O. is 32 years old and she is married with 2 children. She sells clay pots, made by people in the region, in the market. She hopes for the loan amount to purchase more pots to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more native pots to sell

loans.name: Achol

texts.en:
Achol M. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcohol and is requesting a loan to build a bar.  Achol is 29 years old and is married with a husband who works as a teacher. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Open up a bar

loans.name: Juan Rodolfo

texts.es:
“Tengo una niña pequeña y cuando me voy a trabajar me gustaría dejarla a ella y a mi esposa mas seguras dentro de la casa, es por eso que necesito poner protecciones en las ventanas y también tengo planeado poner un portón grande para que mi hija pueda jugar sin correr peligro”. 
Cabe mencionar que en la foto solo aparece la esposa y la niña del solicitante ya que el Sr. Juan Rodolfo sale al amanecer hacia su trabajo y regresa muy tarde a su casa es por eso que no pudimos coordinarnos con el para que apareciera en la foto.
texts.en:
“I have a young daughter and I would like to leave her and my wife in a safe home when I go to work. That’s why I need to add protection to the windows and install a big gate so that my daughter can play without danger.”

The picture above is only of Mr. Juan Rodolfo’s wife and daughter. We couldn’t coordinate a time so he could be in the picture since Mr. Juan Rodolfo leaves to work very early and gets home very late.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make house safe

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a native of Binangonan, Rizal province in the Philippines. She is 43 years old and married to Benjamin who is 48 and her partner in her business. She has four children to take good care of. The eldest daughter is 21 years old and a college graduate while the youngest is six years old and an elementary school pupil.

As a mother, Juanita’s dreams are always for her children and family. She wants to bring her children into a decent life. In 2008, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines. She hoped to have access to capital for the continuation of her dying business. Her previous loans were carefully utilized as additional and rolling capital for her fish cage. A fish cage is used as a venue for fingerlings to be cultured until ready for harvest.

Now on her 3rd loan, Juanita proposes a loan of 15,000 pesos as additional capital for her fish-cage business. Specifically, the amount will be used to pay for three rolls of assorted fish nets, a hundred pieces on bamboo, wires and other tying materials and also for labor expenses.

Juanita is hopeful that her business will grow and that someday she will have more fish cages. She also dreams of sending all her children to school until college and that they find jobs. One of her aspirations is to be able to build a house that is durable and spacious.

loans.use: To pay for supplies and labor for her fish cage

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia L. is from the village of Plaridel in Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 34 years old. Antonia is single and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Antonia sells a variety of products from her farm in the local community. Antonia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Antonia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antonia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. Antonia is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Antonia's third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to educate her child and supplement her income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of her business.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny G., 45 years of age, is a resident of Datu Tangkilan, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She has one child and is now separated from her husband. Her child is already in college.

Jenny owns and operates a grocery store. Her customers are her neighbors. Her future plan for her business is to make it bigger than what it is now so that it can help for the future of her family, most especially to pay for the studies of her one and only child.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her grocery store

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.en:
Y. Ilhomjon is 24 years old. He is married and has a little child. Ilhomjon has a small place in the market where he sells all kinds of small items necessary for a household. He has been in this kind of business for four years. Ilhomjon wants his children to have a higher education, and that is why he is working hard together with his wife, who always assists him in everything. The business is successful, bringing considerable income to the family.

Today Ilhomjon wants to expand his business and to increase his working capital for purchasing new goods to sell. With this purpose he is requesting 4000 TJS. Having received a loan from IMON twice already, and having demonstrated himself as a reliable client, Ilhomjon promises to manage this loan with accuracy. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To expand his business by increasing the working capital to purchase new goods to sell.

loans.name: Marlenis

texts.es:
La microempresaria: Marlenis Rubí tiene 43 años de edad es casada  tiene dos hijos menores de edad, ambos estudian en nivel primario. La señora Rubí se dedica desde hace nueve años a la venta ambulante de cosméticos y prendas de oro y plata laminado.

Sus principales clientes son del sexo femenino a quienes les entrega sus productos al crédito con facilidades de pago, por lo general en dos o tres cuotas quincenales. Este negocio lo realiza por encargo en base a lo que sus clientes le solicitan en ocasiones hace su pedido y en otras veces viaja a la capital. Marlenis ya ha sido beneficiada con dos préstamos anteriores por parte de kiva y ya ha cancelado en tiempo y forma.

Sin embargo por la naturaleza  del negocio tiene que contar con un capital que le permita hacer las compras al contado y entregarlas con facilidades de pago, para este fin es que solicita financiamiento, en este caso requiere comprar oro laminado ya que es el producto que esta teniendo mayor demanda en esta época del año.

Los productos a comprar son los siguientes: 10 pares de Aretes de oro laminado los compra a US 8 dólares cada par, 8 unidades de pulseras de oro laminado las compra a US 20 dólares cada una, 8 unidades de anillos de oro laminado a US 15 dólares cada unidad y 8 unidades de cadenas de oro laminado a US 30 dólares cada unidad.
texts.en:
Marlenis Rubí is 43 years old and married. Her two children are elementary school students. For the past nine years, Marlenis has worked as a door-to-door saleswoman selling cosmetics and both gold and silver plated jewelry.

Her main customers are women. They purchase these products on credit, and then make their payments in two or three installments every two weeks. Most of her time is spent gathering orders from her customers, while at other times, she has to travel to the capital to obtain merchandise. Marlenis is the beneficiary of two previous Kiva loans that were repaid in a timely manner.

Due to the nature of her business, she needs capital to acquire her merchandise with cash and still issue credit to her customers. This is the reason why she is requesting a loan. Marlenis will use the proceeds to acquire gold plated products that are higher in demand during this time of year.

The items she plans to purchase are as follows:

• 10 pairs of gold earrings @ $8 USD/pair • 8 gold bracelets @ $20 USD/each • 8 gold rings @ $15 USD/each • 8 gold chains @ $30 USD/each

(Click HERE and HERE to view the previous loans.)

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase gold plated jewelry to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadores Group

texts.en:
Claribel is the coordinator of the group Mujeres Luchadores (Fighting Women) and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients. 
Her group is located in a rural area surrounding the city of Imbert, nestled in between mountains with a river running through it. Despite the picturesque location, subsistence farming dominates the economy. Running water (not potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home in a simple structure with her long term partner and their two children ages nine and five. 
Claribel is excited to be taking a fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans without incident. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling cleaning products like dish washing soap, laundry detergent and tile cleaner. She says that in the past her loans with Esperanza have helped her business and she expects to continue her success. 
Claribel will use the profits from this loan to continue investing in her business. She is saving to buy her own home. Claribel thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Dish Soap, Tile Cleaner, Detergent

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Yaguarón, Bº San José a 15 Kms. de la Oficina de Paraguarí, se reunieron un grupo de mujeres con el objetivo de conformar un comité y de esa manera acceder al préstamo, de ahí que coordinamos la reunión para mayor información sobre el programa, quienes aceptaron por los múltiples beneficios ofrecidos.
El comité lleva por nombre Divino Niño Jesús, actualmente se encuentran en el segundo ciclo con calificación excelente integrada por 16  sacrificadas señoras, quienes ponen el mayor de sus esfuerzos para mejorar la calidad de vida de ellas y de sus respectivas familias. Todas las integrantes son mujeres muy luchadoras, quienes han invertido sus préstamos en sus respectivas actividades.
La historia de cada una de estas mujeres es muy conmovedora ya que cada una lucha por su familia por su bienestar y educación anhelando una vida mejor para ellos.
Una de ellas Doña Patricia M. dueña de una despensa, su lugar de trabajo en donde tiene todos los productos de uso domestico comestible, articulos de limpieza y algunas manualidas hechas por sus hijas también estas a la venta. Ella con su buen humor y sus buenos precios.

texts.en:
In the city of Yaguarón, in the San José neighborhood 15 kms from the Oficina de Paraguarí, there is a group of women who got together with the goal of forming a committee and getting access to capital. We offered them more information about the program and they accepted because of the multiple benefits offered. The committee is called Divino Niño Jesús (Divine Baby Jesus) and is currently in its second loan cycle. The groups receives a high score for its self-sacrificing 16 female member who put their efforts towards improving their own quality of life and that of their families. All of the members are hard workers and have invested the loans in their respective activities. The life story of each of these women is very moving as each has struggled for their families' well-being and education, hoping for a better life. One of them is Doña Patricia M. who owns a grocery store where she has all kinds of edible goods, cleaning items and some crafts made by her daughters. She has a great sense of humor and good prices. 1 Bernardina C. - Sale of coal 2 Mirna Martínez - Sale of beverages 3 Evany T. Employee 4 Magdalena Sánchez Employee 5 Teodolina I. Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Their loans have been invested in the respective activities of each member

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.fr: Z. Marguerite est née en 1959 et est mariée à NOUVETONOU Denis. Le couple a 8 enfants à charge, dont six sont leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et vivent ensemble avec leurs parents au quartier Zogbo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Marguerite n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a environs 10 ans que Marguerite mène comme activité, la vente de tissus, de façon ambulante et au marché Vèdoko à Cotonou. Cette activité procure à Marguerite des revenus qu’elle utilise pour la développer davantage et pour subvenir à ses besoins.  Marguerite s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Marguerite a obtenu déjà deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. La clientèle de Marguerite s’accroît au jour le jour ; mais Marguerite n’arrive pas à la satisfaire parce que les moyens financiers dont elle dispose sont faibles. Marguerite sollicite donc un troisième crédit pour renforcer son activité et mieux satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
Marguerite Z. was born in 1959 and is married to Denis Nouvetonou. The couple cares for eight children, six of whom are their own. All of the children attend school and live together with their parents in the Zogbo quarter in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. The couple shares the family responsibilities. Marguerite did not attend school. For about 10 years Marguerite has been in the business of selling fabric, as a traveling vendor and at the Vedoko market in Cotonou. This work brings income which she uses to develop her business further and to meet her daily needs. Marguerite secures her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market in Bénin. Marguerite has already received two loans through the ALIDé, loans which she has repaid. Marguerite's clientele is getting bigger every day, but she is not able to satisfy demand because her financial means are limited. Marguerite is requesting, therefore, a third loan to build up her business and to better satisfy the demands of her clients.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric

loans.name: Chhim

texts.en: Mr. C. is 35 years of age and currently lives with his wife in a wooden house in a village in Kompong Tom province. C. owns a rice milling machine and provides a rice milling service in the village. He and his wife have also built a small stall where they breed many pigs which they sell when mature. C. always uses the leftovers from his rice milling to feed his pigs. C. requests a loan to purchase parts to replace the broken part of his house. (Mr. C. was not available when the photo taken so his wife is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To purchase parts to repair his house

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita N. is from Pagadian City. She is 43 years old. Elenita is single. To make a living, Elenita owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Elenita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elenita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elenita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Elenita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Elenita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: In God We Trust Group

texts.en:
Tenneh G. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called In God We Trust. She is 30 years old, single, and has two children who are 5 and 7 years old. She was only able to attend school through high school.

For five years, Tenneh has been selling dry fish and palm oil in the Stephen Tolbert Estate on the Somalia drive in Paynesville. She sells good products and has a friendly manner which keeps customers returning.

She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this group loan to buy more fish and oil.  Her goal is to grow her business to a shop and to live a better life.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Tenneh is holding a sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution, with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more fish and oil.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson is 26 years old and married with two children who go to school. He runs a retail shop where he sells general merchandise such as rice, sugar, cooking fat and soaps.  He has been in this business for ten years.  He also rents out residential houses to earn a living.  He was previously employed in the transport industry as a driver before he went into business.   Previously, he had taken a loan of Kes 30,000, which he used to expand his business and successfully paid. He has requested a loan of Kes 60,000 to buy sugar, rice, baking powder and maize flour to sell.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice, baking powder and maize flour

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia M. D. C. D. 42 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo quien se dedica a trabajar y junto a sus dos hijas menores D. edad. Antonia posee un comedor en el cual elabora desayunos y almuerzos, así mismo hace pupusas y frescos D. frutas. Su negocio esta ubicado frente a el Instituto San Luis, ubicado en la ciudad D. Soyapango, cuyos alumnos son sus clientes más frecuentas, así posee muchos clientes los cuales son habitantes del lugar. Antonia solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar todo lo necesario como verduras, frutas, carne y platos desechables, todo lo que le sea útil para la elaboración y venta D. alimentos. Este negocio es muy importante para ella, ya que es el que le permite pagar muchos D. los gastos familiares, D. manera que pueda ayudarle a su esposo.
texts.en:
Antonia M. D. C. is 42 years old and resides in the town of Soyapango, located in the Department of San Salvador. She lives with her husband, who is devoted to his work, and their two young daughters. Antonia has a diner where she prepares breakfasts and lunches. At the same time, she makes pupusas and serves fresh fruit. Her business is located in front of the San Luis Institute in the city of Soyapango. The students are frequent customers, as well as the local residents.

Antonia is requesting a loan in order to buy the necessary supplies for her business such as vegetables, fruit, meat, and disposable plates. All of these items are useful in preparing and selling food. This business is very important because it allows her to pay most of the family expenses, which is a great help to her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for food preparation

loans.name: Bader

texts.en:
Bader is a 22-year-old single man living with his parents. In 2007, he started working on air conditioning and ventilation projects in Lebanon. He cooperates with his father and brothers to satisfy the heavy family demands.

Bader is satisfied with his new business and he's pleased with the idea of creating such a business, especially after seeing a need for such services in the region. 

Today, Bader is asking for $1,200 to purchase new tools for his business and to repair the equipment he uses for his work.

loans.use: To purchase new tools and to repair existing equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Products like noni and natural oils

loans.name: Tweyambe Women's, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
B. Matia, aged 35, with a family of six children, operates a retail shop in Kyarutanga trading centre. There he trades in a variety of products commonly bought for domestic use.

Matia’s main drawback is that he has a limited variety of products in his shop that cannot satisfy his customers’ demand. Therefore, he is looking forward to increasing the stock in his business when he gets this loan and also to expanding into a wholesale shop in future. This will help him earn more revenue and sustain his daily-living needs.

Matia belongs to a group of members who insure each other in paying back the loan. They are on their 17th loan. Matia is standing in the back row raising his hand as group leader. The ones squatting with hands raised are also executive members of the group but were not interviewed.

loans.use: To buy more stock for his shop

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo K., 30, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for its pre-Angkorean temples. She is employed as a garment factory worker for an income of about USD 3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 3 per day.

K. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to repair her house. In the future, she would like her husband to be a construction foreman for small or medium projects. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Marie D. est une fille de 32 ans qui habite a la cite des forces armées une des cites environnantes de la banlieue de Dalifort. Elle est membre de la caisse depuis 4 ans et a déjà rembourse 2 prêts  antérieurs. C’est une fille qui aime elle-même gagner sa vie raison pour laquelle depuis 3 ans elle s’active dans le secteur du petit  commerce et de la petite restauration. C’est une vendeuse  ambulante de fruits qui commercialise oranges, bananes, pommes, qu’elle se procure au marche Sandaga. En ce qui concerne la petite restauration  c’est une activité  qu’elle a hérité  de sa petite  sœur. Elle a récupéré  sa place et y   vend le déjeuner. Son souhait est de toujours développer son commerce et c’est la raison pour laquelle elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs destine a l’achat d’un réfrigérateur  ou elle pourra conserver  au frais les restants de fruits. Ce sera aussi l’occasion pour elle de s’adonner a la préparation de thiakry  qu’elle pourra vendre le soir. Pour mademoiselle D. l’accroissement de ses bénéfices  lui permet de renforcer son épargne, de mieux respecter ses engagements vis-à-vis des tontines, et aussi d’acquérir  des bijoux en or.
texts.en:
Miss Marie D. is 32 years old and lives in the housing development of the armed forces, one of the housing developments in the suburb of Dalifort. She has been a member of the credit union for 4 years and has already repaid 2 previous loans. She is the type of girl who likes to earn a living for herself, which is why she has spent the past 3 years running her own food stall and working in a food outlet. She is a mobile fruit vendor who sells oranges, bananas and apples that she procures from the Sandaga market. She also works in a food outlet, where she took over from her younger sister selling lunches. Her wish is to continue developing her business. She is therefore requesting a loan of 200 000 frs to buy a fridge in order to store her left over fruit and keep it fresh. It will also give her the opportunity to devote her time to preparing Thiakry (sweetened snack/dessert made from grain and fermented milk) which she will be able to sell in the evening. For Miss D., the growth of her profits will allow her to improve her savings, to better respect her commitments in regard to the tontines, and also to acquire gold jewellery.

Translated from French by Kate Bennett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: investissement

loans.name: Bendiya 2 Group

texts.fr:
Bendiya 2 est constitué de 10 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45  ans et  2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles polygames à Kegne, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont l’arachide,   le petit mil et le maïs. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, DJENEBOU C. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1,3 hectare d’arachide.
La production est vendue au niveau de la ville de Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 52000FCFA environs en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
"Bendiya 2" is composed of ten married women who average 45 years of age and two children living in polygamous families in Kegne, a village in Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their businesses at the start of winter.  The crops include peanuts, pearl millet, and corn.   The group members are on their fifth farm loan, and all the previous loans have been repaid.  With this new loan, Ms. Djenebou C. intends to buy supplies (ahead of price increases) and sundry equipment and to cover the cost of labor for maintaining about 1.3 hectares of peanuts.  After harvesting, the produce is sold in Dioïla City to a customer base composed of women and men. Djenebou plans on making a profit of about 52,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting season.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paying for plowing, seeds, manure, herbicide, weeding, and sundry equipment

loans.name: Mr. Chhiek Tien Village Bank Group

texts.en: Eleven people are requesting this village bank loan and they are all villagers I. Tuek Thla village, Takeo province. Mr. Chhiek T. is the village bank president. He is 38 years old and was selected by the other members who will use their portions of the loan for different ways to support their businesses. He is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land where he cultivates rice to sell I. order to support his family. He is also a string maker and his wife, Mrs. Chet Heng, is a seamstress I. a garment factor. They try to work a lot but they still can only earn a little money to support their family. So to improve his family's living, Mr. Chhiek T. is requesting a loan to buy some chicken and piglets for breeding to start a new business. He is a father of two children, both of whom are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy some chicken and piglets for breeding to start a new business

loans.name: Marceline

texts.en:
Marceline is 29 years old.  She is a mother of four children who are 3, 5, 8 and 9 years old.  Three of her children are in school while the youngest is not yet in school.  Her husband buys and sells goods. 

Marceline owns a bar and she has been in this business for 5 years.  She needs a loan to buy more bottles of alcohol to stock her bar. With the profits, she looks forward to renovating her house, paying her children’s school fees, and saving some money.

loans.use: Buying more alcohol for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine, different kinds and colors of thread, large and small sizes of scissors, etc,

loans.name: Mely Daisy

texts.en:
Mely Daisy N. is from the village of Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Mely Daisy owns and operates a business operating tricycle transport services. Mely Daisy has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2007, Mely Daisy joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used as additional capital for her business. Mely Daisy is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be her sixth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Chagnaadorj

texts.en:
Chagnaadorj J. is 43 years old and lives with his wife and four children in  Mongolia's capital city, Ulaanbaatar. He and his family live together in a traditional Mongolian tent home called a 'ger'. His oldest daughter is a student and the other three children all attend local middle school. 

Chagnaadorj produces wooden saddles and his wife sells those items in a stall at Narantuul, the largest and main market of Ulaanbaatar. He has been operating a wooden saddle making business since 2006 and has built up a stable and successful operation. In addition, he operates a taxi service using his own car to supplement his earnings. He says, “I want to expand my businesses and provide a good education for my children." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more wood materials for his saddle-making business.

loans.use: To purchase more wooden materials

loans.name: Fareed

texts.en:
Fareed is a young man from Bethlehem. He borrowed money from friends to buy a taxi car three years ago and has worked as a taxi driver since then. The returns of the taxi are very good. 

Fareed took a $3,000 loan because his car broke and needed maintenance. He couldn't work for months and couldn't repay his friends, so he came to FATEN to fix the car and be able to repay his friends.

Fareed is a hard-working young man trying to distinguish himself with punctuality and good driving. Fareed appears here next to his car

loans.use: To pay off his car loan repayment

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela R. is 48 years old, married, and supports her family by operating one business venture: Cycle Parts Trading business.  She lives in Purok Bulahan, Brgy. Media, Argo, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.

 By working hard in her Cycle Parts Trading business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 30,000. Angela is now borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can continue to fund the operations of her spare parts business.  This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom .Angela aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund the operations of bicycle spare parts sales

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: M. Moses is a hardworking man and a salary earner from Kihihi. Moses is seeking a loan to be able to pay school dues for his children who are still in school, and he will be using his salary to clear the loan. He is married with 5 children, of whom two are still in school and the rest are managing their own lives. For the times that he has taken out a loan, he has been able to improve his home and he is so happy about it.

loans.use: School dues for his children.

loans.name: Fatima Maribel

texts.es:
Fatima Maribel V. A. tiene 23 años. Vive en Unión Libre  vive con el compañero y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.
 
Los miembros de la V.R.C. El LA UNION se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Aguas Frías, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Fatima se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 5 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es dar la educación a los hijos.
Le gusta salir a pasear todos los domingos con la familia.
texts.en:
Fatima Maribel V. A. is 23 years of age.  She lives in Unión Libre with her companion and children.  They live in the Ventanas canton in the Province of Los Ríos. She has 2 children.
 
The members of the V.R.C. El LA UNION are found in the Aguas Frías region, belonging to the Ventanas canton.  This branch is dedicated to agricultural workers who grow crops with a short growing cycle such as corn, rice and beans.  This activity requires a great deal of time.

Fatima has been dedicated to agriculture especially to the sowing of corn, rice and beans for 5 years.  She buys her products in Ventanas and sells them in the Ventanas market and in the same precinct.  

She requests the loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers for the cultivations.  The support of the loan would help her economically to supply her needs.  She faces challenges such as plagues and illnesses and the changes in the climate.  Her dream is to give an education to her children.  She likes to go for a walk on Sundays with the family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers for the cultivations

loans.name: Mujeres Dinamicas Group

texts.es:
Este comité Mujeres Dinámicas es un comité  que está  en el segundo ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres de la Fundación Paraguaya cuenta con 12 integrantes. 
Una de las integrantes y de quien se puede hablar es la Sra. Licia quien posee un pequeño puesto de venta de frutas al costado de la calle de su comunidad, ella va al mercado de abasto a comprar las frutas que posteriormente vende y en ese lugar es más barato que los otros. 
Ella vende además jugos naturales, tiene clientela formadas con el ingreso que ella obtiene día a día ayuda al marido. Ingreso en el comite con la idea de ampliar su pequeño negocio.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de frutas como manzana, naranjas, melones, sandias, piñas y otros.
Es un comité donde las integrantes tienen  muchas ganas de superarse.
texts.en:
The 'Mujeres Dinámicas' (Dynamic Women) committee is in its second loan cycle as part of Fundación Paraguaya's Women's Committee Program.  The group has 12 members.

One of the committee's members, who we will talk about here, is Luisa Arhens.  She owns a small street stall where she sells fruit in her community.  She goes to the market to buy her fruit which she then sells.  It is cheaper here than in other places.  She also sells natural juices.  She has regular customers and she uses her profits to help her husband.  She joined the committee so that she could expand her small business.  She is requesting her loan to buy fruit such as apples, oranges, melons, watermelons, pineapples, etc.

All of the members of this committee have a great desire to improve themselves.

loans.use: To buy fruit

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna K. is an experienced accountant. While preparing accounting reports for her market trader clients, she realized owning a business can be profitable, and she started her own business. In one year, Susanna doubled her working capital by reinvesting the profit into the business. Susanna’s family members are all hard-working and highly motivated people.
Susanna has applied for this loan to increase the working capital which will allow her to have quick pre-holiday sales and fast loan repayment.

loans.use: Increasing working capital

loans.name: Matthew Okemwa

texts.en:
Matthew Okemwa M. is 42 years old, married and a father of three children, he lives in Mitume, in Kitale town. He operates a motorcycle transport as his primary business and also runs a shop where he sells things like sugar, flour, and rice. 

He has been in this business for one year now and he gets a monthly income of 12,000 shillings. Matthew has never borrowed from any other MFI. This will be his second loan from KADET LTD, which he plans to use to buy petroleum for his motor bike for 1,800 KES, five bags of sugar for 15,400 KES, two bundles of flour for 2,800 KES, and two bags of rice for 5,000 KES.

With the income he is going to get he plans to add more stock to his shop. In the future, Matthew would like to own a wholesale shop, educate his children and also create employment for the jobless.

loans.use: To buy petroleum for his motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan is used to buy additional clothes

loans.name: Erika Yanira

texts.es:
La señora Erika, es socia del banco comunal Vecinas Unidas, del Distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y tiene un solo hijo.
Lleva recién muy poco tiempo trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica a la venta de comida típica de la zona y le está yendo bien porque trabaja solo con pedidos y lo realiza todo en su casa, para su esposo es una gran ayuda porque es una entrada más de dinero a casa.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/.1,100.00 nuevos soles comprara: 2 cientos de platos descartables, 2 cientos de tenedores descartables, 1 paquete de servilletas, y  1 paquete de bolsa grande.
Estos son las cosas que le faltaban para poder dar mejor atención a sus clientes, seguirá trabajando para mejorar cada día su negocio y también  seguir siendo el apoyo de su pareja.
La señora Erika agradece a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo económico.
texts.en:
Erika is a member of the “Vecinas Unidas” (United Neighbors) communal bank in Callería district, Ucayali department.  She is 32 years old, married and has just one child.  She has only been working with Manuela Ramos loans for a short period of time.

She sells typical dishes from the area and is doing quite well because she works exclusively order based and does all the work at home.  This extra source of income is of great help to her husband.

She will use the new, 1100 new sol, loan to buy: 200 disposable plates, 200 disposable forks, 1 package of napkins and one package of large bags.  These are the items still needed to provide better customer service.  She will continue to work to improve her business every day and also to continue being a support for her spouse.

Erika thanks Manuela Ramos for the economic support.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her food preparation business.

loans.name: Morena

texts.en:
Morena A. is from the village of Barangay 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 34 years old. Morena is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Morena owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as canned goods, snack foods & beverages in the local community. Morena has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Morena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Morena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Morena is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Morena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
Erika, de 33 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo Oscar (32), quien se desempeña como obrero, y sus 3 pequeños hijos; juntos buscan progresar cada día. 

Desde hace cuatro años esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la fabricación de distintos accesorios de bijouteria, hechos a mano con diversa pedrería de colores. Esta muy satisfecha pues como trabaja para una intermediaria mayorista obtiene regulares ganancias de acuerdo al número de accesorios terminados por semana. Además realiza el trabajo con tranquilidad durante las tardes  y con la ayuda de sus hijas, esto le permite avanzar para entregar mayor cantidad de collares, pulseras y aretes de colores. Dice que este trabajo le permite cuidar a su pequeño que recién tiene 6 meses sin problemas y de esta manera puede ayudar a su esposo en los constantes gastos del hogar. Como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado retomar su negocio de venta de comidas que tenía antes que alumbre a su último hijo, pues quiere progresar. 

Erika tiene planeado invertir el dinero en la compra de pedrería de colores que necesita para continuar con su labor, pues quiere mejorar la cantidad de accesorios para obtener más ganancias. 

Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca  del progreso.
texts.en:
Erika, who is 33 years old, lives with her husband Oscar, who is 32, and their three little children. They live in their own house, and Oscar works as a laborer. Together they try to make progress every day.

Four years ago this enterprising woman began to create different costume jewelry accessories, which she makes by hand using different colored stones. She is very satisfied since she works through an intermediate wholesaler and she obtains regular earnings according to the number of accessories completed each week. In addition, she performs the work peacefully during the afternoons with the help of her daughters. This allows her to get ahead and to turn over a greater quantity of colored necklaces, bracelets, and earrings. She says that this work allows her to take care of her little son, who recently turned six months old, without any problems and this way she can help her husband with the steady household expenses. As she is an enterprising woman, in the future she plans to restart her business selling food, which she had before she gave birth to her last child, since she wants to make progress.

Erika plans to invest the money from the loan in the purchase of colored stones that she needs to continue with her work, since she wants to increase the quantity of accessories she makes to obtain greater earnings.

This is her second loan with MFP, and she promises to make her payments punctually, since she doesn't want to give a bad impression to the people who make possible the loan that will permit her to continue working in search of progress.

loans.use: Buy colored stones

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace N. is a sole proprietor business lady, who runs a restaurant in Karen; Nairobi. She has been in this business for one year, and earns an income of KES. 40,000 per month. She is 49 years old, single and a mother one child who is six years old.    


She has never borrowed from any other MFI, and she learned about KADET LTD through a friend. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD. She intends to use the entire loan amount to improve the interior decor of the restaurant by buying modern furniture.            


Grace intends to use the anticipated profit to save and to grow the business to a capital base of one million in the next five years.

loans.use: to buy modern furniture for her restaurant.

loans.name: Yunusjon

texts.en:
Yunusjon A. is 35 years old. He has a successful business selling flour at the local market in the Zafarabad region. Yunusjon sells an assortment of good quality flour of different sorts. Because he buys his goods at wholesale, the prices are cheaper than the prices of his competitors. Thus he even has many customers who  make a purchase of his products straight from his house. 

Now he has a great demand for his goods and that is why he would like an individual loan of $2000 USD to add to his working capital and allow him to purchase more inventory.  He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.     
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase flour to increase his stock

loans.name: Colores Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra en su tercer ciclo, es de la ciudad de Asuncion, de un barrio muy humilde de la ciudad capitalina.
La Sra. Gladys C. tiene dos hijos, es vendedora ambulante de empanadas, sale por la mañana a hacer sus ventas en la zona de Tacumbu (zona peligrosa, cercana a la cárcel principal del Paraguay) y vuelve a su casa por la tarde.
Es una señora valiente porque recorre zonas peligrosas en su trabajo porque allí hay muchas ventas ya que nadie se anima a ir por esos lugares tan fácilmente, y todo lo hace para salir adelante con sus hijos ya que es madre soltera.
Tiene una casita pequeña pero propia, desea poder ampliarla con el tiempo y que sus hijos terminen bien el colegio, por eso solicita el crédito para poder comprar todo lo que necesita para prepara mayor cantidad de empanadas como discos de empanadas, carnes, verduras, queso, choclo, etc.
Todas las mujeres de este grupo esperan contar con el apoyo de los inversionistas de Kiva.
texts.en:
This committee is beginning its third loan cycle. Its members live in a humble neighborhood in the capital city of Asuncion city.

Gladys C. has two children. She sells empanadas from a street cart and works in Tacumbu zone (a dangerous neighborhood near the most prominent prison in Paraguay) from morning until the afternoon, when she returns to her home.

She is brave to work in such a dangerous area, but the sales are good since not many food vendors venture there. As a single mother, Gladys is willing to work there so that she can provide for her children. She owns a small house, which she hopes to expand over time. She also wishes to see her children graduate high school. Gladys is requesting a loan to buy ingredients she needs to prepare a greater quantity of empanadas, such as prepared empanada dough, meat, vegetables, cheese, maize, etc. 

All the women in this group hope to receive support from Kiva investors.

loans.use: To purchase empanada dough, meat, vegetables, cheese, maize, etc.

loans.name: Suipacha Group

texts.es: El Banco D. Emprendimiento SUIPACHA es un banco que ya está en su quinto ciclo y el Banco está conformado por 8 Integrantes 6 Mujeres y 2 Varones y las señoras se dedican al comercio y venta ropas y otros, y la Sra. MERCEDES es la presidenta del Banco y  tiene cuatro hijos 	que se encuentran estudiando, ella se dedica a la venta D. víveres, abarrotes a crédito, compra por cantidad y después entrega a crédito los productos cobrando semanalmente o quincenal  y con el préstamo comprara mercadería por cantidad en abarrotes como fideos, azúcar, arroz, etc. y D. esta manera incrementar su  capital D. trabajo, es un apersona muy trabajadora agradecida por la oportunidad que se le brindo, todas las socias se conocen entre ellas y muchas D. ellas mantienen solas sus hogares y están agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The community bank SUIPACHA is a bank that is already in its fifth cycle. The bank is maD. up of 8 members, 6 women and 2 men. The women are merchants who sell clothes and other things. MERCEDES is the bank president and she has four children who are in school. She sells groceries on credit. She buys wholesale and later sells on credit, collecting weekly or bi-weekly. With the loan, she will buy grocery merchandise wholesale such as pasta, sugar, rice, etc. In this way, she will increase her working capital. She is a hardworking person who is grateful for the opportunity offered her. All of the members know each other and a lot of them are the sole breadwinners in their families. They are grateful to the institution for the support it has offered.

loans.use: to buy grocery merchandise wholesale such as pasta, sugar, rice, etc.

loans.name: Getsemani Group

texts.es:
Doña Rosa Graciela es casada, tiene 44 años D. edad, cursó los 6 años D. educación primaria, tiene 2 hijos y uno D. los cuales esta estudiando,se dedica a la sastrería, la confección D. tejidos, específicamente la confección D. delantales típicos, lleva 20 años D. experiencia en este trabajo, inició este oficio como operaria, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien también se dedica al mismo oficio.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo, la cual será invertida para la compra D. telas típicas para la elaboración D. delantales típicos, las otras integrantes del grupo se dedican a diversas actividades productivas las cuales son: tejeduría y crianza D. animales. Esperan ver su negocio con utilidades y capital disponible.
texts.en:
Doña Rosa Graciela is 44 years old and married.  She has completed 6 years of primary education and has 2 children, one of whom is studying.  She is dedicated to tailoring and weaving, specifically the production of typical aprons.  With 20 years of experience in this work, she started this job as a machinist and has the support of her husband who also works at the same office.

She organizes a group that is requesting a loan.  The loan will be invested to buy traditional fabrics for the production of typical aprons.  The other team members engage in various productive activities such as: weaving and animal husbandry. They hope to see business profits and available capital.

loans.use: buy fabric for aprons.

loans.name: Santos Joel

texts.es:
Santos tiene 28  años de edad, el es casado, tiene  02 hijos menores de edad, cuenta con casa propia la cuala está ubicada en el caserío Valle Nuevo en el distrito de Mochumi a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Santos se dedica a la  comercialización de animales menores, en variedad como aves gallinas, pavos, patos, los cuales cría en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, este negocio lo desarrolla en el Mercado central o en  los distintos caseríos cercanos a Mochumi.  Esta actividad la realiza desde hace mas de 6 años, en los que a adquirido experiencia en el rubro y clientela fija a su negocio.

Santos está solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles para el engorde de sus aves, con el préstamo comprara alimento para dichos animales además podrá adecuar corrales para tal fin.

Santos es una  persona emprendedora y responsable, el desea poder crecer como empresario y poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Santos is 28 years old. He is married and has 2 minor children. He has his own house which is located in the settlement of Valle Nuevo in the Mochumi district, 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Santos earns a living through the sale of a variety of small animals like hens, turkeys and ducks. He breeds them in pens situated in the back of his home. He is building up this business in the central market or in the various settlements near Mochumi. He has been engaged in this activity for six years during which time he has acquired experience in the area and loyal customers for his business.

Santos is requesting a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the fattening of his fowl. With this loan he will buy feed for said animals as well as be able to improve pens to that end. 

Santos is an enterprising and responsible person. He wants to be able to grow as an entrepreneur and be able to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animals and their respective feed.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a married woman with four children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a food cafe business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her products. Constance dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of rice, beans, cooking fat oil and charcoal. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice, beans, cooking fat oil and charcoal.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio’s San Benito, Texas-based stone memorial business, D. A. Monuments, is a uniquely community-oriented company. Virgilio prides himself in serving seniors in his Hispanic community by offering them reasonably priced, high quality products. His aim, he says, is to help these seniors provide respectable, well-crafted monuments for their loved ones that fit into their small and often fixed-income budgets.

Virgilio’s business, which he began 15 years ago, makes stone memorial monuments for cemeteries. The ideas to start his business came to him while working at a funeral home, during which time he started to create monuments for the customers there. When people began to comment on how much they liked his work and asked for more of his products, Virgilio opened the doors to D. A. Monuments.

Currently, he sells his products directly to members of the Hispanic community and has contracts with various cemeteries in his area. The business has grown enough in the past 15 years to support two full-time employees and two others who are on-call. However, even with these employees, the amount of sketching, measuring, and designing necessary to fill his monument orders was causing Virgilio to work ten to twelve hour days, including weekends. As a result, he decided to modernize his business, utilizing cutting-edge computer design equipment to save time and allow his business to take on more orders.

Virgilio used his loan to purchase a computer system called Monu-Cad, worth $15,000, which allows him to map out the design of his products on the computer. It dramatically cuts down on the amount of work he has to do; he says what used to take 24 hours can now be done in an hour and a half. His is the only business that offers that type of quick service in his town, and he is now able to produce and sell significantly more products.

In the future, Virgilio hopes to continue offering the affordable, reliable products for his community members along with gaining more large contracts with cemeteries. Since his loan freed up a lot of time that would otherwise be spent hand-designing his products, he believes that he can now truly begin growing into larger markets. 

His 15 years in business has led Virgilio to offer the following advice on frugality and fiscal responsibility to aspiring business-owners: “You can’t live a luxurious life because your business will claim it; you have to be cautious with your expenditures.” With this knowledge and his newly modernized workplace, Virgilio hopes to continue serving the monument needs of his customers and his community.

loans.use: to pay for computer software to design cemetary monuments

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: Mrs. Eng is a 37-year-old farmer who lives in Reussey Keo commune. Mrs. Eng is married to Mr. Khive, aged 45. This couple, who work together in the farming business, has four children: all of them are single, two are employed. Mrs. Eng also breeds pigs behind her house. The pig-raising business is a very profitable one so Mrs. Eng is seeking a loan of $600 to buy some piglets to raise for sale when pork is commanding the highest price.

loans.use: to buy some piglets to raise for sale.

loans.name: Blanca Marleny

texts.es: Blanca Marleny de treinta y cinco años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos en casa propia. Ella posee un negocio de venta de ropa de todo tipo: para damas, caballeros, niñas y niños; es muy conocida en la localidad pues vende de forma ambulante ropa de muy buena calidad y novedosa siempre a la vanguardia de la competencia, además tiene muy buen servicio y precios realmente accesibles. Blanca siempre está llena de energía con ganas de salir adelante con sus sueños para ella al pensar en grande  sus hechos crecerán es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa como faldas, vestidos, pantalones, camisas, blusas entre otros para dar continuidad a su negocio y ahora que esta en espera de otro miembro de su familia sus ganas de luchar para salir adelante han incrementado. Blanca Marleny se encuentra muy bien referenciada como sujeto de crédito, por eso tiene confianza que así lograra darle a su familia una vida plena con seguridad económica.
texts.en: Blanca Marleny, who is 35 years old, lives with her life partner and their two children in their own house. She has a business selling all types of clothing: for women, men, boys and girls. She is well known in her area since she sells as a walking vendor and her clothing is of good quality and in the latest fashion, always at the vanguard of the competition. Furthermore, she has very good service and prices that are actually accessible. Blance is always full of energy, with the will to advance with her dreams. For her, to think big means that her accomplishments will increase. For this reason, she decided to apply to INTEGRAL for a loan that will permit her to buy clothing such as skirts, dresses, pants, shirts, and blouses, among other items, to give continuity to her business, and now that she is expecting another member of her family, her will to strive to advance has grown. Blanca Marleny has very good references to be given credit, thus she has confidence that she will succeed in giving her family a life full of economic security.

loans.use: to buy skirts, dresses, pants, shirts, and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Juan Inocente

texts.es:
Juan  de 38 años de edad, es soltero, vive en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de San José que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad pesquera y turismo.

Desde hace unos años aproximadamente Juan se ha dedicado a la venta de abarrotes (todo tipo de productos que se utilizan diariamente como: leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos,otros) útiles de escritorio y bebidas, su negocio lo ha colocado en su misma casa para su seguridad, con las ganancias por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos personales.

Para poder  implementar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 500 nuevos soles para comprar más mercaderías, con el único ideal de que su negocio se amplie y tenga más productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes;  con el dinero que gane para cubrirá su préstamo y sus obligaciones de su casa.  Juan es una persona dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por tener más comodidades en su casa.
texts.en:
Juan, 38, is single and lives in a house that he owns.  The house has basic services: water and electricity.  Juan lives in San Jose, a district in Peru's "departamento" of Chiclayo.  Local people make their living from fishing and tourism.

Juan has owned a general store for several years.  He sells all kinds of grocery products--milk, rice, cooking oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, eggs, etc.--along with office and school supplies and cold drinks.  He operates the business in a room of his house, an arrangement that he considers more secure.  He tries to support himself with the income from the business.

Juan is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a 500 new soles loan that he will use to buy merchandise for the business.  He wants to grow the business by expanding the range of products he can sell to his customers.  He will repay the loan with the extra money that he expects to make.  Juan is committed to working hard so that he can make a better life for himself.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his general store.

loans.name: Bandi

texts.en:
Mr. Bandi is a clothes seller at shopping center called Bumbugur. He is 34 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been selling clothes for seven years and recently his current  business assets are not good enough. He wants to increase them, because it is absolutely important and beneficial for his business expansion. 

Bandi requested a loan to purchase a larger number of clothes than before for sale. He has a plan to buy a new apartment, if he can raise his income later.

loans.use: To purchase a larger number of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Ines

texts.en:
Ines started her own day care and currently watches over 12 children. For the past 11 years, she has been working directly with a federal agency which pays her for the food and supplies she needs to provide loving care for the children. After her recent inspection, Ines will be able to increase the capacity of her day care by 2 children. Ines has the help of one employee depending on the season. She hopes that someday she will be able to offer her services to more people and open a new day care.

Ines will use this loan to renovate the daycare and purchase more tables, chairs, and toys for the children.

loans.use: To purchase more furniture and educational toys for the day care.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Rebecca has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy fish to sell. Rebecca has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Rebecca hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Rina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doña Rina tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y madre de cinco hijos, junto a su familia reside en la colonia Rivas Montes en el municipio de Juticalpa y se dedica a la venta de abarroteria.

Desde hace 18 años atras doña Rina cuenta con una pulperia que le permite ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de su familia. Inició vendiendo solamente refrescos, charamuscas y chocobananos, y poco a poco con lo que le quedaba de sus ventas diarias. Su inversion inicial fue de 3,500 lempiras y ahora cuenta con un inventario de productos valorado en 50,000 lempiras. Ella atiende su pulperia sola y cuando sus hijos tienen tiempo libre le ayudan. 

Doña Rina solicita este prestamo para la compra de embutidos, lacteos, carnes, maseca, arroz, pastas, escobas, shampoos, acondicionadores, desodorantes, refrescos, jugos, verduras, entre otros productos. Con el apoyo de este prestamo su pulperia estará mejor surtida y sus clientes siempre encontraran lo que necesiten.

Su meta es tener un mini-mercadito y contratar a un empleado para que la ayude a atenderlo, y asi ella podra atender a su familia y en un futuro cercano tener otro negocio mas.

Este es su ciclo 8 en FAMA y por dos ocasiones ha sido premiada por ser una cliente puntual con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Doña Rina is 45 years old, married and the mother of 5 children. She lives with her family in Rivas Montes in the town of Juticalpa and she sells groceries.

For the last 18 years Doña Rina has had a store which allows her to help her husband support the family. She started off selling soft drinks, frozen fruit drinks and banana icecreams and little by little with what was left over from her daily sales she expanded. Her initial investment was 3,500 lempiras (HNL). She now has an inventory of products valued at 50,000 lempiras (HNL). She takes care of her store alone and when her children have free time they help her out.

Doña Rina is asking for this loan to buy cold meats, milk products, meat, maseca (instant corn dough), rice, noodles, brushes, shampoos, conditioners, deoderants, soft drinks, fruit juices, vegetables and other products. With the help of this loan, her store will be better stocked and her customers will always find what they need.

Her goal is to have a mini-mart and hire an employee to help her serve the customers. In this way she will be able to take care of her family and in the near future have another business.

This is her 8th loan cycle with FAMA and she has twice been awarded for being on time with her repayments.

loans.use: to buy groceries in general.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 9 children.
