Perla is providing motorela or habal-habal services. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 13,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.

Perla has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Perla hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina D. 58 años, convive con Adrián D. 59 años, y fruto D. este amor nació Joel su único hijo. Juntos habitan en su casa propia en el distrito D. Pichari. A los 12 años, Marina ya conocía las labores agrícolas D. cómo preparar un terreno para realizar el sembrío, el manejo agronómico, L. cosecha e incluso podía ya realizar L. comercialización. Fue así que elL. en compñía D. sus padres cultivaba el cacao, café, plátano, ajonjolí y maní, pero con más intensificación al cultivo D. cacao y café, pues ambos productos tiene mucha demanda en el mercado nacional como en el exterior. Ahora continua con esta labor cultivando café, pues este año llegó a costar 10 soles el kilo, con este precio uno logra recuperar L. inversión. Es por esta razón, que desea expandir más su campo agrícoL. con plantaciones D. café. En las labores que realiza siempre cuenta con el apoyo D. su querido esposo quien le apoya en las labores más forzosas, Este será su  primer crédito con MFP, por lo que esta comprometida en cancelar puntualmente el pago D. sus cuotas. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más plántitas D.  café.
texts.en:
Marina, 58, lives with Adrian, 59; their loving union has produced Joel, their only child.  They all live together in their own house in the district of Pichari.  By the time she was 12, Marina already knew about farming, preparing the land for planting, agronomy, the harvest, and even sales.  That's how she and her parents grew cacao, coffee, bananas, sesame, and peanuts.  Mostly it was coffee and cacao, because both products are in high demand on the domestic market as well as internationally.  Marina still grows coffee, and this year the price hit 10 soles per kilo; at that price you can recoup your investment, so Marina wants to further expand her farm by planting more coffee.  She can always count on help from her beloved husband, who helps her out with whatever job needs to be done most.  

This will be Marina's first loan with MFP, so she is committed to making her payments on time.  She plans to use her loan of 1000 soles to buy more coffee plants.

loans.use: To buy coffee plants.

loans.name: Bienvinida

texts.en:
Bienvinida, a 41-year-old mother of seven school-age children, is married to Mr. Darion, who is a carpenter and a farmer. They live in the village of Guba, Clarin Misamis Occidental.

Bienvinida has been planting and harvesting corn for sale for about 11 years and earns approximately PHP 7,600 every cropping. A member of GDMPC, she is requesting her first loan of Php 5000 to purchase fertilizers for her cornfield. The extra profits arising from the loan will go toward the education of her children. She hopes that her business will remain successful.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora is single. She has sold kernel oil at Eguafo for the past 3 years. Nora uses her income to take care of herself. She will use the loan to purchase kernel nuts in sacks. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nora plans to further her education.

loans.use: purchase kernel nuts

loans.name: Mwashamba

texts.en:
Mwashamba is a 31-year-old married woman with three children. Two of the children attend school and one is too young. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of basic family needs. Mwashamba lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Mwashamba has operated a retail shop for the past two years, with her neighbors as her customers. With the loan of KES 40,000 she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice and cereals for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance to expand her business, which is her dream.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of sugar, rice and cereals for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 28, is married and lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years she has operated a tailoring business; her potential customers are neighbors and passers by. She dreams of establishing new shops in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 loan she wants to purchase clothes materials for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes materials for resale.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбуба проживает в районе Пяндж. Ей 40 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Она более шести лет занимается скотоводством. Махбуба разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Кредит берет для закупа мелко - рогатого скота.
texts.en: Mahbuba lives in the Pyandj district.  She is 40 years old, married and has four children.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for over six years.  Mahbuba breeds cattle at home.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of small livestock.

loans.use: to purchase small livestock

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en: Rosana, 42, is married and a mother of four children. She lives in Poblacion 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Rosana used her last loan to purchase expensive fish to sell. Her business is successful, and she is taking a new loan which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She is running her other business venture particularly in the retail sector. In the future she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is married father of four children living in Hioma,Uganda. He owns a retail shop and has been running it for quite a long time. He faces the challenges of inadequate capital and price fluctuations. Simon hopes to educate his children and build a permanent house while his business plan is to expand to new markets. 
Simon will use his loan to purchase general merchandise such as soap, sugar and cooking oil to .Instead of a still photo the officer in charge took a video.

loans.use: to purchase general merchandise such as soap, sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 38-year-old single man with 3 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a motorcycle transport business and also earns a salary from ushering in a hotel. He faces hardships in the poor road network and high fuel prices, affecting the profit margin of his motorcycle business.   

However much this is a hindrance to his growth, Moses is still looking forward to having a good house. Moses needs a loan to buy a solar system for lighting his home.

loans.use: buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Veronicah would like to buy new clothes and school  School uniform materials

loans.name: Koubahoin

texts.en:
At 36, Ms T. Koubahoin, never had the chance to go to school. Married to a farmer, she is the mother of seven children. To contribute to the payment of household expenses, she has began to produce palm oil, which has proven to be a great success. Because of good management of her activities, she has been able to pay back previous loans without any difficulties. Now, in order to increase her sales, Ms T. Koubahoin is asking for a loan of $550.00, to buy palm nuts and make them into oil. With this new loan, which is an important source of revenue, she hopes to better to living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Agée de 36 ans environs, Madame T. Koubahoin n’a pas eu la chance d’étudier. Mariée à un cultivateur, elle est mère de sept (07) enfants. Pour contribuer aux besoins du foyer, cette mère s’est lancée dans production de l’huile de palme qu’elle exerce avec un grand succès. Par la bonne gestion de ses activités, elle a remboursé ses antécédents crédits sans difficultés. Ainsi pour augmenter son chiffre d’affaires, Madame T. Koubahoin sollicite à présent un crédit de $550 pour assurer l’achat et la transformation de la noix de palme en huile. Avec ce nouveau crédit qui est source d’importants revenus, elle pense améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To purchase palm nuts to make into red oil.

loans.name: Araz

texts.en: Araz A. left the occupied Jebrail district of Azerbaijan in 1993 and fled to Baku. Araz is married, with one child. He started an auto repair business in 2000, and needs a loan of $1000 to buy new equipment for the shop.

loans.use: To buy modern equipment for his auto repair business

loans.name: Zaira

texts.en: Zaira is a dedicated entrepreneur who has faithfully run her little clothing sales kiosk for twelve years. Her business is located at the busy central market in Melitopol, Ukraine. She has gained much experience over the years she has been in business. She currently makes around $300 in profit each month which is valuable income for her and her husband, Uriy. She has requested a loan of $600 to help her purchase necessary inventory. She has been a great client with Nadiya Ukaine in the past. We are grateful for this opportunity to continue assisting her with her business.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Hard work has helped Margaret expand her business using the $1,150 loan that was financed by Kiva lenders (#5061). She is very grateful for the support. Margaret used the loan to start a book binding business which is doing well. She fully repaid the loan by 9th September 2007.

Being an enterprising woman, Margaret also rears chickens. She currently has 800 birds. She is looking at expanding her business to 1,200 birds. She would like to borrow $1200 to buy more chicks and expand the chicken housing units. She employs one person, but she will need to employ extra labor when the number of chickens increases. Her dependents also give an extra hand while taking their school holidays. She is very optimistic that the expansion of her businesses will enable her to send her children and dependents through school.

loans.use: Poultry

loans.name: Francia

texts.en:
Francia, 40 years old, is a very successful business woman. She started the grocery store fifteen years ago. Her husband is a taxi driver and is working in the capital. Her only-begotten daughter is fourteen and goes to public school in their home town.

In Francia’s grocery, people buy rice, salt, flour, oil, spices, milk, chocolate and other foodstuffs. Currently, supplies are running low in the store. Francia needs a loan in order to buy some sacks of rice, flour and wheat. She will also buy new items to introduce into the business so that she can better attend to her customers’ needs and attract new ones.

loans.use: To purchase some sacks of rice, flour and wheat which are running out in the grocery store. Also to introduce new items in the business so as to attract new customers.

loans.name: Neida Elizabeth

texts.es:
Six years ago, Neido became pregnant and she vowed to work with all her might so that her son might be happy and not be lacking in anything. With the help of her mother she started to make food to sell and slowly she and her food stand started to become known and her through her effort and dedication, and her success can be seen in the good work that she does. Today she has more clients and many have become regulars. But unfortunately her stand is too small.

Nedia requests a loan in the amount of $750 US to be repaid in a term of 6 months. With this loan Nedia will be able to purchase a new and bigger stove to be able to make more food in the same amount of time, and she will also purchase tables and chaires so that her clients can sit while Nedia makes their order. With your help Neida will be able to support her son and will be able to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva volunteer.

Hace 6 años, Neida se dio cuenta que estaba embarazada, y decidió luchar con todas sus fuerzas para que su hijo fuera feliz y no le falte nada. Con la ayuda de su mamá comenzó a hacer comidas para vender y poco a poco se fue haciendo conocida su comida puesto que el esfuerzo y la dedicación de salir adelante se ve reflejado en el buen trabajo que realiza. Actualmente ya tiene más clientes y muchos se han hecho constantes. Pero desgraciadamente el local sigue siendo muy pequeño.

Es por eso que Neida está solicitando un crédito de US $750 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Neida podrá comprar una parrilla más grande para hacer más comidas al mismo tiempo y mobiliario para que sus clientes se puedan sentar a esperar la comida que prepara Neida. Con tu ayuda Neida podrá sacar adelante a su hijo y podrá crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To furnish her business.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Señora María Z. has sold groceries like basic grains and cooking oil for 29 years. Her business is known for being very stable because at any given day or time, it is common to find her working.

She is married with two kids to care for, and they are the reason for her efforts and hard work. She has worked with CEPRODEL for a year, obtaining improvements to her business and also being able to support her two children, who are in school. It's important to point out that she has been loyal with the payments of her credits with CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Maria Z. desde hace 29 años se dedica a la venta de abarrotes tales como granos básicos y aceite. Su negocio se caracteriza por ser muy estable ya que en todo momento, a cualquier día y en cualquier hora es muy común encontrarla en sus labores.

Es casada y con dos hijos que mantener por lo que ellos son la razón de sus esfuerzos y labores. Desde hace un año ha trabajado con Ceprodel obteniendo mejoras en su negocio y además pudiendo mantener a sus dos hijos que se encuentran en la etapa de estudios. Es necesario destacar que ella ha sido fiel con el pago de estos créditos en Ceprodel.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries

loans.name: Mirembe Ii(C) Group

texts.en: Harriet is 26 years old and married with three children of ages 6, 3 and 1. Two fo the children go to school. Her husband has a small bakery. Harriet owns a beauty salon and wants to use the extra business profits to construc a house. She sees a business opportunity of opening up another salon in the city suburbs of Kampala. Rehema has a restaurant business and wants to buy more saucepans with the loan. Manjeri is a millet grainer. Porssy sells new clothes and intends to expand business with the loan. Regina sells charcoal for a living and wants to use the loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal.

loans.use: To purchase more salon equipment

loans.name: Loisith

texts.es:
Loisith is a member of the "Honesty and Work" communal bank and lives in Juanjui in the San Martín region of Peru. She set up her business on one of the main city streets, where she daily tends to her customers, who are locals or visitors from nearby.

Since she was very young she has had experience selling popular regional dishes door to door, before a relative encouraged her to start a business in a fixed location. So she set up the post where she currently works from the afternoon through the evening selling her various menu items and grilled chicken skewers, all of which she very tastily prepares. Her clientele seems to grow daily, which makes her feel satisfied.

With the $700 loan, which she plans to repay in six months, she will purchase the ingredients she needs to make her meals such as rice, sugar, beans and legumes, all kinds of vegetables, beef, chicken and pork, which will help her tend to customers. She will also buy some big pots for her business. A part of the money will be used to finish the roof on her home, as well.

Loisith is an enthusiastic 35-year-old with six children whom she wants to give a better future. Her goal is to set up a part in her home where she can install her business and thus be closer to them when she works.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Loisith es socia del banco comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. Desarrolla el negocio en una de las calles principales de la ciudad donde diariamente acuden su comensales, que son moradores de la propia localidad o transeúntes de lugares cercanos Desde muy joven tuvo experiencia en la venta casa por casa de juanes, humitas, relleno y otros preparados, por lo que motivado por un familiar decidió instalarse en un lugar fijo donde actualmente trabaja a partir de horas de la tarde hasta la media noche, vendiendo comida variada tipo menú y anticuchos de carne de pollo asados al carbón, preparados con muy buena sazón que hace que cada día su clientela aumente por lo que se siente muy satisfecha. Con el préstamo de S/ 2,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará los insumos para la preparación de los alimentos como, arroz, azúcar, menestras al por mayor, verduras en todas sus variedades por kilos, carnes de res, pollo, cerdo también en kilos, que le permitirá preparar comida variada para la atención a sus clientes e implementará el negocio con ollas grandes, además con una parte del capital terminará el techado de su casa. Loisith es una mujer entusiasta de 35 años, con 6 hijos a quienes quiere darles un futuro mejor, por lo que anhela acondicionar en su casa un ambiente donde instalar el negocio y así estar más cerca de ellos.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients such as rice, sugar, beans and legumes, beef, chicken, etc. / Compra de arroz, azúcar, menestras al por mayor, carne de res y pollo, etc

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
I have been running a small cake shop in my home for 2 years. I cannot complain because thank God everything has gone fine. I have several plans in mind, such as purchasing more ingredients and baking pans in order to prepare cakes of different sizes and flavors. Unfortunately, I do not have the capital to carry out my plans. I am requesting $800.00 USD in order to purchase cake ingredients and baking pans.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo una pequeña pastelería en mi casa desde hace 2 años no me puedo quejar gracias a dios me ha ido bien, tengo varios planes que me gustaría realizar como es la compra de más ingredientes y moldes para preparar pasteles diferentes y de distintos tamaños y sabores, pero no tengo el capital para hacerlo” Solicito $ 800.00 dlls para comprar ingredientes y moldes para la preparación de pasteles

loans.use: Invest in cake shop

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: I am Sajida Parween from Lahore, a big city in Pakistan. I was married four and a half years ago and live in a joint family system. My husband and I both dropped out of school after completing our secondary education. B., my husband, operates an electronics store where he sells items such as fridges, televisions, and irons etc. He started this shop five years ago and sells items at his shop on installments to people of lower class who cannot afford to buy on upfront payment. Our business generates decent profits for us but we need to further improve our income and therefore we are requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 950.

loans.use: Expand our electronic goods store

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita started her business to give her children a good start in life. Due to questions of fate, she had separated from her husband, and then had to provide for her children and cover the costs of their education. She began three years ago after being invited to a course in handicrafts and that’s how she began to enjoy this activity. She began to commercialize her products and has earned good profits since.

Margarita needs a US $600 loan, which she will pay back in six months, to buy material to make handbags, pencil cases, and other cloth goods. With your help, Margarita will improve her family’s situation.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva volunteer.

Margarita inició el negocio para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, ya que por cuestiones del destino se separo de su pareja, y despues de eso tenia que sacar adelante a sus hijos y poderles cubrir los gastos de estudio de ellos. Comenzó hace tres años cuando por invitacion de unas amigas acudio a un curso de manualidades y de ahí le surgio el gusto por esta actividad, por lo que empezo a comercializarlas y ha obtenido buenas ganancias por esto.

Ella necesita un credito por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para poder comprar material para hacer bolsas, cepilleros, portalapices, etc. Con tu ayuda Margarita sacara a su familia adelante.

loans.use: Invest in materials for her handicraft sales

loans.name: Kum

texts.en: Kum N., age 53 (pictured at her farmland), is a farmer and lives with her husband and they are farmers who earn around $2 each day. They grow rice and bananas. This couple has five children, two of whom are married and live away from home; and another child is employed in a garment factory. Kum wants a loan to purchase good rice seed to grow for next year.

loans.use: Kim would like to purchase good rice seed to grow for next year.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine I.  is an orphan. Almost all of her family was killed in 1994, during the genocide.

She began  selling boiled  eggs with 2000 Rwf (less than US$ 4) as capital. When she reached 50,000 Rwf (about US$ 90),
she joined Nyabugogo market and is now selling dresses.
Ms. I.  has three  children  in charge,  one in secondary school and two in primary school.

loans.use: Increase her business capital

loans.name: Ou

texts.en:
Mrs. Ou S. is a 52-year-old widowed farmer who cultivates twice a year in Khsang Thbong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province.  She has four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another one is a primary school teacher who can make $30 per month to support the family. The remaining one is attending school. 

Even though the family members are gainfully employed, their lives do not improve and they live in an old house. Thus, Mrs. Ou S. is requesting a loan to add to her savings to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: To add to her savings to build a new house for her family

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel A., married with four children, has been selling groceries including sugar, rice, biscuits, and soap in Braman in Cape Coast since 2002. His wife is a trader. Samuel is responsible for paying his children's school fees and the utility bills.

He is requesting a loan in order to purchase more groceries for sale to meet the demands of his ever-increasing customer base. Samuel hopes to use the new profits to reinvest in his business, thereby eventually increasing his income.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Eva Yaneth

texts.es:
Eva tiene 25 años de edad, estudió quinto año de secundaria, es casada y madre de 02 hijos (una mujer de 05 años y un varón de 01 año de edad). Vive en el Jr. Manco Capac interior 29, distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno, y desde el año pasado integra el Banco Comunal “La Ilaveñita” en Ilave.

Con su primer préstamo de S/.300, compró 01 televisor con S/.280.00 de segunda mano. A los 22 años de edad formó su hogar y desde esa fecha hasta hoy se dedica a la compra y venta de artefactos usados. Su pedido le llega cada quincena o cada mes, y su esposo le ayuda en el negocio porque es técnico.

Con este crédito de S/.800, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará un equipo de sonido con S/.700, el cual será comercializado en la feria de Ilave.

Su meta es construir su casa propia en la ciudad de Ilave, además que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.

 “Desde que integro el Banco Comunal he aprendido a ser más responsable y puntual y ello es muy bueno”, manifestó doña Eva.
texts.en:
Eva is 25-years-old, studied through her fifth year of secondary school, is married, and has 2 children (one girl who is 5 and one boy who is 1). She lives at Jr. Manco Capac interior 29 in the district of Ilave, the province of El Collao, in Puno. She has belonged to the communal bank, "La Ilaveñita" in Ilave since last year.

With her first loan of 300 nuevos soles, she bought one second-hand television for 280 nuevos soles. When she was 22, she formed her family, and since then she has bought and sold used devices. She receives her order every two weeks or every month. Her husband helps her with her business because he is a repairman. With this credit of 800 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 3 months, she will purchase a stereo for 700 nuevos soles, which she will sell at the market in Ilave.

Her goal is to build her own house in the city of Ilave and to educate her children so they can be professionals. "Since I became a part of the communal bank, I have learned to be more responsible and punctual, and that is very good," says Doña Eva.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase a stereo

loans.name: Kosar Bashir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Kosar baji is a wife of B. A.. They reside in a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. She is 40 years old and a very active lady. Kosar baji is a mother of two children, one son and one daughter. Her son is a carpenter. Her daughter reads in the 5th standard grade.

Kosar baji and Mr. B. get up at five each morning to work in their field. They have land in an area named “Aziz-a-Abad” in the city of Pakpattan. They grow vegetables there. When the vegetables become ripe they harvest them and Mr. B. goes to the market to sell the vegetables.

Kosar baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer for her land so that they can grow more vegetabless and earn more profit.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Asia baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. Allah Rakhi baji wants a loan to buy ingredients such as chick peas and rice for her food business. Taj baji wants a loan to buy cigarettes on wholesale to resell. Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy a lath machine. Shahida baji wants a loan to buy electric supplies like wires and switch boards for her electric shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for agriculture

loans.name: Ha Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Hà 34 tuổi, chị tham gia  Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị Hà là từ buôn bán hàng tạp hoá và chăn nuôi với mức thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Bên cạnh đó  chồng chị làm nghề xây dựng nên hàng tháng gia đình chị còn có thêm thu nhập khoảng 3.000.000đ. Với mức thu nhập ổn định này cuộc sống của gia đìnhchị Hà đang ngày càng được cải thiện hơn.
Chị Hà mong muốn vòng vốn tới được vay thêm 10.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn mua thêm hàng hoá phục vụ nhu cầu của bà con trong dịp Tết nguyên đán sắp tới.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ha Thi N., 34 years old, joined the Fund in 2003. Currently her family's main source of income is trading and selling general goods and raising livestock with an income of 3,000,000 VND/month. Besides that main business, her husband also works as a construction worker so the family has a supplemental income of 3,000,000 VND/month. With this stable income, the family's quality of life is improving day by day. Mrs. N. would like to borrow 10,000,000 VND in this round of funding to invest in buying more goods to serve the demands of her customers in the upcoming Tet New Year's holiday.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Yaw

texts.en: Yaw O. K. is 45 years old, married, and a father of four children who are currently in school. He sells fuel in gallons in the community where he lives. The distance from the village to the big town is quite great, so what he does is buys the fuel in gallons and resells it to the commercial vehicle drivers who plight that road to pick up passengers. Yaw has been in this business for the past three years. He says what he does is risky because he does not have a bigger container to store the fuel; instead he uses smaller gallons which can catch fire. He requests the loan to buy bigger fuel containers so that he can store larger quantities of fuel for his customers. It seems Yaw is the only fuel supplier on that road; therefore the demand for fuel is high. Through this business he has supported two of his kids who are in junior high school. He believes with this loan he would be more resourced to save more in supporting his kids in school. Yaw would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy gallons of fuel for supply

loans.name: Soam

texts.en: Soam S., 23, is married and lives with her husband in Battambang province. She grows various kinds of vegetables and oranges and sells them at the market to earn approximately US$ 2 in profit every day, while her husband Horm Sokhum, 30, pictured here, is a construction foreman and makes US$ 6 a day. This couple has one little child. Mrs. Soam is asking a loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use for his commute to work. This will reduce the cost that he spends every day on public transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for transport for her husband

loans.name: Busingye Allen Group

texts.en:
Allen Businyge is 32 years of age and married with four children. She also cares for additional family members. She rents a one-room house, where she stays with her children and husband. She has access to piped water and electricity and the family has three meals a day. Her greatest expense every month is feeding the family and paying tuition for her children.

Allen Businyge sells tomatoes to make a living for herself. She works seven days a week and pays rent for the premises on which she operates her business. She has been doing this business for five years now and prior to this she was selling groundnuts. The main challenge she finds in her business is the rainy season, which affects the number of customers she receives in a day. She sells in an open market and the rain disrupts her business.

This is her tenth loan with MCDT and the reason why she chose to work with MCDT is because it is near her home so she doesn’t have to spend money on transport. She hopes to use this loan to increase her stock. She aspires to expand her business to improve her income.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Amir

texts.en: Amir M. is a farmer who dedicates himself to the business of farming and livestock raising. Amir is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his three children. The necessity that he is currently faced with is the need to invest in the purchase of cattle. For this reason he is seeking a loan of 1200 USD to purchase cattle to raise for sale. Amir is grateful to everyone supporting him.

loans.use: purchase two calves

loans.name: Jenny Grisel

texts.es: La señora JENNY GRISEL S. A. y su esposo ERICK GUZMAN GONZALES, tienen un pequeño hijo a quienes mantienen con su trabajo. Ellos viven en su domicilio de la calle  ángel Sandoval # 1524  en la zona Calama, en la ciudad de El Alto. La señora Jenny se dedica a la venta de humintas y anticuchos; la huminta es una empanada tradicional de la zona occidental de Bolivia esta compuesta de choclo y queso; el anticucho esta compuesto de corazon de vaca, papa y maní (cacahuate), ensartados en un alambre. La señora sale todos los días  a la venta de sus productos, la elaboracion de las humintas las realizaba manualmente moliendo con la presion de un combo pero ahora con la compra de su moledora lo realizara eléctricamente. El mayor deseo de ellos es poder darle a su hijo una buena educación para que en un futuro sea una persona  de bien y responsable.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jenny Grisel S. A. and her husband Erick Guzman Gonzales have a young son whom they work to support. They live in their home at 1534 Angel Sandoval street, in the Calama neighborhood of the city of El Alto. Jenny sells humintas and anticuchos. A huminta is a traditional empanada from the western part of Bolivia and is made with corn and cheese. Anticuchos are skewers with cow's heart, potato and peanuts. Jenny goes out to sell her products every day. She used to make the humintas by hand, grinding them with the force of a wooden mallet, but now she has purchased an electric mill to grind them. The greatest hope of Jenny and Erick is to be able to give their child a good education so that he will grow up to be a good and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn and an electric grinder

loans.name: Erlita

texts.en:
Erlita C. is 50 years old, married and blessed with six children. She is presently residing at Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. Her business is charcoal vending. She buys coconut shells to produce charcoal, which she delivers to Oroquieta City every week during market day.

She borrowed PHP 7,000 for the labor cost and for the coconuts. She is also supported with her three children who are working already.

loans.use: To buy coconut shells for charcoal and for payment of labor

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena , Misamis Occi

loans.name: Melodia

texts.en: Mrs. Melodia J., 63 years old, is a widow and resident of Seaside, Tinago, Ozamiz City. She is blessed with 4 children and all of them are already married.  At the age of 8, she was already engaged in a vegetable and dry goods vending business in the market. Still this type of business has helped her most especially in supporting her daily needs. She started fruit vending and green mango vending in the year 1997 with a capital of PHP 1,000 from borrowing, on daily payment basis. She joined PAGLAUM MPC in the year 2006 at PAGLAUM Pagadian Branch and decided to transfer her membership and residence in Ozamiz City. She also earns a little income from her coco land, cassava production and is also engaged in seaweed production together with her son. Now, she is applying for the amount of PHP 5,000 to add her capital to purchase green mangoes and other fruits.

loans.use: Additional capital for green mango and fruit vending business.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice S. is married to a driver and has 3 dependents. She has received schooling through Primary School level. Eunice sells hair creams, body creams and other cosmetics. She has been in this business since 2003.

Eunice uses her income to pay for food and housekeeping expenses. Eunice will use the loan to purchase hair creams for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Eunice plans to reinvest to increase her profits.

loans.use: purchase hair creams for resale

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia N. is 40 years old and is married with five children. She sells drinks, coolers and toys, both wholesale and retail. Patricia is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more drinks to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma C. is married and is 43 years old. Emma lives in Tibig, a village in Silang, Cavite, with her husband and five-year-old daughter (shown behind Emma in the picture).

Emma operates a sari-sari (convenience) store in Tibig. The store, which she’s been running for four years, makes 47,500 PHP in profits per month. 

Emma applied for a 50,000 PHP loan from CCT to expand her store’s inventory. Emma joined CCT four years ago and previously had a 32,000 PHP loan from CCT, which she repaid on time. Emma hopes to use the profits from the business to renovate the family’s house and pay for her daughter's education.

loans.use: Expand her store's inventory

loans.name: Bidemi

texts.en: Bidemi, 36 years old and married with one child, has a provision shop. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Z. Madeleine

texts.fr: Z. Madeleine est née en 1961 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Madeleine est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Madeleine n’a jamais été à l’école. Mais a été initiée dès son jeune âge au commerce par sa mère. Après son mariage, s’est mise à son propre compte pour vendre différents produits en gros, à savoir : crevettes, pétrole lampant, tissus et bijoux. Madeleine livre à crédit les crevettes et le pétrole lampant aux détaillants. C’est à crédit que Madeleine livre également les tissus et bijoux, mais aux particuliers. Madeleine est à son quatrième crédit avec ALIDé. Madeleine sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son fonds de commerce afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle
texts.en:
Z. Madeleine was born in 1961 in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. She is married and the mother of three. Madeleine has never been to school. But when she was young, she was introduced to commerce by her mother. After Madeleine was married, she started off on her own selling different goods wholesale, namely: shrimp, lamp fuel, cloth, and jewelry. She delivers shrimp and lamp fuel on credit to retailers. On credit is also how she delivers cloth and jewelry, though to private individuals. Madeleine is on her fourth loan with ALIDé and is requesting it in order to boost her working capital, so as to respond better to the demands of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baskets of shrimp, cloth, and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Fatimatou

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Pour aider son mari chauffeur de taxi dans la gestion du foyer, elle s’est lancée depuis 2004 dans la vente de produits alimentaires et divers articles domestiques. Elle vend ses produits dans le marché d’Akodessewa à Lomé mais aussi dans son quartier Kegue. Pour renouveler son stock, elle  voudrait avoir un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 02 sacs d’haricot, 01 sac de riz, 03 sacs de maïs et d’autres articles comme des petits sachets de savon en poudre et autres articles. Ce prêt lui permettra aussi de couvrir ses frais de déplacement vers Atakpamé pour s’approvisionner en cérélales
texts.en:
This woman is married and the mother of 4 children. Her husband chauffeurs a taxi. In order to help him manage their home expenses, in 2004 she launched a business selling food and various products for the home. She sells her wares in the market of Akodessewa in Lomé and also in her own neighborhood of Kegue.

In order to re-stock her supplies, she would like a loan from WAGES (the micro-finance group) to purchase 2 sacks of beans, 1 sack of rice, 3 sacks of corn and a variety of other products, such as little packets of detergent and other items. This loan will enable her to pay for her trip to Atakpamé and shipping expenses to purchase her supply of grains.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food products and a variety of products for the home

loans.name: Taha

texts.en: Taha is a 46-year-old married man with 2 children. He has owned a phone shop since 2000. Over the years, thanks to his business income, he has been able to meet his children's needs. Today, Taha is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase more rechargeable cards so he can increase his sales and therefore his income.

loans.use: purchase more rechargeable cards

loans.name: Lucie

texts.fr: B. Lucie est née le 13 Décembre 1979 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative du Bénin. Mariée à HOUNGBEDJI Paul, un carreleur, Lucie vit à Porto-Novo depuis quinze ans. En plus de ses deux enfants, Lucie a en charge deux autres enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Le couple supporte ensemble les dépenses de la famille. Lucie vend à manger du riz et du haricot à côté de son domicile. Lucie s’approvisionne au marché de Ouando situé à Porto-Novo au Bénin. Lucie a bénéficié antérieurement de deux crédits qu’elle a eu à bien rembourser. Lucie ambitionne augmenter son fonds de roulement et accroitre sa clientèle. C’est ce qui l’a conduit à solliciter à nouveau un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Lucie B. was born on December 13th, 1979 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She is married to Paul Houngbedji, a tile layer; and has been living in Porto-Novo for fifteen years. In addition to her own two children, Lucie is also taking care of two other children, all of which are schooled. The couple takes care of family expenses together. Lucie sells rice and beans beside her house. Lucie buys her inventory at the Ouando market, located in Porto-Novo, Benin. Lucie has already benefited from two previous loans that she repaid in full. Lucie's aims to increase her working capital and her customer base, which is why she is requesting her third loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Dina Dumenko, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, beans, oil and sauce ingredients (tomatoes, onions, peppers, etc.)

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda D. is from the village of Danao. She is 46 years old. Brenda is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Brenda owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Brenda has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Brenda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Brenda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Brenda is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Brenda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma L. is from the village of Locsoon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Thelma owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Thelma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Kamu Kamu Group Of Lugazi

texts.en:
Emma N. is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is a hard-working, determined, married woman who has three children, ages 12, 11 and 10 years old. She also cares for her parents. Emma has been selling firewood in central Lugazi for one year. Before this business, she operated a bar. She is able to make 150,000/= Ugandan shillings in profit each week. This enables her to care for her family and expand her business. 

She is grateful for her loans because they have ensured quality in her business and made it possible for her to increase her stock. In the future, Emma hopes to become a wholesaler of firewood; supplying to schools, hospitals, barracks and colleges. She also wants to educate her children and build a house for them. 

She needs a loan to help re-capitalize her business and provide a steady supply of products to her customers. This is Emma’s 69th loan with her group.

loans.use: To buy firewood to resell

loans.name: Bertha Alicia

texts.es: L. señora Bertha Alicia T. es casada y se dedica a L. venta D. Tupper Ware y venta D. ropa usada, desD. hace 3 años el negocio esta dando ganancias, por L. gran dedicación y esfuerzo, los productos y el buen trato que le brinda a sus clientes, elL. esta tramitando este crédito para L. construcción D. una barda para el frente D. su vivienda y obtener una mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Señora Bertha Alicia T. is married and makes a living by selling Tupperware and used clothing. She has earned a profit with this business for three years because of her dedication, effort, products, and the good treatment she offers to her customers. She is applying for this credit so she can build a wall in front of her home for better security.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall

loans.name: Juana Del Camen

texts.es: Juana Del Carmen tiene 50 años es madre soltera y como toda mujer emprendedora tiene que trabajar para sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, por lo que hace más de 13 años que se dedica a este negocio y con el paso del tiempo es que lo ha mejorado para beneficiar a sus clientes que siempre le solicitan productos de calidad y además les gusta el servicio que le ofrecen. Por lo que su jornada empieza desde muy tempranas horas, ya que tiene exhibir sus productos, arreglar la mercadería y limpiar el local. Ella disfruta mucho de su trabajo es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para calzado, pantalones, shorts, camisas de vestir y vestidos por lo que se acerca la temporada navideña y quiero mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Juana del Carmen is 50 years old. She is a single mother and, like all working mothers, must work to get ahead with her 2 children. Her job is in the sales of general merchandise, which she has worked in for more than 13 years. With time’s passing, she has improved to the benefit of her customers who always want quality products and also like the service that they are offered. Her days start very early, since she has to exhibit her products, arrange the merchandise and clean the shop. She enjoys her job, and for this reason is requesting a loan for working capital that will be designated for shoes, pants, shorts, shirts and dresses. Since it is the Christmas season, she would like to improve her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Edson Ramiro

texts.es: El señor Edson  ya trabaja con emprender bastante tiempo, el primer credito saco para comprarse una pequeña cocina, posteriormente saco otro credito para poder comprar un horno semi industrial para prepar las tradicionales salteñas en su local, el señor edson accedio al credito con tasa preferencial por ser un cliente dinamico y responsable y no tener dias de mora, tambien vive en casa familiar con su esposa e hijos los cuales siguen estudiando y el señor Edson es el unico que corre con los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Señor Edson has worked with Emprender for quite awhile. He used his first credit to buy a small kitchen. He later took out another credit to be able to buy a semi-industrial oven to prepare traditional salteñas [a food similar to empanadas] in his kitchen. Señor Edson is accessing this credit at a preferred rate because he is a dynamic and responsible client and has not had delays with his payments. He also lives in his house with his wife and children, who are in school. Señor Edson is the sole generator of income for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Santos Eufemia

texts.es:
la sra. Santos Eufemia E. tiene 33 años de edad, vive en la aldea nueva Choluteca de la ciudad de Choluteca, es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos.
Eufemia se levanta a las 5 de la mañana  a para atender a sus hijos y luego abre su negocio para empezar a atender a sus clientes. Eufemia cuenta  con su madre que tambien le ayuda en cuidar la casa y el negocio cuando tiene que salir a comprar algo del hogar o para sus hijos.
en estos momentos Eufemia tiene poco inventario en su pulperia y desea comprar mas productos para tener mas variedad y asi tener mejores ventas, todo ahorita esta mejorando y las ventas se estan incrementando.
necesita el credito para sacar adelante su negocio y su familia,.
texts.en:
Sra. Santos Eufemia E. is 33 years old. She lives in the New Choluteca neighborhood of the city of Choluteca. She is a single mother with 3 children. Eufemia gets up at 5 in the morning to take care of her children and then she opens her business to begin taking care of her customers. Eufemia relies on her mother, who also helps her take care of the house and the business when she has to go out to buy something for the house or for her children.

At this time Eufemia has little inventory in her grocery store, and she wants to buy more products in order to have more variety and thus have better sales. Everything right now is getting better and sales are increasing. She needs this loan to advance her business and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy beans, rice, sugar, coffee, bread, cookies, beverages, juices, corn meal, tortillas, toilet paper, candles, matches, lard, oil, margarine, instant soups, condiments, salt, and eggs

loans.name: Lanh's Group

texts.en:
Lanh Thị Nguyễn is 31 years old. ( id: 010117140035). She sells clothes in the market. She was married and has one child. Lanh lives in Xom Ngoai village, in Uy No Dong Anh, Ha Noi. She has a monthly income of about 3.000.000 VND. Lanh is the group leader of a 5  member loan group offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. She has taking part in SEDA loans for 5 years and repayed each loan on time. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.750.000 VND from SEDA. Lanh is now requesting a new loan of 6.322.000 VND ( or 345 USD) which will be used to support her clothing sales business.

 About the other borrowers in her group: 
Hà Thị Hoàng is 27 years old. ( id: 010117140039). She wants to borrow 7.194.000 VND( or 385 USD) to invest in her glass and aluminum shop.
Liên Thị Đỗ is 54 years old. ( id: 010117140038). She has a bicycle repair shop. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND( or 270 USD) to buy bicycle parts to resell.
Linh Thị Nguyễn is 44 years old. (id: 010117140002). She sells sugar cane in the market. She wants to borrow 5.450.000 VND( or 295 USD) to inprove her small business.
Hiền Thị Hoàng is 40 years old. ( id: 010117140004). She sells from her shop every morning. She wants to borrow 6.322.000 VND( or 345 USD) to buy equipment including table, chairs, bowls, etc for her business..

loans.use: to support her business

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy B. is from the village of Lunao, Gingooog City. She is 33 years-old and unmarried. To make a living, Judy owns and operates a bakeshop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from baking and selling bread in the local community. Judy has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Judy joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Judy is requesting a first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Esmeralda Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento ESMERALDA es un banco que trabaja con nuestra Institución desD. el año 2007, este banco se caracteriza porque en todo este tiempo a conseguido consolidarse como grupo, la mayoria D. sus socias se dedica a la venta D. pan,anticuchos,café y algunas socias tienen tienda. 

La Sra ESTHER es una D. las fundadoras, tiene a su cargo la presidencia, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. pan, tiene una familia D. 4 miembros, con el prestamo a conseguido comprar por cantidad harina, azucar y levadura,lo que ha permitido que su producción se diversifique y aumente sus ganancias, mejorando su calidad D. vida.

La Sra. MIRNA Es una socia antigua, esta casada y tiene hijos pequeños, esta a cargo D. la secretaria, con el prestamo a comprado diferentes productos para su tienda, aprovechando que hay más ventas por las fiestas D. carnavales.

La Sra. MARIA es la tesorera del banco, ella tiene como principal actividad la atención D. una tienda D. barrio en su mismo domicilio, con el prestamo a comprado conservas, golosinas y galletas por cantidad, con este aumento en su capital mejorara sus ingresos D. ella y su familia.

Todas las socias son personas responsables, dinamicas y trabajadoras que en muchos casos mantienen solas el hogar y desean mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus familias, estan agradecidos con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.

OJO: En la fotografia esta el hijo D. una D. las socias.
texts.en:
The Esmeralda Communal Bank has been working with our Institution since 2007. In all the time it has managed to establish itself as a group, this Communal Bank has become known for its members who are primarily engaged in selling bread, skewered meats, coffee, or operating retail shops.

Sra. Esther is one of the founders and holds the position of President. She produces and sells bread. Esther has a family consisting of four members. With her loan she plans to buy flour, sugar, and yeast so that she can diversify her production and increase her earnings. As a result, she will be able to improve her quality of life.

Sra. Mirna is a long-time member who is married and has small children. She serves as the Secretary. With her loan she plans to buy different products for her store so that she can take advantage of the Carnival festivities to generate more sales.

Sra. Maria is the Treasurer of the Bank. Her principal business activity is managing a neighborhood store located in her home. With her loan she plans to buy canned goods, candy, and cookies in bulk so that she can increase her inventory and improve the income for herself and her family.

All of the members are responsible, dynamic, and hardworking people who support their families, and in most cases, must do so by themselves. They desire to improve the quality of life for their families and are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for trusting them by providing this loan.

NOTE: The son of one of the members also appears in the photograph.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Rosa Josefa

texts.es: LA SRA. ROSA ES UNA CLIENTE ANTIGUA (SEPTIMA SECUENCIA),  HA MOSTRANDO RESPONSABILIDAD Y PUNTUALIDAD EN LOS PAGOS D. SUS CREDITOS, ELLA TIENE LA DETERMINACION D. LLEGAR A VENDER POR MAYOR, ES EMPRENDEDORA, EL PUESTO D. VENTA  SE  ENCUENTRA EN LA POPULOSA  ZONA D. LA 16 D. JULIO,LA SEÑORA SE ESFUREZA POR SUPERARSE YA QUE TRABAJA DESD. LA MADRUGADA HASTA QUE SE PONE EL SOL, EL ESPOSO D. DOÑA ROSA ES COSTURERO QUIEN LA APOYA EN SU SUEÑO D. SER UNA EMPRESARIA, EL MAYOR ANHELO D. LA CLIENTA ES LLEGAR A SER RECONOCIDA POR LA SOCIEDAD EN SU LUCHA D. MEJORAR SU CALIDAD D. VIDA. CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA MERCADERIA AL POR MAYOR COMO ZAPATOS ULTIMOS MODELOS D. LA TEMPORADA, ESTA AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Rosa is an old client (in her seventh loan cycle). She has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality in the payments of her loans. Rosa is determined to sell better, and is an enterprising woman. She has a stand located in the populous 16 D. Julio zone. Rosa works very hard to better herself and works from sunrise until sunset. Her husband is a tailor and supports her in her dream to be a businesswoman. Her greatest longing is to become recognised by society in her quest to improve her quality of life. With the money Rosa is seeking she will purchase merchandise such as the latest styles of shoes. Rosa is thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they have shown in granting her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new styles of shoes

loans.name: Franca

texts.en: Franca sells cooking oil like palm and groundnut oil. She buys in bulk and sells at retail. She gets goods across Lagos and has been in this business since 2000. Franca is 39 years old, married to a customs officer and they have five children. Her children are between the ages of 5 and 15 years old. With part of her profit and what her husband brings in, they are able to clothe, feed and take care of their children's school fees. Franca is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more cooking oil to sell. She says thank to all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Ahunbaeva's Group

texts.ru:
Мархила лидер этой группы. Ей 41 год, она занимается  розничной реализацией молока и айрана. Молоко закупает у народа с села и реализует в г. Ош, а из молока готовит айран для реализации. Ее супруг строитель. У нее двое детей. На кредит она закупит доенную корову для реализации молока и молочной продукции.

Гульмира, 28, замужем. Ее супруг находится на заработках в РФ. У нее 3 детей. Старшая дочь ходит в школу, остальные дома. На высланные деньги от супруга с РФ, клиентка закупила телку, откормив телку продала и закупила доенную КРС и начала реализовать молоко. На кредит планирует закупить доенную корову и увеличить реализацию молока.

Октамхон, 37, замужем. Супруг работает мебельщиком, в месяц зарабатывает около 150 долларов. 'Клиент занимается выпечкой и реализация лепешек. Клиентка каждый день выпекает с одного мешка 75 лепешек и реализует в г. Ош по 10 сом. На кредит планирует закуп доенной коровы.

Чынара, 37, замужем. У нее 4 детей, сыну 15, дочерям 14,12 и 11 лет. Сын занимается наемной работой, дочери идут в школу. Клиент ежемесячно получает пособие в размере 15 долларов. В настоящее время клиентка занимается наемной работой (сеет картофель). кредит будет потрачен чтобы построить ворота.
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Marhila is a leader of this group. She is 41 years old and sells milk and ayran (a yogurt drink) in retail. She buys the milk from the village population and resells in the town of Osh, and also makes ayran from the milk to resell it. Her husband is a construction worker. They have two children. She will use the loan to buy a milk cow for selling of milk and milk products. Gulmira is 28, she is married. Her husband is working in Russia. She has three children. Her oldest daughter goes to school and the rest of the children stay at home. She used the money which her husband sent from Russia to buy a cow and after feeding it she sold it and bought a milk cow and began to sell milk. She plans to use the loan to buy another milk cow to increase the milk sales. Oktamhon is 37, she is married. Her husband makes furniture and earns around $150US a month. She bakes and sells flat breads. Every day she makes 75 flat breads from one bag of flour and sells them in the town of Osh for 10 soms each. She plans to use the loan to buy a milk cow. Chinara is 37, she is married. She has four children. Her son is fifteen and her daughters are fourteen, twelve and eleven. Her sons works for hire and her daughters go to school. Chinara receives an allowance of $15US a month. At this time she also works for hire, she sows potatoes. She will use the loan to build a gate.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy milk cow

loans.name: Las Azucenas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Azucenas  está conformado por tres personas tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es Nubia del Socorro García L. de 49 años quien vende tortillas y nacatamales desde hace seis años con la ayuda de su hija. 
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Santos A.  trabaja vendiendo esquimo desde hace 10 años el inicio como repartidos y ahora tiene un pequeño local donde vende este producto y Eduardo E. quien realiza calzado donde su especialidad son las sandalias.
texts.en:
The "Las Azucenas" (The Lilies) group is made up of three hard-working people. One of them is Nubia del Socorro García L., 49, who has sold tortillas and nacatamales (a type of tamal) for 6 years with the help of her daughter. Another member of the group is Santos A., who has sold Eskimo brand ice cream for 10 years by delivering it and now has a small store where he sells it. Eduardo E. is the third member, who makes footwear. His specialty is sandals.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn and firewood

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cloth to sew more garments

loans.name: Dem

texts.en: Dem S., 46, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She sells palm juice for an income of about $2 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of around $1.50 per day.  S. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Zakhida

texts.en:
Zakhida O. is a 35-year-old woman who raises calves in the small village of Saatli. She has more than 10 years experience. She buys calves in the livestock bazaar every three month, fattens them and sells to the local butchers for a profitable price. Her income is not permanent as she earns money once every 3-4 months and makes about 2000 AZN.  

Zakhida is married and has three children. She applied for a loan to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase two calves

loans.name: F. O. Blanche

texts.fr: H. F. O. Blanche est née le 06 Février  1960 et est mariée à MOKOMBIO Simplice, un comptable.  Le couple a un enfant qui est scolarisé. Il y a trois ans que Blanche s’est installée avec son mari et son enfant à Djeffa, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Blanche assure avec son mari les différentes charges de la famille. Ayant arrêté très tôt l’école, Blanche a appris la coiffure. Blanche exerce cette activité depuis trois ans à Agbalilamè. Parallèlement, Blanche vend des mèches et des produits de coiffure ; de façon secondaire, Blanche vend également des boissons en canettes. Blanche s’approvisionne au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin.  La clientèle de Blanche s’accroît de plus en plus, et Blanche n’arrive plus à tous les satisfaire. C’est donc pour renforcer son activité et mieux répondre aux exigences des clients que Blanche sollicite un premier prêt.
texts.en:
F.O. Blanche H. was born February 6, 1960, She is married to Simplice Mokombio, an accountant. They have one child, who has been to school. Three years ago Blanche and her husband and child moved to Djeffa in the commune of Sèmè-Podji. Blanche and her husband pay for the family's expenses. She dropped out of school and learned hairdressing. For three years, she has been in this business at Agbalilamè. She also sells hair extensions and hair products; on the side she sells canned drinks. She buys her products in Nigeria, Benin's neighbor. With more and more customers, Blanche has not been able to meet all of their needs, and so to build her business and better respond to customer demand she is asking for her first loan.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy hair extensions and other hair products

loans.name: Ma. Imelda

texts.en:
Ma. Imelda S. is from the village of Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old. Ma. Imelda is married. To make a living, Ma. Imelda owns & operates a business running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Ma. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ma. Imelda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ma. Imelda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yadira Isabel

texts.es:
Yadira García es una mujer dedicada a la marroquinería, oficio que aprendió cuando al trabajar su esposo en un taller que continuamente cerraban, ella fabricaba en su casa y sus productos los distribuía su esposo en  centros comerciales  importantes del centro de Barranquilla y también vendía  al detal en la calle, es decir la producción a cargo de Yadira y la comercialización en manos de su esposo. Toda esta experiencia generó el que   en la actualidad se dedica  exclusivamente a fabricar hermosos y coloridos bolsos, carteras, accesorios sintéticos y muy  modernos, porque Yadira es una mujer comprometida con su trabajo y siempre está atenta a la moda, para crear o emular los mejores diseños que agraden a sus clientes y que sean rentables. 
Este es su segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el primero aumentó su producción convirtiéndolo en un capital de trabajo nuevo, con el que ella no contaba; por eso ahora está solicitando su credikiva  para comprar materias primas e insumos,  como cuerina, pegador, correderas, slider, trabillas, mosquetones goma solución blanca ojetes y cartón, para sacar una nueva colección, aprovechando que se acerca el día del amor y  la amistad y preparándose desde ahora,  para los últimos meses del año, época en la cual  hay una gran demanda de sus productos y  por consiguiente sus ventas se incrementan. 
Su meta es prosperar siempre en su negocio, mediante la expansión y sobre todo el posicionamiento gradual en el mercado, para que su familia progrese.
texts.en:
Yadira García makes leather goods, a trade she learned when her husband worked in a shop that was constantly closing down. She used to work from her home and her husband distributed the products to the major shopping centers in Barranquilla. They also sold retail outside; that is Yadira would manufacture the goods and her husband would sell them. This experience lead to what she does exclusively today, making beautiful and colorful purses, wallets, and very modern synthetic accessories. Yadira is very dedicated to her work and in touch with the current fashion, so that she can create or copy the designs that her customers like best and are most profitable. This will be her second loan through “Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.” The first loan allowed her to increase her production and subsequently created a need for working capital that she had not counted on. Now she is asking for a Kiva loan to buy supplies, such as leather, glue, slide fasteners, straps, carabineers, white glue, eyelets, and cardboard. She want to create a new collection so that she can take advantage of the approaching day of “Love and Friendship,” and also to prepare for the holiday season, when demand for her products goes up and her sales increase. Her goal is to prosper in her business, through expansion, and above all position herself in the market so that her family can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Sènoumè

texts.fr: Z. Sènoumè est née en 1975 à Lokokoukoumè dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji et s'est mariée à CHAGANOU Firmin, un mécanicien auto. Sènoumè est mère de trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Sènoumè vit à Lokokoukoumè depuis son enfance. Sènoumè vend divers produits (conserves de tomate et de sardines, pâtes alimentaires, lait, savons, couscous, huile d'arachide, etc.) à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille. Sènoumè achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du BENIN. Sènoumè veut augmenter son capital et accroître son chiffre d'affaire, raison pour laquelle Sènoumè sollicite l'aide financière de ALIDé. Sènoumè avait obtenu antérieurement deux prêts de ALIDé, prêts qui ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Sènoumè Zounhoeva was born in 1975 in Lokokoukoumè in the Sèmè-Podji borough, and is married to Firmin Chaganou, an automobile mechanic. She is the mother of three children, all attending (or having attended) school. She has lived in Lokokoukoumè since her childhood. Sènoumè retails a variety of products from her home (canned tomatoes and sardines, pasta, milk, soap, cuscus, peanut oil, etc.). This enables her to meet her needs and those of her family. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. Sènoumè wants to increase her working capital and her turnover, which is why she is requesting financial support from ALIDé. She had previously been granted two loans from ALIDé, both of which were duly repaid.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products

loans.name: Aruinaa

texts.en:
Aruinaa D. is 41 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Tuv province, central Mongolia. She and her family have been living together at their current home address for 10 years. Her husband also works in their repair center. Her oldest son attends university and her younger two sons and daughter currently attend a local secondary school. In the future they plan to improve their living conditions as well as save money in order to pay their children's tuition fees for higher education. 

Aruinaa attended  Aktubinsk vocational training in Russia in gas welding from 1981 to 1983.  She has been operating a repair business of wheel and tires and other machinery with the help of her husband at a local town since 2003. Now they have purchased all kinds of equipment. 

In the future she hopes to have new car repair center with spare part sales. She is a modest and honest person.  Aruinaa is requesting a 500,000 MNT  loan to purchase more car repair supplies and tools.

loans.use: To purchase more car repair supplies and tools

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and 5 siblings. Seven years ago, he stopped his education and started working in car mechanics. And since 2007, he is a proud new car repair shop owner in his town.  He is thankful for his business income because he is able to help his father in the household. 

 Today, he is asking for a loan of US$ 1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a specialized scanner to examine the cars technologically. He is certain that with the help of the loan, he will be able to purchase the machine and develop his business. In the future, he is planning to purchase more technicA. equipment to expand his business level.

loans.use: to purchase a specialized scanner to examine the cars technologically

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old single man living with his mother and one sibling. He is from Lebanon. After the death of his father, he found himself responsible for his family, so despite his young age, he started working as a mechanic five years ago. In 2007, this hard worker opened his own car repair shop to have his own business and own income. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve his business and purchase more mechanic tools to be able to receive more customers. He is optimistic about his business development and he hopes that the coming year will continue to bring positive growth.

loans.use: To improve his business and purchase more mechanic tools

loans.name: Benon

texts.en: Benon wants a loan to buy local chickens for his poultry farm and medicine for his hybrid cow. He is a married farmer with seven children. He lives in a semi-permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He dreams of educating his children and becoming a model farmer for the locals to learn from. However, he faces challenges of price fluctuations of agricultural products and seasonal changes.

loans.use: To buy local chickens for his poultry farm and buying medicine for his hybrid cow.

loans.name: Idah

texts.en: Idah is a 60-year-old lady who runs St. Philomena Medical Clinic.  She also does farming to supplement her income.  She has been running the medical clinic for fifteen years.  She hopes to grow the business into a nursing home in the future.  Being a member of Joy Traders group in Faulu Kenya, she has been guaranteed a loan of 50,000 Kes.  With the loan, she will buy drugs. Idah is the mother of five adults.

loans.use: To buy medicine

loans.name: Deylin Del Socorro

texts.es:
Deylin de 29 años de edad es soltera, tiene 2 niños en edad preescolar, labora el MINED Santo Tomas desde hace 9 años como directora en una comarca de Santo Tomas. 

Esta solicitando  su 4to credito con el objetivo de Instalar el servicio de agua potable y luz en su casita, al mismo tiempo desea legalizar su propiedad, ya que solo cuenta con el titulo de dominio, y sie el dinero alcanza terminar una pared de su cuarto, pues solo tiene levantada la mitad y el resto la tiene cerrada con zinc. 

Sueña con tener su vivienda con las condiciones necesarias para que sus hijos crezcan en un ambiente agradable.
texts.en:
Deylin is 29-years-old.  She is single and has two children of preschool age.  She has worked in the Santo Tomas Ministry of Education as a manager in the Santo Tomas district for nine years.

She is requesting her fourth loan with the goal of installing drinking water and electrical service in her house, and at the same time she would like to legalize her property as she only has the deed now.  If the money is enough, she will finish a wall in her bedroom as she has only raised it halfway and the rest is still finished with zinc. 

She dreams of having her own home with the necessary conditions so that her children can grow up in a pleasant environment.

loans.use: Installation of basic services and finishing a wall

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su tercer ciclo y se encuentra trabajando solidariamente para ir creciendo cada una y también el grupo, y tratan de cumplir con todas las responsabilidades que tienen cada una. 
Se puede mencionar a la Sra. Ana Maria C. con 35 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos que se quedan  en la casa mientras ella se  va a hacer su Quiniela por la mañana luego regresa a su casa prepara para el almuerzo  y vuelve a salir por la tarde para a hacer su quiniela.
Es una señora muy sufrida que tiene un día a día muy pesado  por que al llegar de su trabajo debe de realizar las tareas de la casa y todo lo hace para salir adelante con sus hijos ya que es madre soltera.   
Tiene una casita  pequeña hecha de materiales precaria. 
De esta manera ella sostiene los gastos de la casa y de  sus dos hijos que van en la escuela. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra los gastos de la casa ya que llega la época de navidad y los ingresos que obtiene no le alcanza para las mejoras que quiere realizar por su vivienda.
texts.en:
This committee is in its third loan cycle.  The members work jointly so that each individual, and the group, can continue to grow.  They try to fulfil all the responsibilities that each member has.

Here we can mention Mrs Ana Maria C..  She is 35 years old and has two children who stay in the house while she goes out in the morning to sell lottery tickets.  She returns home to make their lunch and then goes out again in the afternoon to sell her tickets.

Ana Maria is a long-suffering woman who has a very difficult day every day because when she gets home from work she has to do her housework.
