She does everything to get herself and her children ahead in life as she is a single mother.  Ana Maria has a very small, poorly-constructed, house.  She works so that she can cover her home expenses and those of her two children who go to school.  She is requesting this loan so that she can cover home expenses as the Christmas period is approaching and the income she makes from her business doesn't stretch far enough to cover the improvements that she would like to make on her home.

loans.use: Expenses for improving her home

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.es:
La Sra. Bernarda es comerciante hace mas de 5 años tiene en su propia casa una despensa bien surtida está ubicado en el barrio Azucena  de Cnel. Oviedo, además tiene en su negocio artículos de Mercería y también vende comestible en frente de su casa.
La misma está casada con Don Ramón Rojas  hace más de 20 años, el mismo es jubilado y percibe sueldo del estado. 
La misma también manifiesta que no se queja de sus ventas  ya que tiene muchos clientes todo el día porque  al lado de su negocio hay dos talleres grandes y llega mucha gente. 
  Agradece a la Fundación  Paraguaya por haber confiado en su persona dándole la oportunidad de formar parte de la gran familia de micro-empresas a quienes les ofrecen fondos para el capital de trabajo. 
Ella solicito el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías varias para su negocio.
texts.en:
Bernarda is a saleswoman.  For more than five years she has had a small, well-stocked grocery store in her home in Azucena de Cnel. Oviedo neighborhood.  She also sells hardware in her store and sells food in front of her home.

Bernarda has been married to Ramón Rojas for more than 20 years.  He is now retired and receives a state pension.  Bernarda tells us that she has no complaints as regards her sales.  She has lots of customers all day long as there are two large workshops next to her business and a lot of people come to her store.

Bernarda is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for having placed their trust in her, giving her an opportunity to form part of a large family of small businesses to whom they offer funds for working capital.  Bernarda requested her loan to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.use: To buy soda, bread, flour, sugar and noodles

loans.name: Arif

texts.ru:
Arif T. 49 let. On jenat i imeyet 3 detey , dva iz kotorix uchatsya v kolledje. Arif yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli i seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey lubimoy semyoy.
 
Arif uje pochti 14 let kak rabotayet v etom biznesse prodaji medicinskix priporatov. Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Arifa v perviy raz on bral 1200$ i za eto on blagodarek Kive i lenderam za kredit. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit kupit medicinskiye lekarstva dlya pereprodaji.

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/4520
texts.en:
Arif T. is forty-nine years old. He's married and has three children, two of whom attend college. Arif is an internally displaced person from the city of Fuzuli, currently residing in the Fuzuli region with his family. For the past fourteen years, Arif has bought and resold medical supplies. He's requesting a loan of 2000 AZN in order to acquire some healthcare products to resell for profit. 
This is Arif's second loan here at Kiva. His first loan was of $1200 and he would like to thank Kiva and its lenders for the support they offer. 

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/4520

loans.use: To buy healthcare supplies for resale

loans.name: Estrella De Luz Group

texts.es:
El grupo Estrella de Luz lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es la señora Yessenia Aurora T. T. quien vede ropa, cosméticos y chiverías desde hace 10 años. Ella inicio con poca mercadería y con el tiempo su ardua labor y los prestamos su negocio ha ido creciendo.  
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Marlene M. Moreno propietaria de una venta y Zeneyda Margarita Velásquez propietaria de una mini pulpería.
texts.en:
The group Estrella de Luz [Starlight] is made up three hardworking women.  One of these women is Yessenia Aurora T. T., who has sold clothing, cosmetics, and dairy products for 10 years.  She started without much merchandise, but with time, hard work, and loans, she has grown her business.  

The other members of the group are Marlene M. Moreno who owns an inn and Zeneyda Margarita Velásquez who owns a small convenience store.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal “Inka Wasi” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 31años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene 01 hijo, la señora estudió educación secundaria. 
Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, paralelamente elabora caritas (máscaras) que vende al por menor.
Es una socia nueva, ella solicita un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá  en su negocio de venta de cosméticos, también comprará un quintal de harina y 10 bolsas de yeso para hacer caritas (mascaras), trabaja junto con su esposo y cuñada.
Su sueño es tener una casa propia y crecer más como empresaria.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la organización y lo que ganan sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the Communal Bank “Inka Wasi” which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Puno. She is 31 years old, in a common law marriage, and has one child. Sra. Isabel studied for her high school education.

She sells cosmetics. In addition, she produces masks that she sells at retail. Isabel is a new member, so she is requesting her first loan in the amount of 300 PEN. The money will be invested in her business of selling cosmetics, but she will also buy a quintal (46 kg) of flour and 10 sacks of plaster for making masks. She works with her husband and sister-in-law.

Her dreams are to have her own house and continue growing as an entrepreneur. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the organization and the interest she earns from her savings.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics & supplies for making handcrafted masks

loans.name: Jinny

texts.en:
Jinny R. is from the village of Santo Niño, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 38 years old. Jinny is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Jinny owns a service-based business which provides motorela or habal-habal services to local community members with her husband as the driver. She also buys and sells fish like sardines and mackerel. Jinny has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jinny joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jinny has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Jinny is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed to provide service and also to be used for working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools needed to provide service and for working capital

loans.name: Jussely

texts.es: Jussely, de 27 años, es una joven madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Roger de 29 años y su querida hija Ángela de 7 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. La actividad a la que se dedica Jussely, es el cultivo de choclos, papas, arvejas, etc, en las chacras que heredó de sus padres, ella trabaja todos los días arduamente, para luego llegado el momento adecuado, cosechar sus productos y venderlos en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene en el desempeño de su labor, ya que ella decide que es lo mejor para sus cultivos. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado, ya que la mayoría de veces, le es muy difícil conseguir un carro que quiera llevarla. En adelante, espera poner un puesto en el mercado, ya que está segura que así mejorará sus ingresos económicos. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que ser puntual en sus pagos, como la ha sido en sus anteriores créditos. En su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria y esta muy comprometida con el desarrollo de sus grupos. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de arveja, ya que esta plata leguminosa se esta vendiendo actualmente muy bien en el mercado.
texts.en: Jussely is 27-years-old and a young and hard-working mother.  She lives in her own house along with her husband Roger who is 29-years-old and their beloved daughter Angela who is seven-years-old and who are the reason for all of her hard work.  The work Jussely does is growing corn, potatoes, peas, et cetera on the farm that she inherited from her parents.  She works very hard every day for when the right moment arrives to harvest her products and sell them in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma.  What she likes best about her work is the freedom she has in how she goes about her work, as she decides what is best for her plantings.  She has worked in this for ten years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her products to the market, as the majority of the time it is difficult to obtain a car that can take them.  Looking forward, she hopes to put a stand in the market as she as sure that in this way she will improve her earnings.  This is her ninth loan with MFP.  She knows that she has to be punctual in her payments as she has been with her previous loans.  In her communal bank she is a supportive member and is very committed to the growth of the group.  With the 3000 nuevos soles that she is requesting she will buy pea seeds as this legume plant is selling very well at the market right now.

loans.use: Purchase pea seeds

loans.name: Benedetta

texts.en:
Benedetta N. is a married lady. Her husband is a businessman and they have three children, aged between four years old and six months old, whom they hope to educate to the university level. Her business is located by the roadside in Kitengela. She sell cereals such as beans, rice, green grams [mung beans], maize and others to local people. She has been in this business for five years now and has provided employment to one person. 

Benedetta says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is that there are other people in the area doing the same business as hers, so customers are not loyal as they are spoilt for choice. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 90,000 Kenyan shillings to add stock of cereals to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to expand to wholesale and later make it a supermarket. She also sees herself owning a plot of land where she will build their residential house. She describes herself as ambitious and business-oriented.

loans.use: to add stock of beans, rice and green grams [mung beans].

loans.name: Tamemsu Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Tamemsu” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek for a loan of SLL 500,000.00 for each member to invest in their own businesses. 

Fatmata K. is the leader of this group. Fatmata is a 29-year-old, single woman with no children. Fatmata sells dried fish. She buys her fish from the villages of Tombo and Mama Beach near Freetown and sells in Kabala town. Fatmata will use her share of the loan to buy dried fish in large quantities to resell in Kabala town.

loans.use: To buy dried fish in large quantities, to resell in Kabala town.

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Bun E., 58, is a local teacher who lives with her husband and four of her children in Takeo province. She is able to earn US $2.50 per day, while her husband, a village chief, earns US $1 per day. This family is supported by their four children who work in garment factories. Bun E. now wants to take out a loan of US $1,200 to breed cows.

loans.use: to buy cows to breed.

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
Anibal es un padre de familia de 35 añosde edad, vive en casa de sus padres con un hijo en edad escolar,cuenta con todos los servicios (agua, luz y desagüe), ubicada en la calle los obreros de la provincia de Chiclayo.   Ciudad caracterizada por el alto desarrollo comercial, agricultura y turismo.

Anibal labora como chofer de transporte público, en su vehículo propio haciendo taxi, esta actividad lo realiza desde hace  8 años en la ciudad de Chiclayo, al tener carrop ropio le permite trabajarlo mañana y tarde sin problemas.  Esto le permite incrementar sus ingresos diaR. quel e servira para solventar sus gastos.

Se ha visto  Anibal en la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para la reparación total y pintadode su vehículo, al no presentar ninguna falla puede ir a cualquier lugar que su cliente le diga y así puede brindar un mejor servicio, con la finalidad de tener más ingresos para poder sacar adelante a su hijo y como todo padre brindarle una mejor oportunidad en lavida.  Esto le permitirá Anibal pagar su crédito con responsabilidad y puntualidad.
texts.en:
Anibal is the father of a family and he is 35 years old. He lives in his parents' house together with a school-aged son. It is equipped with all the services (water, electricity, and sewage). It is locate don Los Obreros street in the province of Chiclayo. The city is characterized for its commercial development, its agriculture, and tourism.

Anibal works as a public transport driver, driving his own car as a taxi. he has been in the business for 8 years in the city of Chiclayo. He has his own car so he is able to work in the mornings and afternoons without any problems. This helps him increase his daily income which helps him provide for his expenses.

Anibal has seen the need to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 3000 nuevos soles to carry out a full maintenance overhaul and paint job to his car. Without any mechanical problems he will be able to go anywhere his clients request and to provide them with a better level of service. His goal is to have more income to support his son and, as any father would, to provide him with a better opportunity in life. This will help Anibal repay his loan responsibly and on time.

loans.use: to carry out a complete overhaul of his car.

loans.name: Margarita Lucia

texts.es: Margarita buscando bienestar para su familia  desde hace dos años inició su negocio de vender frituras y refrescos,   capital de trabajo que adquirió mediante préstamos costosos a particulares, los cuales hoy ha reemplazado totalmente. Ella se le ocurrió esta idea porque su esposo es taxista y él era el único que aportaba al hogar dinero, para satisfacer las necesidades de la familia conformada por ellos dos y sus 6 hijos en las edades de 2 a 17 años. Hoy Margarita genera ingresos que ayudan mucho a los gastos  de este hogar y se siente muy satisfecha de poder aportarle cada día más.  En la actualidad planea incrementar sus ventas y está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con su credikiva comprará insumos en mayor volumen y herramientas para modernizar la fritanguera, pues con ello exhibirá una mejor imagen a sus clientes y aspira a aumentar su rentabilidad sobre las ventas que no es menores de un 30%. Su sueño es tener su propia casa y lograr el crecimiento de su negocio para en un futuro lograr ahorros que ayuden a ofrecerles a sus hijos herramientas educativas de mejor calidad con tal de que logren su éxito futuro. Su mayor desafió ocurrió en el pasado cuando pagaba pasivos costosos para poder iniciar y sostener su negocio, pero fue una experiencia que la enseñó a disciplinarse con su negocio.
texts.en: Two years ago, Margarita sought to improve the wellbeing of her family so she started her business selling fried foods and soft drinks. She acquired a working capital through private and very expensive loans, which have been completely cancelled today. She thought of this idea because her husband is a taxi driver and he was the only one earning an income for the family's needs. Their family is made up of them both and their 6 children, between the ages of 2 and 17. Today, Margarita generates an income which helps with the household expenses and she feels very happy to earn more every day. She currently plans on increasing her sales and she is applying for her first loan with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner). Her Kiva loan will be used to purchase ingredients in larger quantities and to purchase tools to modernize her fried foods business. She will give a better presentation to her clients and she aspires to increase her sales profits so that they are no less than 30%. Her dream is to have her own house and to expand her business so that in the future she will have savings. This will help her provide her children with a quality education for a successful future. Her greatest challenge she has faced in the past when she paid high interest to start and maintain her business. But it was an experience that taught her how to discipline herself in her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients in large quantities and to purchase tools to modernize her fried foods business.

loans.name: Teodolinda

texts.es: Teodolinda, de 38 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Ronald de 44 años y su hija Zulema de 18 años, en el caserío de Picoy. Desde muy joven comenzó a trabajar para salir adelante. Su principal negocio es la venta de animales menores en su misma casa, es ahí donde vende gallinas, patos y otros animales, los cuales están bien alimentados y cuidados, es por eso que tiene muchos clientes y sus ingresos económicos son buenos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es alimentar a sus aves, ya que los cría con mucho cariño, lleva 18 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que sacrificar algunos de sus animales, para vender su carne a las carnicerías de su localidad. Para el futuro, planea alquilar una tienda donde pueda brindar a sus clientes una mejor comodidad a la hora de atenderlos. Pero hace poco incursionó en la venta de productos comestibles y de primera necesidad y aunque le falte abastecerlo con más productos, le está dejando buenas ganancias. Además cuenta que comenzó a trabajar junto a su hija en la confección de buzos, donde piensa más adelante invertir la mayor parte de su capital ya que tiene mayor campo de trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Exaltación Santa Cruz”, y este es el décimo crédito con MFP; donde espera un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Teodolinda, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de productos comestibles como: azúcar, arroz, leche, atún y demás. Asimismo comprará tela para la confección de buzos.
texts.en:
Teodolina is 38 and is a very simple and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own home in the town of Picoy with her husband Ronald, who is 44, and her daughter Sulema, who is 18.  Since she was very young, she started working to get ahead.  Her main business is selling small animals at her home.  She sells chickens, ducks, and other animals who are well-fed and cared for.  This is why she has many customers and her economic income is good.  What she likes most about her job is feeding her birds, and she raises them with a lot of care.  She has had this business for 18 years, and what she considers the most difficult is sacrificing some of her animals to sell the meat in butcher shops in her area. 

In the future, she plans to rent a store where she can offer her customers more comfort.  A little while ago, she invested in consumable goods and basic products, and she needs more money to increase her inventory.  She is making good profit.  She also tells us that she started working with her daughter to make sweaters where she plans to invest the majority of her capital .  She belongs to the communal bank, “Exaltación Santa Cruz,” and this is her 10th credit with Microfinanzas Prisma.  She hopes this small loan will help her meet her objectives.  On the other hand, she promises once more to make her payments on time, just like she has with her previous loans.  She is also thankful to her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and united.  Teodolinda will invest the requested money in the purchase of consumable goods like:  sugar, rice, milk, tuna, etc.  She also will buy fabric to make sweaters.

loans.use: to buy basic food products to supply her store and also to buy fabric.

loans.name: Bonns Club Group

texts.en:
Ntombenhle is 33 years old and single with three children between the ages of 9 months and 12 years old. Two of her children attend school. She runs an agricultural business in Kwa Zulu Natal of Empangeni in South Africa.

She has been in this business for a year, selling fruits and vegetables at her home. 

Ntombenhle requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to buy clothes for resale. She says that she does not face any challenges. She says that this loan will help her clothes-selling business grow. 

Ntombenhle would like to see her business grow and generate more profit. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her business grow and help her manage to repay her loan.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Santos Ronis

texts.es: El Sr. Santos Ronis  él es trabajador activo del  Ministerio de Salud en el centro de Salud de Masachapa desempeñándose como Afanador tiene  cinco años  de trabajar para esta institución es casado actualmente  tiene dos hijo en edad escolar. Ha obtenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Santos Ronis works for the Ministry of Health as a maintenance man at the Masachapa health center.  He’s been employed here for five years.  He’s married and has two school age children.  He has gotten two CEPRODEL loans that he used to buy building materials and supplies like: sand, cement, stone, gravel, concrete blocks, etc. to enlarge and improve his home.  Ceprodel loans have been very beneficial for him because he’s been able to improve his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Ruzan

texts.en:
Ruzan was born in 1965 in Yerevan. She lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and grandson. Ruzan’s daughter is married and lives separately from her parents. Ruzan’s husband is a shoemaker and had his own workshop, but because production in Armenia was not so profitable, he and Ruzan decided to get involved in trade.
For more than 15 years, Ruzan and her husband have been engaged in a shoe sales business. For about seven years they have been renting a stall in the one of the biggest subway stations in Yerevan, where they sell children’s, men’s and women’s shoes. They buy merchandise from Georgia and Yeravan’s wholesale fair. Thanks to their own business, Ruzan and her family have improved their living conditions and bought a car, which helps them to decrease their business expenses.
Ruzan is requesting a 450,000 Armenian drams loan to add to her shop's shoe assortment, especially children’s shoes. She intends to spend her future income on children's and students' shoes, which she will purchase ahead of the academic year.

loans.use: to add to her shop's shoe assortment, especially children’s shoes.

loans.name: Elena Doraliza

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Inmaculada se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi, cantón conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

La señora Elena es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos. Tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos  gemelos que tienen 1 año y seis meses  de edad. Su esposo es maestro en una escuela de la localidad.

Es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Tiene más de un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes ya que son muy buenos agrega. También se dedica a la cría de chanchos y gallinas pero esto es más para su consumo aunque a veces vende algunos de sus animalitos a sus vecinos.
	
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio hace 5 ciclos y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante tanto en el Banco como en su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank María Inmaculada meets every two weeks in the parish of La Sequita de Montecristi, known as the birthplace of the old fighter Eloy Alfaro and for its famous straw hats that are popular in and outside of the country.

Mrs. Elena is the founding member of the communal bank and she enjoys it because of its easy credit terms.  She is 38, married and has twin boys who are 18 months old.  Her husband is a school teacher in the town where they live.

She is a homemaker who earns an income selling Yanbal brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and ladies' accessories).  She works three days a week and sells on a credit basis, collecting payment on a weekly basis.  For over a year she has had this business, which is doing well.  Her best selling products are perfumes, which she claims are very good.  She also raises pigs and chickens for family consumption although sometimes she sells to neighbors.

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and fashion jewelry.  She has been a member of the communal bank for five terms and likes the fact that loans are granted quickly.

Her goals are to be successful in both the communal bank and her own business.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and fashion jewelry.

loans.name: Jeff

texts.es: Jeff, de 31 años, es un joven soltero y trabajador. Su familia lo conforman sus padres y su hermana, con quienes viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). Como hombre joven y lleno de ambiciones, Jeff se dedicaba a  vender electrodomésticos en diferentes ciudades del país; con el tiempo sus deseos eran mayores, quería tener algo propio. Es entonces que comenzó a dedicarse a la agricultura. Sus principales cultivos constan de café, los cuales siembra en sus 2 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, ya tiene 6 años dedicándose a ello. Lo que más le gusta, es poder ayudar a sus padres a mejorar sus granos, ya que le heredaron parte de sus cultivos. “El secreto para obtener un buen grano, es dedicar mayor tiempo en el cuidado de las plantaciones”, afirma, por ello sus planes para el futuro son, sembrar otras variedades de café. Su experiencia en las ventas y las ganas de salir adelante le ayudarán a lograr su objetivo. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Prestatarios de unión palomar” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP,  donde asegura podrá salir adelante gracias a su banco comunal y a todos ustedes, que hacen posible el pequeño préstamo. Jeff instalará 5 mil plantitas de café; por ello de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la contrata de peones para que le ayuden en el poseo (hoyos en la tierra para plantar), de esa manera obtendrá su hectárea de terreno cultivable listo para producir.
texts.en: Jeff, 31, is a young man who is single and hard-working. His family is comprised of his parents and his sister, with whom he lives in their own house in the community of Unión Palomar (in the central Peruvian jungle). As a young man full of ambitions, Jeff used to sell small home appliances in different cities around the country. Over time, though, he wanted more than that. He wanted something that was his own. That is when he started working in agriculture. Jeff's principal crop is coffee, which he plants on his two hectares of farmland. He has already been doing this work for six years. The thing he likes most is that he is able to help his parents to improve their coffee beans too, since he inherited part of their crops. "The secret to obtaining a good coffee bean is to dedicate more time to caring for your plantation," he says. His plan for the future is to plant other varieties of coffee. His sales experience and his desire to get ahead will help him to achieve his objectives. He belongs to the "Prestatarios de Unión Palomar" ["Borrowers of Unión Palomar"] communal bank and this is his second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. He is sure that he will be able to get ahead thanks to his communal bank and all of you, who are making this small loan possible for him. Jeff will plant five thousand coffee seedlings. In order to do so, he will use the requested money to hire workers to help him with el poseo (making holes in the ground to plant the seedlings). This way, he will be able to get his land ready to produce.

loans.use: to hire workers to prepare his fields for planting coffee

loans.name: Roza

texts.en: Roza is 54 year old women, married with three children. She grows seasonal fruits and vegetables.  She has three years of experience in this field and has already demonstrated herself to be a good client with a positive credit history. Fresh fruits and vegetables are very popular among Azerbaijan people and  that’s why Roza would like to improve her business to increase sales. She usually sells her products in the local Bilasuvar bazaar. Roza applied for 1200 AZN loan in case to purchase more seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Maria De Los Santos

texts.es:
la sra. Maria de los Santos tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion, ademas de esto se dedica al cultivo de cafe, tiene 7 años de dedicarse a dicha actividad productiva, la cual es su mayor fuente de ingreso que percibe anualmente, de esto cubre sus compromisos.
Maria de los Santos vive con su esposo y tiene tres hijos que le ayudan con la produccion del cafe.
La Sra. Maria utilizara el credito para la compra de una planta solar la cual esta necesitando para poder  gozar de las ventajas de este servicio de energía, asi mismo podra poner luz en su pulperia y poder antender a sus clientes durante mas tiempo por las noches.
texts.en:
María de los Santos has a small general store that she runs out of her home.  Besides this, she grows coffee. She has been growing it for 7 years, and it is her greatest source of annual income. From it, she covers her commitments. 

María de los Santos lives with her husband and has three children, who help her with coffee production.  

María will use the loan to buy a solar-powered electrical plant, which she needs in order to be able to enjoy the advantages of having electricity. As well, she will be able to have lighting in her general store, and be able to wait on her customers for more time during the evenings.

loans.use: To buy a solar-powered electrical plant.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a hardworking businessman who is 24 years old and married. For the last two years, he has been managing a carpentry business to earn a living. He plans to use this loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy timber. He has used his previous loans from Kiva field partner Faulu Kenya to boost his business.

loans.use: to buy timber

loans.name: Givi

texts.en:
Givi is from Kareli, Kartli region, East Georgia. He is 46 years old, married and lives with his wife Marina and family, consisting of two daughters (ages 20 and 15) and his parents.  Marina works as teacher.  Their oldest daughter is a high-school student and the youngest goes to school. Givi’s parents are retired. 

His main source of income comes from agricultural activities.  They have a milk cow and sell cheese at the local market.  The family also owns one pig and 10 piglets.  Piglets are sold in the village as well.  Givi grows tomatoes and cabbages on family owned and rented land. Harvested vegetables are sold locally to green grocery retailers. 

Total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris.  Givi is requesting a loan to cultivate land, buy wheat for sowing as well as feed for pigs. 

Givi will harvest the wheat and sell it locally.  After fattening his pig and piglets during the winter he will sell them for good prices in late winter or spring. 

The loan will help Givi increase his family's income and their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay to the tractor for land tilling service,  to purchase  wheat for seading as well as feed for pigs

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en: Sokheng is a garment factory worker earning $2 per day. Her husband has a small shop to do electronic repairs from which he earns $6 per day. They have two children, one is studying and the other is too young to go to school. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $6 on electricity, $20 on house rent, $3 on school fees, and $7 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy equipment for electrical repairs to help her husband’s career. This loan will help her husband to have enough equipment that can provide better service to his customers. The couple plans to extend their shop and wants to open an electric repairing school so that they can make other income.

loans.use: To buy equipment for electrical repairs to help her husband's career.

loans.name: Siomara

texts.es:
Siomara, de 63 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos, los cuales, ya son independientes, ella es comerciante, tiene una pulpería y además vende comida los fines de semana. Inicia esta actividad hace  6 años cuando a su esposo lo jubilaron y se quedo sin trabajo, ella necesitaba apoyar a su esposo porque no alcanzaba con la pensión que le daban tenia que terminar de pagar los estudios universitarios a sus hijos y no era suficiente con solo la pensión que recibían fue entonces que busco la manera de generar ingresos a su hogar por su propia cuenta. Primero comenzó a vender leña y frijoles cosidos a medida que fue creciendo fue agregando nuevos productos para vender y que son parte de las necesidades propias de su barrio , luego se puso a vender comida los fines de semana vende comidas típicas y sopas de esta manera ha venido sobreviviendo poco a poco . 
Ella realizo el préstamo para comprar productos tales como arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, huevo, verduras, frutas, jugos, sodas, pan, caramelos, enlatados, snacks para surtir su    pulpería poco a poco, mejorar sus ventas. Uno de sus planes es repara algunas partes de su hogar que están en deterioro, comprar vitrinas y estantes para exhibir sus productos.
texts.en:
Siomara is 63, married, and has two children who are already on their own. She has a small general store. In addition, she sells meals on weekends. 

She began her business six years ago when her husband was given his retirement, and was left with no work. She needed to support her husband, because he couldn't manage with the pension that they gave him. They had to stop paying for their children's university studies, and they didn't have enough with only the pension they were receiving.  It was then that she looked for a way of generating household income on her own account. 

First, she began to sell firewood and cooked beans.  As this business began to grow, she started adding new products to sell; household necessities used in the neighborhood. Later, she began to sell meals on weekends. 

She sells traditional dishes and soups, and in this way, she has been getting by, little by little. She undertook the loan in order to buy products such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, beans, eggs, vegetables, fruit, juices, soft drinks, bread, candy, canned goods, and snacks. These are needed to stock her small general store little by little, and improve her sales. 

One of her plans is to repair a few parts of her home that are damaged, and to buy windows, and shelves to display her products.

loans.use: To buy products such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, beans, eggs, vegetables, fruit, juices, soft drinks, bread, candy, canned goods, and snacks, in order to stock her small general store.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 24 years old and single.  He runs a retail shop selling electrical goods.  He has been operating this business for four years.  He employs two people to assist him in the business.  

Michael is requesting a loan for  60,000 Kenya shillings, which he will use to renovate his business premise and add stock of sockets, switches, and electric cables.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has improved his business and has become more financially stable. His desire is to open other outlets of his business in five years.

loans.use: to renovate his business premises and add stock of sockets, switches, and electric cables.

loans.name: Simana C Group

texts.en:
Judith takes care of four children at home. In the recent 2011 season, Judith had a very good maize yield harvesting 8 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Judith was only able to harvest 2.5 bags of maize on ½ an acre of land. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to feed her family and to access fertilizers and hybrid seeds. With income from maize sales, Judith will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

Judith is the facilitator of the Simana C Group. In the photograph above, Judith is pictured with her group members. Judith and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Simana C Group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Judith and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Maria Gabriela

texts.es: María Gabriela se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene 2 hijos bajo su cargo, a los que les brinda alimento, salud y vestimenta. Uno de los sueños que María tiene es seguir adelante con su negocio uno de los problemas más frecuentes que atraviesa es el no tener suficiente inventario para ofrecer variedad de productos a sus clientes. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de sabanas, cosméticos, cremas, perfumes, calzado, reloj y ropa en general. Ella tiene que salir a ofrecer sus productos de manera ambulante para obtener nuevos clientes.
texts.en: María Gabriela sells general merchandise.  She has two children in her care; she provides them with food, health and clothing.  One of María’s dreams is to stay in business but one of her frequent problems is not having enough inventory on hand to provide variety to her customers.  The reason for the loan is to buy sheets, cosmetics, creams, perfume, footwear, watches and clothing in general.  To obtain new customers she has to go out and sell her wares as a street vendor.

loans.use: to buy sheets, cosmetics, creams, perfume, footwear, watches and clothing in general.

loans.name: Melchor

texts.en:
Melchor loves his family a lot so he works untiringly in his one-hectare corn field. He plants and harvests corn and sells to traders. He earns about PHP20,000. He is sending three children to school. Two of his children are in high school and one is in college education, so the income was just enough for their school expenses. Sometimes, the family suffers financial shortage because of their expenses.

Melchor is now asking for a loan of PHP10,000 to buy two sacks of rice seeds and four bags of fertilizers used in farming.

Someday, Melchor would like to keep producing abundant harvests to earn a higher income and to provide for all of his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of rice seeds and four bags of fertilizers used in farming.

loans.name: Reachiel

texts.en: Reachiel is 30 year-old married woman with four children — all of them in school. She has had a business selling food stuff in Bor, South Sudan for three years. Reachiel is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and oil to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is married with three children. She is 34 years old and lives in Migcanaway, Tangub City. 

Anita sells "banana cue" (fried bananas on a stick) to earn a living and has had this business for six years. Every month she earns 3,000 PHP from it. 

She has requested a loan of Php 6,700 to purchase bananas, barbecue sticks and charcoal. In 2009, Anita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she hopes to increase her savings for the future needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, barbecue sticks and charcoal.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa, who is married to a farmer, extracts palm kennel oil for sale in Abrafo near Abura. In business for seven years now, she uses her income to support her husband to pay their accomodation bills. Her loan will be used to purchase more palm kernels for the extraction of oil to sell. With the new profit, Adjoa will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase palm kernels for the extraction of oil to sell.

loans.name: Niveen

texts.en:
This is Niveen’s second loan cycle with Ryada. Her previous loan helped her to develop her business and had a positive outcome. Today, Niveen is planning to keep on developing her business to make sure that her children will have the best lives and education and, at the same time, ensuring that her customers are satisfied. 

She decided to take this loan to purchase a power generator and bottles to fill with the soap she makes and sells in her grocery store. Niveen is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success in her business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a power generator and bottles to fill with the soap she makes and sells in her grocery store.

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es: La Sra. Martha trabaja para una escuela publica en el municipio desde hace 30 años como profesora atendiendo a niños entre las edades de 10 - 12 años, actualmente agradece a ceprodel por haberle facilitado este credito para realizar mejoras en su casa de habitacion con la compra de materiales para constrccion como cemento,ladrillos mano de obra
texts.en: Martha has worked for a public school in her municipality for 30 years as a professor teaching children between 10 and 12 years old.  Currently, thanks to Ceprodel for facilitating this loan, she will be able to make improvements on her home with the purchase of construction materials, such as cement, bricks and labor.

loans.use: to improve her home.

loans.name: Enyima Une Nkunyundzi Group

texts.en:
Amadu is a member of Enyima Une Nkunyundzi group. All the group members belong to registered vibrant farming association.  Amadu is  45years old this year and is happily married with two children aged 18 and 8. Both of his children are in school. Amadu lives with his family in Efutu Koforidua, in the Central Region of Ghana. 

Amadu has been farming for the past 12 years and has gained much experience. He grows oranges on a 10-acre  land. He is also a tailor, and though the tailoring business is doing well, his main source of income is still the farm.

Amadu's farming association has obtained a contractual agreement with a local company that  purchases the crops  for processing into juice. He just needs to maximize his yield now, and his only challenge  is the difficulty in getting the micro loans from financial institutions locally to finance the costs required to maintain the farm. In particular, Amadu needs to hire laborers for weeding, pruning and harvesting the crops. He also needs to purchase inputs such as fertilizer and insect traps. Without such inputs, Amadu's harvest would be much poorer as his crops will not grow well and may even be destroyed by fruit flies. A micro loan of GHC2,000 will help increase his yield significantly, and his profits would far exceed the capital he needs to invest in his farms now. Amadu will use the gain from the farm to care for his family and also help pay the school fees for his children. Amadu thanks all micro-lenders for their generous assistance.

loans.use: to hire laborers to work on the farm and to purchase farming inputs such as fertilizer and insect traps.

loans.name: Khin Pyant Gyi Village

texts.en:
Located in Central Myanmar’s Magway township, this community currently has 47 village customers, including 10 CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members who help to lead the loan program in the area. There are a total of 144 households and farms in the village, and raising livestock and climbing palm trees are the main sources of income. The village is suffering from a water shortage because there is only one community water basin for village usage, and it is difficult to store the water in the rainy season. They are now fundraising money to re-dig that water basin after this crop season. As all of the villagers are Buddhists, they must save for regular cultural ceremonies, such as providing provisions to monks.

The new loan will help those borrowers to buy fertilizer and hire laborers for their peanut, pigeon pea, and green gram farms.  These days, labor charges are higher, and farmers have to spend a lot of money to finish weeding and harvesting. It costs about $100 to hire the labor necessary to cultivate one acre. In addition to spending on farming inputs, some borrowers aspire to use the loan to raise livestock, such as goats and cows. Not only do these animals help on their farm, but their manure can be used as a natural fertilizer, helping farmers save money on expensive chemical fertilizer.

Pictured above are the committee members from the CBO: U Sein, U Win, U Soe, U Aung, U Kyaw, Daw Phyu, Daw Thuzar, Daw Khin, and Daw YeYe. Included in the photo (third from the right) is U Kyaw, who is a 37-year-old single farmer who has 4 family members. He is looking after his family and pays for his nephew's education. He purchased farming inputs with his previous loan and will use his new loan to do the same.

loans.use: to help 47 villagers buy fertilizer, hire laborers, and raise livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on business

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo Jossefa Z., 39 years of age and a son of livestock breeders, was born in Mugazine in the Catembe District. Being a father of 4 and having worked 10 years in South Africa, he obtained little understanding of his family’s business. He returned to Mozambique after the general peace agreement terminated a 16-year conflict and brought with him a truck allowing him to transport freight and passengers from Catembe to the South African border. He worked with this vehicle for many years, and it broke down at the end of 2000. Beginning in 2001 he worked as a driver, no longer self-employed. With the money earned as a driver we was able to purchase another smaller freight vehicle to transport freight from his small grocery store. At this time, he obtained a mini bus that necessitated repair to transport people with a degree of security. With the present loan he intends to repair the mini bus so that he can again transport passengers, a job he considers his forte. His transportation business has a positive impact on the community. There is a shortage of local transportation, and Alfredo hopes to minimize this problem while also guaranteeing two more jobs, including himself.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Alfredo Jossefa Z., de 39 anos de idade, nasceu em Mugazine Distrito de Catembe, filho de Criadores de gado. Tem pouco nível de escolaridade característica própria de família de criadores. É pai de 4 filhos tendo trabalhado durante 10 anos na Africa do Sul, regressou a Moçambique depois do acordo geral de paz que terminaram com o conflito que durou 16 anos, donde trouxe um camião pelo qual fazia transporte de carga e passageiros da Catembe até a fronteira com África do Sul. Trabalhou com esta viatura durante longos anos e veio avariar nos finas de 2000 e a partir de 2001 começou a trabalhar como motorista. Com os rendimentos conseguiu compra outra viatura pequena de carga para transporte de carga da sua lojinha de venda de produtos de 1ª necessidade. Neste momento adquiriu uma Mini bus que precisa de uma reparação para transporte de pessoas com certa segurança. Com o presente crédito pretende reparar a Mini-bus de forma a recomeçar com actividade de Transporte de Passageiro que é o seu forte. Este actividade tem um impacto positivo, pois há carência de transporte no local onde pretende desenvolver a actividade e com este meio irá minimizar os problema da falta de transporte que afecta a zona bem como garantir mais dois postos de trabalho contando com ele próprio.

loans.use: To buy spares to repair mini bus

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph M. M. is 24 years old and is married with one child. He is also the firstborn in his family and has to take care of his siblings six of who are all of school going age. His mother is a single and has no any other source of help other than his son. He owns a semi-permanent shop where he sells small electronic items (like pocket size radios), caps and bags. He intends to get a better shop and buy more stock to be able to earn more income .
He is requesting for a loan of US$800 to help him expand his business.US$300 to rent and furnish the shop,US$200 to pay for the local authority licenses.,US$300 to buy stock. Given this loan, he will be able to improve his business and thus earn more return to meet all his family needs  effectively

loans.use: To be able to buy general electronic accessories needed to expand his business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita is 25 years old and has been separated from her husband for two years because of his abuse to her. She has two children and works by making little cakes filled with caramelized condensed milk which she sells as a traveling merchant. She belongs to the group “Montebello 4” together with Ms. Jacqueline Vasquez Arcos who sells shoes by catalog. With the loan, Margarita will purchase flour, eggs, corn starch, milk, and sugar while Jacqueline will expand her shoe business.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Margarita tiene 25 años y hace dos años que se encuentra separada de su esposo por el maltrato que le daba . Se quedo con dos hijos, ella trabaja haciendo y vendiendo pastelitos rellenos con manjar y los vende de manera ambulante. Pertenece al grupo Montebello 4 junto con doña Jacqueline Vasquez Arcos (vende zapatos por catalogos). Con el prestamo Margarita comprara harina , huevos , leche, maizena, azucar y Jacqueline ampliara el negocio de los zapatos.

loans.use: Sales of cakes

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
AMALIA is 40 years old, she has four children. She is separated from her husband. She sells sandwiches, tacos, hamburgers, quesadillas, etc. She started this business by renting the restaurant premises six months. It’s located 20 minutes from house. She will use part of the loan to refit the place in order to offer her clients a good service. She is a part of a group called “Primavera 5” together with Mrs Francisca Vázquez Morales (grocery store), she will use her loan to buy more merchandise like sugar, coffee, salt, rice, oil, cookies, refreshments, others.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

AMALIA tiene 40 años, cuatro hijos, separada de su esposo. Ella vende tortas, tacos, hamburguesas, quesadillas, otros. Hace como seis meses que inicio con este negocio rentando un local ubicada a 20 minutos de su casa. Con la parte de su préstamo invertirá en el acondicionamiento del lugar para ofrecer a sus clientes un buen servicio. Forma parte del grupo Primavera 5 junto con doña Francisca Vázquez Morales (tienda de abarrotes), ella invertirá su préstamo en el surtido de la tienda comprando azúcar, café, sal, arroz, aceite, galletas, refrescos, otros.

loans.use: Refit restaurant premises.

loans.name: Prum

texts.en: Mrs. Prum T., aged 36, works selling vegetables and earns about $1 of profit per day.  Her husband is a farmer and grows vegetables to sell, earning about $1.60 per day.  They have five children. One child works at a private company, earning about $2 per day, and the other four children are students.  For the past few years, the family has rented the plot of farmland they grow their vegetables on.  Mrs. Prum T. is requesting a loan of $500 in order to purchase a plot of farmland of their own along with additional seeds to grow their own crops to sell in the market.

loans.use: To purchase land and seeds to farm.

loans.name: Mukaram

texts.en:
Mukaram has been engaged in business for over 10 years. She is married and has five children. Her business is located at the big food market in Spitamen, district of Khujand,Tadjikistan.

She became a client of MLF Microinvest in 2007 and her first loan was for 200 somoni. During her experience in the market, she has attracted many clients and has learned much about their taste preferences.She always tries to meet their needs and quickly innovates her assortment according their needs.

She sells macaroni products from local workshops and presents herself as both a responsible and punctual business partner. Now, she wants to add confectionery products to her assortment, as she knows that the demand for these kinds of products in the holiday season will be more expansive then other time.

loans.use: To purchase confectionery  and macaroni food products.

loans.name: Esmelda  Maria

texts.es:
Esmelda began her business with a small amount of capital, C$3000 córdobas, a product of her and her husband’s savings. Now 5 years have passed that they started this business and she always has the unconditional support of her family providing attention to their customers.

With effort, sacrifice, and the goal of improving their children’s day-to-day quality of life she has obtained loans with Ceprodel for the past two years, during which time she has received 6 loans that have contributed to her increased inventory, a variety of seafood products, better conditions in her locale, and, enabled her children to study in school.

Esmelda has as a goal to continue this activity with Ceprodel’s financial support so that she can make reality her dream of her children studying at the university.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Esmelda inicia su negocio con un pequeño capital propio de C$3,000 córdobas, producto del ahorro en conjunto con su marido. Ya han transcurrido 5 años desde que inicia esta actividad siempre con el apoyo incondicional de su familia que le ayudan en la atención de sus clientes.

Con esfuerzo, sacrificio y la meta de mejorar día a día la calidad de vida de sus hijos ha obtenido créditos en CEPRODEL desde hace dos años, durante los cuales ha administrado 6 créditos los que han contribuido en el incremento de su inventario, variedad de productos en mariscos, mejores condiciones en su local, y por ende, permite que sus hijos estudien.

. La Sra. Esmelda tiene como propósito seguir con esta actividad con apoyo financiero de CEPRODEL para que realice su mayor sueño el que sus hijos estudien en la universidad.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of fish

loans.name: Joselin

texts.en: Joselin is an eighteen-year-old, new mother. She sells new and used clothing to the men of her community. Joselin explains that she needs a lot of money to cover all of her household expenses. Each and every day, Joselin visits friends and neighbors to sell her goods. On weekends, she offers her products at the public market, where more people can see the garments and purchase her goods. Joselin hopes to have her own store in the near future so it would be easier for her customers to purchase her products. With this loan, she would buy more products to increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase clothing in bulk to supply the entrepreneur's business.

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es:
I have a wooden fence around my home, but I would like to start building a concrete protective wall. I am also planning on building an additional brick room, but what I need above all is the wall because I feel that I would be safer and more protected. For this project, I need a bigger investment. I am requesting a loan of $300.00 in order to build a protective wall around my house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo una cerca de madera en mi vivienda pero me gustaría empezar a construir una barda de concreto, tengo pensado también construir un cuarto en mi vivienda de block, pero ahora me urge más la barda ya que siento que estaría más segura y protegida y además para eso se necesita una inversión mayor ”. Solicito $ 300.00 dlls para construir una barda en mi vivienda.

loans.use: Construction of protective wall

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabrina has belonged to the Wiñarisun communal bank, which means "We grow" in Quechua, for three years. She is 46 years old, married and has six children. She sells meat at a post in the centeral market Monday-Saturday, and on Sundays she travels to the different fairs in the region to purchase her animals.

Sabrina needs a loan of 2000 soles ($750) to invest in the purchase of cattle. She will use her earnings to feed her children and pay for their education. Her dreams are for her children to be successful, to improve her business and to build a home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Sabina pertenece al Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa “Crezcamos” en quechua hace 3 años.

Sabina es casada, tiene 46 años y 6 hijos, Sabina venD. carne en un puesto del mercado Central, actividad que realiza D. lunes a sábado, los días domingos junto a su esposo viajan a las diferentes ferias D. la región donD. compran los animales.

Sabina necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. ganado vacuno.

Sus ahorros lo utilizará para la educación y alimentación D. sus hijos. Los sueños D. Sabina son que sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar su negocio y construir su casa.

loans.use: Purchase cattle / Sabina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado vacuno.

loans.name: Mwazani's Motomoto Group

texts.en:
Mwazani is 34 years old and is a married woman with 4 children, ages 9, 6, 5 and 2 years old. Mwazani has been a fish seller, since 2007. Everyday, she works from 10am to 9pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Dionisia and Subira, who have businesses dealing in clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Progresando Alcohuillca Group

texts.es:
The Community Bank “Alcohuillca Progressing” is a young bank which is beginning its second cycle with thirteen members. The members are all from the community of Alcohuillca in the district of Iguain, around one hour from the town of Ayacucho.

The members are engaged in different businesses such as fruit-selling, raising suckling-pigs, groceries, livestock raising and offer services such as carpentry. They are also engaged in agriculture.

The members need different amounts of loans: some of 300 sols, some of 600 sols and some of 900 sols, making a total of 6 900 sols in loans from the Community Bank.

The loans will be invested in the purchase of oranges, bananas, mandarins, apples, suckling-pigs, wood, rice, sugar, noodles and young animals.

The dreams of the members are to have a house in Ayacucho town, to provide their children with good educations and to see their businesses prosper.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

El Banco Comunal Progresando Alcohuillca es un Banco joven que inicia su segundo ciclo con 13 socios. Las socias son provenientes de la comunidad de Alcohuillca, distrito de Iguain que esta ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como venta de frutas, cochinilla, abarrotes, ganado, brindan servicios de carpintería y también se dedican a agricultura.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de préstamos, algunos montos son de 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, haciendo un total de 6,900 soles de préstamos en el Banco Comunal.

Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra de naranja, plátano, mandarina, manzanas, cochinilla, madera, arroz, azúcar, fideo y animales menores.

Los sueños de las socias son tener una casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y que sus negocios prosperen.

loans.use: The loans will be invested in the purchase of oranges, bananas, mandarins, apples, suckling-pigs, wood, rice, sugar, noodles and young animals.

loans.name: Chaom

texts.en: Mrs. Chaom S., 27, lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia, home to the famous Angkor Wat temples. She is a housewife and her husband is a motor-taxi driver. The couple has two young children. Chaom would like to help her husband’s business and is seeking to borrow $700. With the loan, she will purchase a new motorbike to replace his old one, as well as purchase a trailer so that he can run a tuk-tuk (a motorbike powered cart) taxi business.

loans.use: Chaom would like to replace an old motorbike and purchase a tuk tuk.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is a hard working woman who is always looking to give the best to her family. Along with her husband, she sells pork wholesale, taking advantage of the expanses of land that they own which are adequate for a pig ranch. The process for processing pork is: first kill the pigs, then place them over a fire to remove their hair, then after an extensive washing, clean them and then she takes them to the local markets. She has been doing this for 12 years, her constant motivation is to improve her economic situation in order to educate her two children, ages 10 and 9. Her wish is to increase the quantity of pigs in her stable, for which she is asking for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Rosa es una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre esta buscando dar lo mejor a su familia, junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta de carne de cerdo al por mayor, aprovechando las amplias extensiones de terreno que poseen, adecuados para una granja de cerdos, el proceso para ello es; primero los mata, los pone al fuego para quitarle todo el pelaje, luego de una exhaustiva lavada, los limpia y lleva a más ferias de su localidad.Lleva 12 años en esta labor, su motivación constante está en la mejora de la economía para educar a sus 2 hijos de 10 y 9 años.Su deseo es aumentar la cantidad de cerdos en su establo, para lo cual está solicitando un préstamo este préstamo.

loans.use: increase the quantity of pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Siaka

texts.fr:
Monsieur Siaka Koné est âgé de  30 ans et vit avec ses  3 enfants et son épouse dans une famille monogame à Noumouso, un des quartiers de la ville de kadiolo (Région de Sikasso République du Mali). 
Après plusieurs activités économiques sans succès, il s’est spécialisé dans l’achat vente des produits céréaliers(maïs, sorgho, mil, riz, pois de terre etc) depuis  maintenant  plusieurs années.
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires afin de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida d’intégrer le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à sa prémière expérience 
Avec ce prêt, il compte acheter 600kg de maïs et 400kg de sorgho sur place  à Kadiolo et dans les villages environnants généralement les jours de foires hebdomadaires auprès de producteurs céréaliers.
Il les  revend  le plus souvent en gros  au comptant  aux achéteurs qui viennent  des grandes villes telles  Bamako(capitale de la république du Mali) ou  Sikasso et quelques fois en détail et au comptant dans la ville de Kadiolo.  La plupart de sa clientèle est constituée d’hommes.
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel  de 60 000 FCFA qu’il utilisera pour payer les intérêts du prêt et investir le reste dans ses affaires.
texts.en:
Mr. Siaka Koné is 30 years old and lives with his 3 children and wife in a monogamous household in Noumouso, one of the districts in the city of Kadiolo (in the Sikasso Region of the Republic of Mali). After trying several business activities without success, he has specialized in the purchase and sale of cereal products (maize, sorghum, millets, rice, groundnuts, etc) for several years now. In his search for supplementary financial resources in order to satisfy the needs of his increasingly growing clientele, he decided to join the credit program run by the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, which whom he is seeking his first loan. With this loan, he intends to buy 600kg of maize and 400kg of sorghum on-the-spot from the cereal producers in Kadiolo and in the surrounding villages, generally during the weekly fairs. He most often re-sells the grains wholesale in cash to buyers who come from large cities such as Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali) or Sikasso. He also sometimes sells at retail in cash in the city of Kadiolo. The majority of his clientele consists of men. He foresees realizing a monthly profit of 60,000 FCFA, which he will use to pay off the loan, investing the remainder in his business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereals (maize and sorghum)

loans.name: Marina Yolinda

texts.es:
La señora Marina Yolinda O. tiene treintaicinco años,  vive en la calle Nazareno 214 en el distrito de Mache provincia de Otuzco departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Marina  estudió primaria completa, pero no pudo continuar estudiando porque en el distrito que habitaba solamente había escuela primaria, sus padres no la pudieron apoyar económicamente para continuar estudiando en otro lugar.
Se comprometió con el señor Jorge Santos Pozo Zavaleta con el que tiene dos hijos varones y una hija mujer, los tres estudiantes.
Empezó su negocio vendiendo quesillo, tuvo una bodega en el caserío Cruz de Mayo pero tuvo que cerrarla porque fue a vivir a Mache para poder educar a sus hijos, continua con el negocio de quesillo y compra venta de animales menores.
Manuela Ramos me prestó por primera ves 300 soles con lo que compré quesillo, hice queso y los vendí a buen precio, manifiesta, también recuerda que el préstamo lo devolvió en cuatro meses. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1000 soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará quesillo para hacer queso y volver a vender.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres de Mache desde hace más de cuatro años. 
Su gran sueño es ver a sus hijos profesionales y que vivan en el lugar donde ellos sean muy felices.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marina Yolinda O. is 35 years old; she lives on Nazareno Street in Mache, Otuzco in the state of La Libertad, Peru. Marina finished elementary school, but could not continue studying since in the district where she lived, there was only elementary school and her parents could not afford to send her elsewhere to go to high school. She married Jorge Santos Pozo Zavaleta with whom she has two sons and one daughter; all three are students. She started her business selling cheese; she had a small shop in the Cruz de Mayo farmhouse but she had to close it when she went to live in Mache where she could more easily educate her children. She still works selling cheese and buying and selling small animals. She received her first loan from the Manuela Ramos organization of $125 which she used to buy cheese which she sold at a good price. She was able to repay the loan in 4 months. With this $125 loan which she will repay in 4 payments, she will purchase more cheese which she will sell. She has belonged to the Women of Mache village bank for the past 4 years. She dreams of seeing her children become professionals and that they can live where they will be happy.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cheese

loans.name: Ericka De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Ericka habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, barrio ubicado en la capital  de Managua, tiene la edad de 34 años, se encuentra casada con el señor Martín de Jesús Palacios, el cual es taxista y le ayuda a los gastos de la casa, juntos tienen 3 hijos de 7, 8 y 9 años de edad quienes están estudiando. Actualmente la señora Ericka se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada donde empezó esta actividad con dinero que su esposo le proporcionó para que iniciara su negocio; hace 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad, ella esta solicitando un crédito de C$  7,000 a un plazo de 9 meses para comprar material de construcción y poner verjas y ladrillo  en su casa, donde aspira seguir mejorando poco a poco su vivienda, y también seguir creciendo con su negocio para que le permita tener una  estabilidad económica buena.
texts.en:
Ericka lives in the Sandino Memorial neighborhood, a neighborhood located in the capital city, Managua. She is 34 years old, married to Mr. Martín de Jesús Palacios, who is a taxi driver and helps her with the household expenses. Together they have 3 children ages 7, 8, and 9 who are all in school. Today Ericka sells new and used clothing. She began this business with money her husband gave her to start her business, and she has had this business for 6 years. She is asking for a loan of C$7,000 for a term of 9 months to buy construction materials and put wrought iron railings and brick on her home, where she hopes to continue improving little by little her home, and also continue growing her business which will enable her to have good economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put wrought iron railings and brick on her home

loans.name: Komla

texts.en:
Komla A. is 29 years old, married with children. He lives in Wome, a small town approximately 130 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Wome is situated in a lush and beautiful area of Togo near the border with Ghana, but it is somewhat isolated. 

Because of his town’s location, Komla operates a taxi-moto business. Many residents of Wome take taxi-motos to nearby villages and Komla’s services are always in demand. Komla picks up passengers along the road and drops them off at their destination. 

To better serve his clients, Komla hopes to use this loan from Kiva to buy a newer, more comfortable motorcycle.  With the profits he will earn from this improvement, Komla can better provide for his family and save money to send the children to school.

loans.use: To buy a new motocycle

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Mrs. Lim L., 40, and her husband, Mr. Sophorn Horn, 39, live in a small village across from the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1988 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Three of their children study in local school and the oldest one weaves silk at home. 

Lim has been a silk weaver for 5 years, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to middlemen in the village, who sell them in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been building wooden houses for 5 years. The couple also grows rice in their rice farm near the village.

Lim is requesting a loan of $500. She will use some of it to purchase silk materials for her weaving business. With the remainder, she will buy fertilizer, pesticide, and rice seed for growing rice.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and rice seed for growing.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A., 60, is a widowed mother of nine children.  She has four female and five male children.  She says her last born is currently in senior high school.  The rest of her children have completed school and are employed.  

Comfort trades yams and charcoal.  She buys her goods from Atebubu and Ejura, in the Brong Ahafo and Ashanti Regions respectively.  She buys the goods at a low-price in those locations, and then she sells some at the local market and also treks to other towns to supply to food vendors.  Comfort has been in business for over 15 years. She wants a loan to buy goods in bulk so that she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy yams and bags of charcoal

loans.name: Chhuon

texts.en:
S. has been farming for a long time and she specializes in growing rice.  It is a skill she learned from her grandparents. 

She is 24 years old, married and has two children, both of whom are teenagers and in school.  Her husband is a local fisherman and also helps his wife in growing rice. 

The couple is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike that will be used to ride for catching fish.  The family lives in Pursat Province and they appear in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Ouch

texts.en: Ouch O., 46, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Takeo, Cambodia. She and her husband sell fish at the market and are able to make US$ 25 in revenue per day. They also get support from two of their children who work as construction workers. This couple needs to ask for a loan to purchase more fish to re-sell.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to re-sell

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
Osman I. is 45 years old. He supports his wife, their three children and his parents who all live with Osman in one house. Osman makes traditional Azerbaijan bread called ”tendir.” He has been working at baking since he was 20. He believes that this business is profitable and is not subject to seasonality. He gets up early and bakes tendir and bread so that people have the fresh bread on their tables for breakfast. He purchases all the input materials like flour, salt, and yeast in the local market.

Now due to high demand, Osman wants to increase the quantity of bread he makes, so he requests $1200 for a term of 15 months. The loan will be used to purchase more flour and also coal for baking. In the future he dreams of opening his own workshop and with the profit, building his own house. Osman deeply appreciates the trust and support you give him.

loans.use: to purchase more flour to increase bread production

loans.name: Maria Maxima

texts.es:
La Señora Maxima S. se dedica a la venta D. diferentes tipos D. masas, pasteles y otros hace tres años cuando se retiro D. Enfermera, es cliente en  tercera secuencia recomendada por otra cliente antigua D. la zona, ella tiene la unica reposteria D. la zona y es conocida por el agradable sabor que le da a los productos que venD.. Sus principales productos que elabora son: tortas, alfajores, empanadas, etc. 
La cliente muestra ser muy responsable en sus pagos.
Actualmente ella  trabaja, ocasionalmente, como enfermera con pacientes D. la tercera edad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maxima S. started selling pastries three years ago, when she retired from a career in nursing. She was originally recommended by another client in the area, and this is her third loan cycle. Maxima has the only bakery in her neighborhood and is well known for the delicious flavors of her products. Her primary products are cakes, tarts, and empanadas. Maxima has shown herself to be very responsible in her repayments. She now occasionally also works as a nurse for senior citizens.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy flour and other ingredients for the bakery

loans.name: Norman

texts.en:
Being a member of Paglaum Multi-purpose Cooperative, one of Kiva's field partners, is a great opportunity for Norman D.. He is thirty-one years old, married and lives at Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City. He is a tricycle-taxi driver and his wife is a homemaker. 
    
Due to the global economic crisis, he felt strongly the need to have additional income besides what he earns  from driving. He joined the cooperative in order to get capital for his newly opened "sari-sari" (general) store. His wife will be the manager. Today, he wants a loan of $275 to buy additional goods to sell and to purchase a secondhand motorcab. He also plans to buy another motorcycle for hire.

loans.use: To buy additional goods for sari-sari

loans.name: Hellena

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 45 year old Helena M. from Dar es Salaam. She is divorced with three children between the ages of 15 and 22.  Helena has been running a retail shop business since 2000. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, seven days per week. Helena currently earns about 120 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase stock in bulk. In the future, she plans to improve her business. Helena thanks you for your support!
	
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future

loans.use: To purchase stock in bulk.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia A. M. sells radios, bags, belts, and polish at Abura. Felicia has received Senior High School education. She is married and has 4 dependents. Her husband is a poultry farmer.

Felicia has been selling radios, bags, belts, and polish since 2002. She is responsible for paying school fees and housekeeping expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more radios, bags, belts and polish for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest to expand her business and increase her profit.
