loans.use: buy more radios, bags, belts and polish for resale

loans.name: Hope

texts.en: Hope A. sells second-hand fridges. She has been in this business for a long time. She is married with 5 children and she is 50 years old. She is requesting the loan amount of N 150,000 to purchase more second-hand fridges to sell. Hope says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand fridges to sell

loans.name: Hort

texts.en: Hort K., 57, is involved in a business in the agriculture sector. He plants corn and farms tree fruit for sale on his plot of land, located about 30 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. He has a typical income of US$ 2.5 approximately. He is married and has three children. One of his children is a student, and the rest are employed at a garment factory. He also specializes in traditional fishing. He produces ordinary fishing tools and goes fishing on his own. Seeing an opportunity to generate a better income for his family in agriculture sector, Teng is asking for a loan of US $800 to expand his business by purchasing corn seeds, fertilizer, manure and materials for creating fishing tools.

loans.use: To buy fishing tools, corn seed, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Tserenhuu

texts.en:
Tserenhuu and her husband have been sewing and selling clothes together for a long time.  Before 2001 they sewed and sold suits at the old open market in the capital.  Once Narantuul, the new and bigger market, opened in 2001, they moved to that market and bought their own booth. They buy their material from the same market.  They work hard and have always been able to maintain a profit. 

They live with their two sons on property owned by their relatives in a Mongolian Ger (nomadic housing tent). Both children are attending local elementary schools. With money from this loan she wants to expand the business so that they will be able to afford a place of their own, in a building instead of a ger. She is a very quiet, pleasant, and unassuming lady.

About XacBank:

Founded in 1998, XacBank is a community development bank and microfinance institution in Mongolia, and is headquartered in Ulaanbaatar.  It currently serves approximately 16,000 micro clients at 76 branches in all 21 aymags (provinces) in Mongolia, making it the largest microfinance institution in the country.

XacBank's mission is to contribute to sustainable development of Mongolia that can come only from educated and skilled people and competitive and dynamic businesses concerned equally about Planet, People, and Profit. The Bank will provide equitable access to transparent, reliable and responsive banking products and services to the Bank’s clients, including its traditional Micro-entrepreneurs as well as Small and Medium businesses.

Your loan enables XacBank to expand its microloan capacity and return a portion of the interest back to the borrower at the end of the loan term

To learn more, please visit the XacBank website at: www.xacbank.mn.

loans.use: To purchase fabric

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new welding machine

loans.name: Las Madres Group

texts.es:
El grupo las madres está conformado por Darling del Socorro D. M., quien es la coordinadora del grupo, Rosa M. y Verónica del Socorro A., tres mujeres provenientes de  la Ciudad de Managua; de la comarca las Pilas, que está ubicada en la zona urbana de la ciudad. Este Grupo, inicia ya el Octavo ciclo de crédito con ADIM y pretenden seguir adelante hasta ver cumplidas sus metas y sueños.

Doña Darling, de treinta y un años de edad, quien desde hace tres años por motivos de la situación económica que afecta el mundo, inicio  su propio negocio, para respaldar el trabajo de su esposo y poder contar con dinero suficiente para las necesidades de su hogar. Así decidió iniciar la venta de Lentes de Sol de manera ambulante y ha ido incrementando la variedad de productos con cada ciclo de crédito en ADIM.

Doña Rosa M. quien vende cosméticos de la Zermat en la su comarca y Verónica del Socorro A. quien desde hace dos años inicio una pulpería en su casa de habitación, negocio que le ha ayudado a solventar sus necesidades, son las otras dos integrantes del grupo. Ellas creen poder seguir creciendo a través de los créditos y capacitaciones que han recibido.

loans.use: estilos mas variados de lentes para satisfacer la demanda

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en:
G. Mukaddas is a hard-working married mother of three children. For the past nine years Mukaddas has dedicated herself to selling office supplies. She started her business after her husband's employment with a construction company ended. Without her husband’s income, bills started to pile up so Mukaddas decided to generate her own income to fill the gap. She likes what she sells and has developed a stable enterprise. Now Mukaddas has requested a loan of 5000 TJS to help purchase a new supply of items to sell. This is an important matter for this family's well-being. Please help Mukaddas’s business to grow. She truly appreciates your generosity. More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase office supplies to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan D. S. is a 54-year-old businesswoman who lives in Pasay City with her two children, the eldest of whom is in college and the other is in high school. Susan loves to multi-task in her business activities. She manages her own general store and at the same time manages an adjacent extension of their house as an apartment for rent. She earns close to P15,000 a month from these business endeavors. She uses her profits to support their daily basic needs including school expenses for her children. Susan got to know about the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative and eventually became a member in 2003 after attending a series of teach-ins conducted by a field staff. The loans provided by the cooperative are helpful in the continuous growth of her general store. Susan is applying for a new loan in the amount of P22,000 from the cooperative. She will use the funds to buy more grocery items to sell at her store. A portion of the loan proceeds will be used to renovate some rooms in her apartment. Susan dreams of seeing her children finish their college education. She said that education is the only gift she can leave her children. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for her store and to renovate her rental apartment

loans.name: Esther S.'s Group

texts.en:
These are staff members of a Vocational Institute, in Tonkolili District, northern Sierra Leone. This institution is geared towards the development of the girl child. Their goal is to educate the girl child develop skills that will enable her become self reliant. Thus they offer courses like computer science, typing writing, agriculture, tailoring, gara dyeing, hair dressing, catering and clothe weaving. They cater mainly for girls who could not make it in the formal schooling sector.

This will be the third loan these Borrowers are accessing Kiva Lenders through SMT. Previous loans had created significant impacts into the lives of these Borrowers. Some of them invested the loan into their businesses, others used theirs to settle their children’s school affairs and others use theirs to buy themselves pieces of furniture. 

Esther S. K. is the deputy head mistress of this vocation. Esther (on the left) was born in Magburaka town. Esther is forty-five years of age. She is divorced with four children. Two of her children are in primary schools and two in secondary schools. Esther will use this loan to pay school fees and other school related charges for her children.

loans.use: Pay School Fess and other school related charges

loans.name: Angeles

texts.es: La señora Angeles juntamente con su esposo Pablo, tienen un taller de cerrajeria donde trabaja todo el dia el señor Pablo y ella colabora en los gastos trabajando como empleada del hogar en la zona e Bajo Seguencoma, esta pareja joven tiene 2 hijos pequeños que estudian en la escuela de Chasquipampa. El esposo se dedica a este oficio ya 8 años y con el esfuerzo de ambos lograron comprarse el terreno donde tienen su vivienda  y por referencias de los vecinos sabemos que son personas de bien y responsables
texts.en:
Angeles and her husband Pablo, have a locksmith’s shop where Pablo works at all day and she helps with the expenses by working as a house maid in the Bajo Seguencoma area, this young couple has two small children that study in the Chasquipampa school. Her husband has worked in the shop for eight years and with mutual effort they were able to purchase the land where their house is located and through reference checks with their neighbors we know they are good and responsible people.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital and shop repair

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy sells drinks, groceries, and food to her customers at retail prices. The demand for her drinks is high and, because this is her busy season, she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She is 32 years old and married with 5 children. Her husband is a commercial motorcycle driver. All of her children are in school, except for the youngest who is still to young to attend. 

She is hoping for a loan of N50,000 to purchase a refrigerator so she can sell cold drinks. She is, indeed, grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa P. is from the village of Guinabot. She is 28 years old. Marisa is married and has one young child. To make a living, Marisa sells daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, and food snacks in the local community. Marisa has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Marisa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marisa successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,500 PHP from PMPC. Marisa is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Marisa's second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: 27 De Mayo Group

texts.es: El banco comunal " 27 de Mayo " esta representado por la señora Mariza y conformada por 12 miembros muy alegres y solidarias, pero sobre todo muy trabajadoras como lo demuestran cada día yendo a trabajar de madrugada en sus puestos de venta de pollo, salteñas, cosméticos, comida, joyas, ropa y al servicio de amplificación y electricidad. Dentro del ámbito de venta de comida, ropa y productos de belleza existe mucha competencia por lo que las socias se ven obligadas a mover sus negocios a otros mercados. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición de mercadería, insumos y herramientas para mejorar sus ganancias e incrementar los ingresos para sus hogares. Este grupo se encuentra cursando su segundo ciclo demostrando tener capacidad para administrar los fondos otorgados de forma honesta y puntual ya que de ello depende el crecimiento de sus negocios y por ende el bien de sus familias.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “27 de Mayo” (May 27th) is led by Sra. Mariza and consists of 12 cheerful and supportive members. All of them are hard workers as demonstrated each day when they open their vending stalls early to sell chicken, empanadas, cosmetics, food, jewelry, and clothing. Some members provide amplification and electrical services. In the retail sectors involving food, clothing, and beauty products, there is much competition, so the members are forced to keep their businesses moving to different markets.

This loan will be used for the acquisition of merchandise, supplies, and tools to improve their earnings and increase their household incomes. The group is starting their second loan cycle. They have demonstrated the ability to manage their funds in an honest and timely manner because the growth of their businesses and the welfare of their families depends on their success.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Darling Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La Sra. Darling R. es trabajadora de la Alcaldía de Managua desde hace 11 años, donde desempeña el cargo de Auditor-Supervisor. Ella se preparó profesionalmente como Contador Público.

Es madre soltera con dos personas a su cargo, Y también ayuda a su mamá en lo poco que ella puede. Ella vive en la Villa Miguel Gutiérrez en Managua la capital de Nicaragua, desde hace 30 años.

Es el primer crédito que solicita en CEPRODEL, lo necesita para cubrir los gastos de operación de la vista de su mamá.

Se siente agradecida con CEPRODEL por brindarle este apoyo, y espera no quedarle mal con este crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Darling R. works for the Mayoralty of Managua for some 11 years, where she works as an Auditor Supervisor. She prepared professionally as a public accountant. She is a single mother with two people under her care and she also helps her mother in the little way that she can. She lives in Villa Miguel Gutiérrez in Managua, the capital of Nicaragua for some 30 years. This is the first loan that she will have with CEPRODEL and needs it to cover the costs of her mother’s eye operation. She is thankful to CEPRODEL for supporting her and hopes to not disappoint with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for the eye operation of her mother.

loans.name: Ingrid Lilibeth

texts.es:
la joven Ingrid Lilibeth S. tiene 23 años de edad, vive en el barrio San Juan Bosco de la ciudad de Choluteca, tiene un hijo el cual tiene 1 año de edad.
Ingrid se levanta a las 6 de la mañana todos los dias para preparar sus frutas y salir a venderlas a barrios cercanos de su hogar.
su madre le cuida a su hijos cuando anda vendiendo las frutas y las verduras de forma ambulante.
las naranjas las vende peladas con sal y especias, tambien las vende sin pelar por bolsas de 10 o mas naranjas.
Ingrid necesita el credito para comprar mas frutas y asi tener mas ventas.
las ganancias las necesita para mantener a su hijo, comprarle la leche y las medicinas que necesita.
texts.en:
Ingrid Lilibeth S. is a young woman who is 23 years of age. She lives in the neighborhood of San Juan Bosco in the city of Choluteca. Ingrid has a one year old child.

She wakes up at 6am every day in order to prepare fruits to sell in the neighborhoods near her home. Her mother takes care of her children when she sells fruits and vegetables as a street vendor. The oranges she sells are peeled with salt and spices. She also sells unpeeled oranges in bags containing ten or more.

Ingrid needs a loan to buy more fruit so that she can increase her sales. Her earnings are needed to support her son, and also buy the milk and medicines that he needs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase oranges, tangerines, cassava, and bananas

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn F., 32, is making sure that her family has enough for their daily needs. Married to Elias F., a vendor, she is blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own vegetable stall for quite some time now.

Ailyn has been a regular member of the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times through CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her vegetable-selling business.     

Now with your help, Ailyn would like to apply for a 12,000 PHP loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying additional quantities of vegetables to be incorporated into her current inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she will have more customers and more vegetables to sell.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional quantities of vegetables

loans.name: Iganga Road Group, Jinja

texts.en:
K. Justine in the small photo at the top left also appears in the big photo at the bottom left and she is the leader of her lending group in Jinja.

Justine is 50 years old and married with seven children. She also takes care of one dependent.

Justine is a businesswoman involved in the sale of grain that she has supplied to Ugachick poultry farmers for fifteen years now. She is able to make 500,000/= as monthly profits. She supplies grain millings and she would like to supply more and more as much as she can. She would also like to build her own house for comfort.

Justine needs a loan to be able to buy more maize for her supplies.

loans.use: To buy more maize for her business

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: LA SEÑORA MARIA ELENA, ESTA CASADA TIENE 2 HIJOS QUE SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR TIENE UNA TIENDA DE BARRIO EN SU DOMICILIO DESDE HACE 22 AÑOS, EN LA CASA DE SU MAMA DONDE ELLA TAMBIEN VIVE, TAMBIEN TRABAJA DE PROFESORA, SE DA TIEMPO PARA LAS DOS ACTIVIDADES, ES MUY TRABAJADORA,  LA SEÑORA MARIA ELENA ES MUY ANTIGUA EN LA INTITUCION, DONDE HA DEMOSTRADO SER MUY RESPONSABLE EN SUS PAGOS, EN GRUPOS ESTA EN SU TERCER CICLO Y EN CREDITO INDIVIDUAL ESTA EN SU SEGUNDO CREDITO. CON  EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA VARIEDAD DE PRODUCTOS PARA SURTIR SU TIENDA Y BRINDAR UN MEJOR SERVICIO A SUS CLIENTES, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Elena is married and has two school-age children. She has a neighborhood store that she has managed out of her mother’s home, where she lives, for 22 years. Maria Elena also works as a school teacher and has time for both jobs. She is a hard worker and a long-time client of Emprender.

Maria Elena has demonstrated that she is very responsible with her payments. She participated in three loan cycles with a group and is now on her second individual loan. With this money, she will buy a variety of products to restock her store and provide better service to her customers. She is extremely grateful to Emprender and Kiva for trusting her by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mariano Alexander

texts.es: El Sr. Marinao tiene 23 años de edad es conviviente tiene una hija de 2 años  de edad, su conyugue se dedica como ama de casa, ellos viven en la casa de sus padres ubicado en el Distrito de parcona en casa de un piso de material noble. El se dedica a prestar servcio de transporte urbano en su vehiculo propio, el adquirio su vehiculo hace un año, anteriormente se dedicaba  a trabajos en la mina artesanal. Ellos son una pareja joven con muchas metas y sueños uno de ellos es poder tener su casa propia. Con el dinero que solicita inevrtira en la compra de un terreno.
texts.en:
Mariano, 23, lives with his life partner and has a 2-year-old daughter. His wife is a housewife and they all live in their parents' house located in Parcona district; the house is single story and made of substantial materials. He provides public transportation services in his own vehicle, which he got a year ago. He used to work as a miner. They are a young couple with lots of goals and dreams, one of which is to own their own home. He will use the requested funds to buy a lot.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a lot.

loans.name: Valdemiro Luis

texts.pt:
Valdimiro Luís G. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Provincia do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique tem 32 anos de idade casado e pai de 2 filhos de 05 e 02 anos de idade, ainda não vão a escola. Fez 12ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras, mas ainda tenciona continuar. Vive na casa propria com sua família e de vez enquanto sustenta seus irmaõs enviando dinheiro e alguns bens de consumo.
Saiu de Maputo para Boane quando casou e tem um negócio próprio há mais de 8 anos possui um empregado, consegue um rendimento de cerca de 10.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de trabalho de mobilização feita pelos oficiais da Hluvuku. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar (cimento e areia) para o fabrico de blocos e vender no seu estaleiro.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros, no futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar no seu negócio.
texts.en:
Valdimiro Luís was born in the city of Maputo, in the Province of the same name, South of Mozambique. He is 32 years old, married and the father of two children who are 5 and 2 years old. They do not yet go to school. He went to school until the 12th but didn't finish it do to the lack of financial resources, although he intends to. He lives with his family in his own house and from time to time supports his siblings by sending them money and a few goods. He left Maputo to go to Boane when he got married. He has had his own business for more than 8 years and has one employee. He earns around 10.000.00mt per month which goes to household expenses and a savings account. He has never requested loans from other banks. He came to know Hluvuku through the enrollment efforts of its officers. This loan is his first in the amount of 10.000.00mt. He intends to buy cement and sand to manufacture building blocks and sell them in his stand. He is committed to paying this loan on time in order to be able to request other loans. In the future, he would like to request more loans to invest in his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cement and sand to manufacture building blocks and sell them in his stand

loans.name: Gulrukhon

texts.en:
Seventeen years ago, Gulrukhon started her clothing business. Experienced and talented in the business, Gulrukhon has expanded her business into a successful trade, supporting her family. Throughout the last 2 years, IMON has provided ongoing assistance to Gulrukhon’s business through microfinance loans. Committed to growth and successful entrepreneurship, Gulrukhon has used each loan wisely and has repaid each with a perfect credit history. Currently, she is seeking a loan of $1400 USD to purchase additional goods for her business. The well being of Gulrukhon’s family and her business are in your hands. Gulrukhon and her children are sincerely grateful for your support.     

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new clothing to increase the variety of goods for sale.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita R. is from the village of Upper Dicayas. She is 59 years old, is married, and has seven adult children.

Benita owns and operates a specialized retail of firewoods, selling firewood in the local community. Benita has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Benita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizer for her garden and farm.

Benita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be additional capital for her firewoods business. This loan will be the 8th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

 About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her firewoods business

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a 55-year-old widowed mother of six children ranging in age between 17-36 years old. Two of her children are still attending school.

She is a farmer from Kisii town in Western Kenya where she has been farming for 33 years. Her main products are maize, beans, millet, bananas and vegetables which she sells to the local market and other retail businesses. She solely relies on the income from farming to meet the family's expenses. Her major challenge is lack of enough capital for expansion and high input prices during planting season.

She recently completed her previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 35,000 KES. She has requested this loan for 60,000 KES to expand her cereals and banana business. The income from this loan will enable her to educate her children and provide for her family. 

She expects to stock cereals on large scale in five years time.

loans.use: To expand her cereal and banana business.

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en:
Mrs. S., 40, has a life partner in her husband who works planting crops and they live in a rural area of Kompong Tom Province. S. currently earns her daily revenue by working as a requirement (casual) laborer. She is also hired by people to clean up their farmlands and typically earns approximately $2 each day. S. has six children who are now single and almost all of whom work in various jobs.

S. will use this first loan she has requested to purchase supplies such as seed, fertilizer and insecticide for her husband to use.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her husband such as seed, fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania P. is 23 and married with no children.  She owns a business selling puletasi (Samoan formal wear).  Epifania has 2 years of experience in this business.  Epifania needs a loan of WST$1500 to purchase additional fabrics and materials.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Epifania joined SPBD in 2009.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Epifania's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane U., 37, is making sure that her family has adequate provision for their daily needs. She makes sure that she earns well so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own ready-to-wear clothing store for the past few years.

Mary Jane has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends its weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her clothing business.

To ensure the success of her business, Mary Jane would like to apply for a PHP 15,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying new designs of products to be incorporated into her current inventory.

Mary Jane dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy new designs of products to be incorporated into her current inventory

loans.name: God Grace Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God Grace.

She is 53 years old, married and has five children who range from 8 to 34 years old. She was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support. For 13 years, she has been selling fufu (a kind of food produced from cassava) in Gbengba Town Market, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more bags of cassava. She describes herself as a hard-working woman. Her dream is to grow her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cassava

loans.name: Johana Mabel

texts.es:
Johana de 28 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (zona urbana, con una ecología en reconstrucción), ella tiene una pequeña papelería y integrado un pequeño Cyber. 

Ella vivía en Guayaquil con su suegra y su esposo pero como querían independizarse comenzaron a reunir dinero para ir a vivir a otra parte, y tener así su propio negocio. Poco a poco cuando ya viviendo en Duran readecuaron su casa y ubicaron una papelería y un pequeño Cyber. Ahora ella trabaja de lunes a sábado. Por la inseguridad en el sector por donde vive a tenido que poner unas rejas de metal en su negocio (como en la foto). 

En el futuro quiere comprar un carro para poder transportar la mercadería, y con el préstamo quiere comprar papelería y computadoras para el Cyber.
texts.en:
Johana, 28 years old and lives in la Primavera de Duran (an urban zone with an environment that is being re-built). She has a small newsagency with a small cyber cafe inside. Johana used to live in Guayaquil with her mother-in-law and husband, but as they wanted to become independent they began to save money to live in another location, and opened their own business. Little by little, now living in Duran, they have adapted their house and installed a newsagency and cyber cafe. Johana works from Monday to Saturday. Because of the uncertainty of the area where she lives she has had to put metal bars in her business (as shown in the photo). In the future Johana wants to purchase a car to transport her merchandise, and with this loan will purchase stationery and computers for the cyber cafe.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stationery and computers

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina N. is currently in the business of selling bags of charcoal at a store  and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Christina is 39 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has four children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco P. is from the village of Nabannagan, Lasam, Cagayan. He is 37 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Francisco owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Francisco has been engaged in his business for over 12 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Francisco joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francisco is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be his first loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.fr:
Monsieur Théoneste B. est un jeune de 30 ans, naquit dans le district de Ngororero de l’ancienne préfecture de Gisenyi en province de l’Ouest. Il est célibataire, il vit avec ses parents et il a un diplôme de niveau A0 en Développement rural.
Il une mini papeterie et secrétariat publique. Son IMF est Amasezerano Community Banking sa, Il prend un prêt aujourd’hui pour acheter une photocopieuse pour l’utiliser dans secrétariat car il l’a implanté tout près de l’Université Libre de Kigali, Campus de Gisenyi ou habite cet homme pour satisfaire des besoins des étudiants de ce campus. C’est son deuxième prêt, il veut à la longue prendre un prêt pour l’habitat, il pourra aussi se marier et avoir des enfants par les épargnes continuelles.
texts.en: Mr. Théoneste B. is 30 years old.  He was born in the Ngororero district of the former prefecture of Gisenyi in the Western Province.  He is unmarried, lives with his parents, and has an A0 degree in Rural Development.  He has a small stationary shop and offers public secretarial services.  His microfinance institution is Amasezerano Community Banking.  Today he is taking a loan in order to purchase a photocopier to use in his shop, as he has established his business very near the University Libre de Kigali's Gisenyi campus such that he can satisfy the needs of the university students.  This is his second loan.  In the long term, he would like to take out a loan for a house and also to be able to marry and have children with his continued savings.

loans.use: Buy photocopier

loans.name: Patricia Lorena

texts.es:
Patricia Lorena B. G. tiene 27 anos. Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Ventanas en la  Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos de 10, 8 , 4, y 2 anos. 

Patricia es socia de la ventanilla rural Nueva Esperanza, que está ubicada a 25 kilometres del Cantón de Ventanas. Es una comunidad que se dedica a labores de ciclo corto (siembra de maíz, arroz, soya, fréjol, y cacao. Son 14 socios en total.

Patricia se dedica a la agricultura. Siembra arroz, maíz, y fréjol desde hace 5 anos. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en Ventanas. Solicita el credito para la siembra de maíz y arroz. Su sueno es tener un terreno propio y tener un negocio de tiendas. Se desafia por las plagas que comen a sus cultivos. 
No tiene mucho tiempo libre y se dedica a los quehaceres domesticos cuando tiene tiempo.
texts.en:
Patricia Lorena B. García, 27, lives in a common law marriage in Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province.  She has four children who are 10, 8, 4 and 2 years of age.

Patricia is a member of the “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) communal bank which is located 25 kilometers from Ventanas canton.  It is a community dedicated to short cycle crops (corn, rice, soya, broad beans and cacao).  It has 14 members.

Patricia is a farmer.  She has grown rice, corn and broad beans for the last five years.  She makes her purchases and sales in Ventanas.

She is asking for funds to plant corn and rice.  Her dream is to own her own land and to have a store.  Her challenge is pest infestations that destroy her crops.

She doesn’t have much free time but when she does she uses it to do her domestic chores.

loans.use: To plant corn and rice.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.pt:
Francisco C. nasceu na década 60 em Gaza uma das províncias do sul de Moçambique tem 4 filhos e estudam. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu de Gaza para Maputo na década 80 a procura de emprego, actualmente trabalha como musico instrumentista e tem um rendimento mensal fixo de cerca de 5.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.

Através da sua empresa soube da existência da Hluvuku e como tinha necessidade de construir a sua casa foi solicitar o seu 6º empréstimo no valor de 11.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, pedra e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. Os empréstimos anteriores foram aplicados no projecto da construção da sua casa o que veio melhorar a sua vida e da sua família pelo que já possui uma casa condigna e bens.

O seu sonho futuro e de concluir a sua casa e comprar um carro para transporte e para concretizar os seus projectos vai solicitar mais empréstimos no futuro
texts.en:
Francisco C. was born in the 1960s in Gaza, one of the provinces in southern Mozambique.  He has 4 children who attend school.  He lives in his own home with his family and does not support anyone else. 

He left Gaza for Maputo in the 1980s, in search of work.  He currently works as an instrumental musician and has a monthly salary of around 5.000.00mt, which he uses for household expenses.  He is able to save a bit in his bank account. 

He learned about Hluvuku through his business, and since he needed to build his home, he requested his 6th loan, in the amount of 11.000.00mt, which he intends to use to purchase materials (cement, sand, stone, etc.) to continue construction.  His prior loans were used for the same purpose, which has improved his life and that of his family by providing them with adequate housing. 

His dream for the future is to finish construction on his home and purchase a car, and to do this he will request additional loans in the future.

loans.use: purchase constuction materials (cement, sand, stones, etc.)

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa N. sells provisions and charcoal at Elmina. She is a widow and has six dependants. She is responsible for the welfare of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more goods to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to further her dependants’ education.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Christian Roberto

texts.es:
Christian Roberto V. C. tiene 20 años. Es soltero  vive con un hermano y un tio, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. No Tiene hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. El LA UNION se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Aguas Frías, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Christian se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 3 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener una casa.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Christian Roberto V. C. is 20 years old. He is single and lives with his brother and his uncle, in the Ventanas region, Province of Los Ríos. He has no children.

The members of the La Union rural communal bank are all based in the Aguas Frías area of Ventanas. The group is dedicated to agricultural work, in a planting cycle of maize, rice and beans. This activity takes a lot of time.

Christian has been dedicated to agriculture - especially the cultivation of maize, rice and beans - for 3 years. He buys his supplies in Ventanas and sells his produce at the market in the same area. He is seeking a loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers for his crops. The loan should help him financially, to stock up on these necessities. He faces difficulties such as crop diseases and the variability of the climate. His dream is to have his own house. He likes to play sport.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel has been in the farming business for the last ten years. His mixed farm, which is located in Kitale town, western Kenya, produces milk and eggs which he sells to the local market. He mainly depends on the income from his farming activities to cater for the basic needs of his family. His biggest challenge has been diseases and difficulties in transporting his products to the local market. 

He has requested this loan from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo of 31,200 KES in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that his milk production will improve and that his family will have enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The extra income from this loan will enable him to take his children to better schools. In the future, he would like to improve his milk production and be the major supplier of milk to the local market.

Samwel is 46 years-old and married with five children who are between the ages of two and 19. Four of the children are currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER DEL CUSCO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Sonia; ella tiene 39 años. La socia es casada, y tiene 02 hijos; la socia se dedica al comercio minorista, la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas, ella trae fruta desde Quillabamab al por mayor y reparte en Cusco. La socia desea el dinero ahora para invertir en su carrito ella tiene junto a su esposo un auto y desea invertir l crédito en la compra de llantas nuevas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de llantas nuevas para su carro.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Introducing Sonia, a member of the Banco Comunal “Nuevo Amanecer del Cusco” (“Cusco’s New Awakening” Communal Bank), that is located in the Huanchac district of the Cusco province.

Sonia is 39 years old, she is married and she has 2 children. She engages in the retail sector, buying and selling fruit: she buys fruit at wholesale price in Quillabamba that she then sells in Cusco. The loan she is now requesting will be used to invest in her vehicle. Together with her husband she owns a car and she want to use the loan to buy new tires. Sonia is asking for a loan to buy new tires for her car. 

Sonia is happy with the loan she has been granted and she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues at the set deadlines.

loans.use: To buy new tires for her car.

loans.name: Benard Ole

texts.en:
Benard Ole Y. is 26-years-old. He is married and is a father of two children. Benard is a farmer and he does the farming activity on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last five years. 
  
He learnt about KADET from a member of a group that is registered with KADET. This will be his second loan and he is planning to buy maize seeds and also buy fertilizer. Maize has proved to be doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions. 

With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to re-invest in the farm and plant more acres of maize. He hopes to export maize overseas and practice large scale farming.

Benard is an industrious man who focuses on his set objectives.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and also buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosario De La Cruz

texts.es:
La señora Rosario de la Cruz O. de 65 años vende ropa, zapatos y cosméticos  desde hace 14 años el cual inicio con poca mercadería y gracias a los prestamos fue creciendo su negocio ya que esto le permitió comprar mayor cantidad y variedad de productos. 

Ella trabaja con sus hermanas y amigas de confianzas quienes le ayudan a regar sus productos.
texts.en:
Rosario de la Cruz O. is 65 years old and has sold clothing, shoes, and cosmetics for the past 14 years. She began with little merchandise and her business grew thanks to the loans, as they allowed her to buy a larger amount and variety of products.

She works with her sisters and trustworthy friends who help her deliver her products.

loans.use: Merchandise (clothing, shoes, and cosmetics)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Carlota

texts.en:
Carlota G. is from the village of Hinaplanon, Baikingon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 47 years old. Carlota is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Carlota owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling vegetables like eggplants, "ampalaya" & stringbeans in the local community. Carlota has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Carlota joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carlota is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional vegetables to sell like cabbages & "ampalaya". This will be the 1st loan taken out by Carlota from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell like cabbages & "ampalaya"

location.town: Baikingon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Ni Ketut

texts.en: Ni Ketut S. got a loan for the first time, which she will use as venture capital to raise her pigs. Ni Ketut S. works to help her husband who is only a day laborer off, so does not have a steady income every month. She lives with her husband and one of her children. Every day she spends 25,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR) for the needs of the kitchen, 4,000 IDR for their children's school supplies, and 100,000 IDR for electricity and water.

loans.use: To buy more piglets

loans.name: Oyunjargal

texts.en:
Oyunjargal is 29 years old and lives with her grandmother, 72 years old, in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that she bought in 2008 with her business revenues. 

Oyunjargal began selling consumer goods at a rented stall in 2000. Initially, she ran her business with her sister and they expanded their business very well. Her sister was responsible for purchasing and importing the goods from China, and Oyunjargal was in charge of sales. In 2009, her sister moved to Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia, and Oyunjargal began operating her retail trading business alone. Her current stall is located in a crowded local market. So far, she has gained enough experience and has built a good reputation among her customers. She goes to China once or twice a month depending on the sales. She is a polite and hardworking person. Oyunjargal is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase clothing for her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Phillip

texts.en:
Philip O. is 24 years old and a single man. He lives in Kisumu county where he runs his business.

Philip has a shoe sales business and has been in it for a number of years. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy more shoes to add to his stock. 

His profits will be used to expand his business. He hopes to own a big shoe shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Con Visión (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres con Visión está conformado por 11 mujeres trabajadoras, luchadoras y siempre en busca de un mejor futuro para sus familias, laboran en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten mejorar su situación económica. Viven en diferentes partes de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es clima frió y tiene un hermoso centro histórico colonial es mismo que es admirado por propios y extraños, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora. Zulay Elizabeth N. vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, se encuentra en el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y le gustan los créditos ya que le permiten crecer en su negocio.
 
Nuestra socia es comerciante, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, esta actividad  la realiza hace 2 años y solo trabaja los días de feria. Ahora va a iniciar  un nuevo negocio que es la venta de comida rápida.

Doña Zulay tiene 28 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos de 9, 8 y 6 años de edad que estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión electricista, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos para la preparación de la comida rápida como: carne, salchichas, pan, arroz, papas, etc.

Su meta es sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Mujeres con Visión (Women with Vision) community bank is made up of 11 hard-working, determined women who are always in search of a better future for their families.  They are all engaged in different business activities which allow them to improve their financial situation.  They live in different parts of the city of Cuenca.  This is a cold-climate city with a beautiful historic, colonial center which is admired by both locals and strangers alike.  Its people maintain their culture and traditions.

Zulay Elizabeth N. lives in Cuenca city center.  This is the second loan that she has accessed through her community bank and she likes the loans since they allow her to grow in her business.  Zulay sells clothes.  She has been in this business for two years and she only works on market days.  She is about to start a new business selling fast food.

Zulay is 28 years old.  She lives with her partner and has three children aged 9, 8 and 6 who are attending an elementary school in the city.  Her husband is an electrician by profession.  They don't own their own home but live in a rental house.

Zulay will invest her loan money in buying products with which to prepare her fast food such as meat, sausages, bread, rice, potatoes, etc.  Her goal is to get her children ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy meat, sausages, bread, rice, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria M., 50, is married and has two children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Gleceria has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to pay for the purchase of spare parts for her motorcycle.

In the future, Gleceria would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Las Salcajeñas Group

texts.es:
Doña Mery Beatriz es casada, tiene 42 años D. edad, estudió los estudios primarios, tiene 4 hijos, los cuales estan estudiando, se dedica a la repostería, la elaboración D. pasteles, inició vendiendo pan en el mercado del lugar donD. vive y actualmente lleva 10 años D. experiencia en este oficio que le ha generado ingresos para sostener económicamente a su familia, espera tener con una pastelería aun mas amplio, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien se dedica al comercio. 

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para comprar materiales para elaborar pasteles y para reparar su horno. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedica a la venta D. ropa, crianza D. animales, tejeduría, tortillería, y a la venta D. comida.
texts.en:
Mery Beatriz is married, 42 years old, and she has a primary school education. She has 4 children, all of whom are in school. She has a pastry shop where she makes cakes. She started out selling breads in the neighborhood market where she lives. She now has 10 years' experience in the business and it has generated an income for her to support her family. She hopes to have an even larger pastry shop. She has her husband's support and he is a merchant.

She brought a group together to request a loan. It will help her to purchase ingredients to bake cakes and to repair her oven. The other members of the group sell clothing, raise livestock, knit, make tortillas, and sell prepared foods.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to bake cakes.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge 35 años de edad, el es soltero y tiene  con 01 hijo, Jorge vive en casa de sus padres, la cual está ubicada en el caserío Pedregal Alto en el distrito de Tambogrande, el  cuenta con un área de terreno propio el cual trabaja.

Jorge se dedica a realizar labores  agropecuarias, el cuenta con 1.5 hectáreas de terreno agrícola , en donde viene sembrado limón el cual cosecha semanalmente y riega  diariamente, de donde cosecha 25 sacos  de limón por semana y además también se dedica a criar ganado ovino, el cual vende en promedio 3 cabezas de ganado ovino, a la semana.

Jorge esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para que pueda comprar  fertilizantes para el cultivo de limón y así poder obtener una mejor producción y por ende logra un mejor precio de sus productos y seguir creciendo en su actividad.

Jorge es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Las personas que lo conocen le consideran una persona  amable y siempre dispuesta a ayudar a los demás.
texts.en:
Jorge is 35 years old, single, and has one son.  He lives in his parents' home which is located in the small village of Pedregal Alto, in Tambogrande district.  Jorge owns his own land which he farms.

Jorge works in agriculture and owns 1.5 hectares of farm land where he grows lemons which he harvests every week and irrigates every day.  He harvests 25 sacks of lemons a week.  In addition, he raises sheep.  He sells an average of 3 head of sheep a week.

Jorge is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which he will use to buy fertilizers for his lemon crop.  This will enable him to obtain a better production and, consequently, he will obtain a better price for his products and continue growing in his business activity.

Jorge is a hard-working man who strives to get ahead in life and enjoy a better quality of life.  Those who know him consider him to be a kind person who is always ready to help others.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his lemon crop

loans.name: Asadullo

texts.en:
Asadullo is 30 years old. He’s married and has two children. Asadullo is in the business of growing onions and wheat.  He began this business on his own initiative and has 4 years of experience. 

With this loan, he would like to buy agricultural supplies to improve production. In the future, Asadullo hopes to increase his production and sales so that he can provide a good education to his children and have economic stability. 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Maritza Natividad

texts.es: Maritza Natividad es una madre de familia de 32 años. Ella se dedica a una farmacia, ella busca la forma de salir adelante con su negocio, tiene una gran variedad de clientes que asisten a su negocio, ella es una persona muy tranquila y que disfruta de hablar con sus clientes. Maritza desea ampliar su negocio para lograr adquirir más ganancias siempre le ha gustado trabajar para mantener a su familia. Solicita por primera vez un crédito con el objetivo de comprar vitaminas, gotas, pastillas y otros.
texts.en: Maritza Natividad is a 32 year-old mother.  She owns a pharmacy and is looking for a way to get ahead in her business.  She has a wide range of customers who come to her business.  Maritza is a very calm person who enjoys talking to her customers.  She would like to expand her business in order to make more profits.  She has always enjoyed working to support her family.  She is requesting her first loan in order to buy vitamins, drops, pills and other products.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, drops, pills, etc.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida is a 46-year-old married woman with six children ranging in age from 26 to 10 years. A farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol, Zenaida has been growing rice for 10 years, earning about 6000 PHP per month. She has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs, and she hopes for her business to prosper.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.
Arlene works hard to support her family.

Arlene requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

In the future, Arlene would like to save enough to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe, in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past ten years, Ruth has run a laundry business. She is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her capital.

Ruth is requesting a 1,500,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to purchase soap and basins to help her wash clothes. With the help of her loan, she hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, Ruth hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase soap and basins

loans.name: Gulchahon

texts.ru: Гулчахон проживает в районе Хуросон. Ей 34 года. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Ее муж находится России. Сама Гулчахон зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности она занимается шесть лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Gulchahon lives in the Khuroson district.  She is 34 years old, married and has four children.  Her husband is in Russia.  Gulchahon earns a living by breeding cattle.  She has been involved in this business for six years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Santos Margarito

texts.es:
El señor Santos Margarito es casado, tiene 52 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educación primaria, tiene 8 hijos de los cuales todos estudian, trabaja en la elaboración de sandalias para niñas, señoritas y señoras, lleva 15 años de experiencia en este trabajo, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien es comerciante en la venta de sandalias.

Solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de materiales para calzado y así producir más: forros, pieles, conos, adornos, etc. Espera en el futuro ver su negocio más grande.
texts.en:
Santos Margarito is married and 52 years old. He has 3 years of primary education and has 8 children, all of whom are in school. He makes sandals for girls and women. He has done this work for 15 years and has his wife's support. She sells sandals.    

Asking for a loan will help him buy materials for making shoes and produce more: covers, hides, cones, ornaments, etc. In the future, he hopes to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy materials for working with leather.

loans.name: Salvation Group

texts.en:
Tendai, age 60, has been engaged in two businesses, poultry and dressmaking, for 10 years. Her main challenges are delinquent customer payments and the increased competition in her business. She and her husband live in Gweru and have two grown children, ages 35 and 40. She is the leader of the Salvation loan group.

Tendai has applied for a loan of US $400. With this loan, she will buy chicken feed and cloth from which to make dresses to offer for sale. The additional income obtained will help her to sustain her family and also help look after her grandchildren.

In the future, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed as well as cloth from which to make dresses to offer for sale

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 26 years old.  He is married to Solomon and they have two children who are between the ages three years and nine months old.

Peter is a cattle dealer and has been in this business for the past three years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD  to enable him buy more cattle to add to his stock.  He hopes to venture into the farming business in the future.

loans.use: buy cattle

loans.name: Vary

texts.en:
Vary (pictured in the photo), 45 years old, sells fish in Phnom Penh market. Her husband, Sarat, is a 47-year-old rice and lotus farmer. They live in a village along National Road number five, which is approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1990, and they have five children: four sons and one daughter. Three of their children are garment workers, one attends school, and another is still too young for school.

Vary is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,200 to assist with her husband’s farming business. Specifically, she would like to buy a motorized hand tiller.

loans.use: To assist with her husband’s farming business by purchasing a motorized tiller.

loans.name: Albina

texts.es:
Albina es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Amigas” del distrito, provincia Puno y departamento D. Puno, tiene 53 años D. edad, está separada y tiene tres hijos, dos D. ellos son  independientes.  Albina cuenta con estudios D. educación secundaria.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace dos años, su primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 nuevo soles lo invirtió en su negocio D. venta D. abarrotes, también se dedica a la venta D. artesanías. 

Con éste nuevo préstamo D. S/. 600.00 nuevo soles comprará arroz, azúcar, harina, leche, huevos y gaseosas, etc. 

La señora desea mejorar su tienda y surtirla con nuevos productos.

Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y la puntualidad
texts.en:
Albina is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Amigas” (Friends) which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Puno. She is 53 years old, separated from her spouse, and has three children. Two of them are independent. Albina has a high school education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for two years. Her first loan was in the amount of 300 PEN and the money was invested in her business of selling groceries. She also sells handicrafts.

With this new loan of 600 PEN, Albina will buy rice, sugar, flour, milk, eggs, sodas, and other products. Sra. Albina wants to improve her store and stock it with new products. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the convenience of the loan and the punctuality.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, flour, milk, eggs, sodas, and other products.

loans.name: Balimi S.h.g Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Balimi S.H Group in Western Kenya! Joseph is the facilitator of Balimi S.H. group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.  As with the majority of the population in this part of Kenya, the members of Balimi S.H Group rely on maize farming for food security and income. 

Joseph takes care of six children at home with he wife.  He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Joseph had an excellent maize yield harvesting 12 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Joseph was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Joseph and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Joseph will educate his children, feed his family throughout the year, and invest in livestock. 

In 2012, the members of Balimi S.H group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. Sally has a business selling used clothes. She has been in this business for 6 years, and she works six days out of every week. Sally sells her products retail from her home. She has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of second-hand clothes.  
   
The main business challenges for Sally include seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also to educate her children up to the university level. Sally lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity, but she doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, feeding the family, and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Justino

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LLANCASUN DE ARIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Justino; el tiene 58 años de edad y es casado y tiene 5 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesania,el socio junto con su esposa vende sombreros, chompas y muñecas en el distrito de Calca, el socio también se dedica al negocio de agricultura, el tiene un terreno de agricultura donde siembra maíz, quinua y frejol, por medio de estos negocios el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de artesanía y mejorar en el negocio de agricultura. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía y también para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para las tierras de cultivo.        
                 
 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “LLANCASUN DE ARIN” communal bank. The bank is located in the Calca district and province which is located in the Cusco department.

The member’s name is Justino. He is 58 years old and married. He has 5 children. He alternates his daily activities with the sale of handicrafts. Along with his wife, the member sells hats, sweaters, and dolls in the Calca district. The member also is a farmer. He has a plot of land where he plants corn, quinoa and beans. Through this means of work, he is able to help his children succeed. The member wants to expand his business selling handicrafts and improve his farming business. He is requesting the loan to purchase handicrafts and to purchase seeds and fertilizers for farming land.

The member is happy about the loan and he promises to make the loan payments.

loans.use: purchase handicrafts and purchase seeds and fertilizers for his farming land.

loans.name: Aguet

texts.en:
Aguet is 29 year old a married woman with four children, and all of them are in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Aguet is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is from Calabayan, Ozamiz City. She is 45 years old, married, and has four adult children. 

Evelyn plants, harvests and sells "saging" (bananas) for their living. She's been in her business for 16 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Evelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to purchase their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina is 41 years old and married with five children.

Melodina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Melodina has borrowed and paid back 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and earns additional income from food vending.

Melodina aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Kofia Keur Momar Sarr Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe existe depuis le 07/07/2011, date de création du Banc Villageois. Il est composé de 29 femmes qui habitent dans le même village.

La responsable du groupe, levant la main à droite de la photo, s'appelle Minetou, elle est âgée de 48 ans, marié et mère de 6 enfants ( 2 garçons et 4 filles). 
Elle s'active dans le petit commerce de sucre, de tabac, de thé...au marché du village.

Avec les bénéfices obtenus elle espère pouvoir augmenter son épargne et développer son activité.
texts.en: This group was formed on the 7th of July, 2011, the same day the "banc villageois" was created. It is made up of 29 women who all live in the same village. The group's representative, Minetou, is on the right of the photo and has her hand raised. She is 48 years old, married and the mother of 6 children (2 boys and 4 girls). She sells items like sugar, tobacco and tea at the village market. She hopes to use the profits she earns to increase her savings and develop her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (e.g. sugar, tobacco, tea) for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Miguel is applying for this loan so that he can purchase raw materials for his sandals, such as leather soles, straps, laminant, and glues.

loans.name: Atsoupi

texts.en:
Ms. Atsoupi G. was born in 1976 in Kladjemé. At a young age, she began helping her parents with their work in the fields and around the house. When she came of age she had no professional training, so she requested her first loan to start selling earrings. Today she is no longer totally dependent on her husband, and she can contribute more to the household income. She is a married mother of five children who also takes care of two of her husband's children. She is energetic and honest and has regularly repaid her first loan and is now requesting another.

This new loan of $850 will allow her to sell jewelry, bracelets and other items at the markets in Cotonou and Accra. With her income she hopes to do more for her family and especially for her children.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1976 à Kladjemé, Madame G. Atsoupi n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter. A bas âge, elle aidait les parents dans les travaux champêtres et domestiques. Devenu majeure et n’ayant appris aucun métier. Elle sollicita un premier crédit pour la vente de boucles d’oreilles, et aujourd’hui elle ne dépend plus entièrement de son mari. D’ailleurs elle contribue plus aux charges de la famille. Mariée et mère de cinq enfants et deux enfants de son mari en charge, elle est dynamique et honnête, elle a pu remboursé normalement son crédit et sollicite un autre.

Cette nouvelle demande de $850 va permettre à faire le marché de Cotonou et d’Accra dans la vente des bijoux, bracelets et autres. Avec les revenus, elle espère faire plus à la famille surtout aux enfants.

loans.use: To buy a supply of earrings

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Isabel is from Mérida, Yucatan, has five children: four men of 28, 25, 21 and 18 years of age and one 24 year-old girl. The children are married and they help her with a small amount of money for expenses, but not enough to cover all her needs, so she decided to start her own business of selling shoes. Fortunately the money and hard work she invested in the business paid-off. In order to be able to fulfill her clients’ orders, Maria needs a loan of $700 dollars. She is committed to paying it back in 6 to 12 months. With your aid Maria can improve her life. She sincerely thanks you for your support and kindness. .
