Translated from Spanish by Virgilio Russi, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria Isabel es originaria de Mérida, Yucatán, tiene cinco hijos, son cuatro hombres de 28, 25, 21 y 18 años de edad y una mujer de 24 años, sus hijos están casados y le ayudan con una pequeña cantidad de dinero para sus gastos, pero no le alcanzaba para cubrir todas sus necesidades, así que se decidió a iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de zapatos, afortunadamente el dinero que invirtió en el negocio ha rendido frutos y ha recibido un beneficio de su esfuerzo y trabajo.

Para poder surtir los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes Maria necesita de un préstamo por $ 700 dólares que empleará con este fin, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Con tu ayuda puedes ayudarla a mejorar sus condiciones de vida, apóyala a seguir adelante con su negocio, ella agradece sinceramente tu ayuda y cariño.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela is a 32-year-old married mother of two. Her husband works in the fields, while she makes decorative embroidered blouses that are popular in her region. She sells them to women in her neighborhood and also to vendors who later sell them to tourists. With the loan, she hopes to invest in looms, special cloths and thread for embroideries.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

MANUELA TIENE 32 AÑOS , CASADA, 2 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO. ELLA TRABAJA EN ARTESANIAS BORDA BLUSAS TIPICAS DE LA REGION Y LA VENDE A LAS MUJERES DE SU COMUNIDAD Y TAMBIEN EN LA CIUDAD CON PERSONAS QUE POSTERIORMENTE COMERCIALIZAN SUS PRODUCTOS EN OTRAS CIUDADES TURISTICAS. PERTENECE AL GRUPO SEMPASUCHIL 2. CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA INVERTIR EN TELARES, MANTA E HILO DE BORDAR.

loans.use: Purchase looms, cloth and thread

loans.name: Hosiat

texts.en:
H. Hosiat has her own stall in the big market of ”Farovon”, in Gafurov, Khujand.  She is a widow and a mother of 5 children.

She and her two sons sell different goods in this market.  They have three places of trade.  Her elder son travels to Istaravshan, Khujand to purchase goods for them.  Hosiat became a client of MicroInvest in 2005.  Her first loan was for $100.

Today, she has a wide assortment of goods.  She sells children’s and men’s shoes and t-shirts, and other kinds of clothes for girls, boys and so on.  Her turnover of goods is good.  Her trade place is small, but very profitable because it is situated in the passage of the market.

For the coming autumn season she is going to purchase seasonal goods such as warm boots, jackets and warm sport clothes for teenagers.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Bol

texts.en: Mrs. Bol S. R., age 55, works grinding beans by hand and selling the shelled beans to members of her community, earning about $10 per day in revenue. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver who earns around $4 per day. They have seven children, three who work in a garment factory earning around $2 per day each, one who is a motor-taxi driver, and three who are students. She would like to request a loan of $1,200 in order to purchase a grinding mill to more quickly grind the shells off the beans and increase her output of product to meet customer demand. This will increase her income and help her fund her children’s education and increase the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a grinding mill to shell beans.

loans.name: Larysa

texts.en:
Larysa is an enterprising business owner from Kharkov, Ukraine. She has a busy footwear sales business located at the Barabashova Rhinok (market) in Kharkov. Larysa purchases shoes and boots from China where she is able to get good prices. She sells from her little stand at the market and also sells bulk supplies of footwear if needed by a customer. Larysa started her business about 12 years ago. She is divorced and is raising one child. One of her goals for the future is to be able to buy her own apartment.

Larysa has requested a short term loan of $1000 to purchase a new supply of inventory. Larysa has been a good client with Nadiya Ukraine in the past and has even co-signed for others to receive loans. We are happy for this opportunity to assist her as she works to make a living.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Vilma's Group

texts.es:
Esperanza, Vilma and Juana belong to the communal bank Generosidad (generosity) for 1, 5, and 1 years respectively.

Esperanza is 42 years old, has 3 children, and has worked selling food walking through the streets of the Nery Garcia market for 5 years. She used to sell fruit, but she left that business because profits were low. On her part, Juana is 51 years old, has 6 children, and has worked selling food walking through the streets of the Nery Garcia market for 7 years. Vilma has a small cafeteria in an institution of the city of Ayacucho. She used to travel to fairs carrying basic needs products and food, but she stopped that business because it was very heard.

Esperanza, Vilma, and Juana, need loans for 600 soles each. They will invest their loans in buying rice, oil, plates, potatoes, pasta, soft drinks, cookies, chocolate bars, vegetables, and pots.

The dreams of Esperanza, Vilma, and Juana are to build their homes with a good material, having a larger business, and that their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Esperanza, Vilma y Juana pertenecen al Banco Comunal Generosidad desD. hace 1, 5, 1 año respectivamente.

Esperanza tiene 42 años y 3 hijos y venD. comida ambulatoriamente en el mercado Nery García desD. hace 5 años. Anteriormente vendía fruta pero dejó este negocio porque no tenía muchas ganancias. Por otro lado Juana tiene 51 años y 6 hijos y venD. comida ambulatoriamente en el mercado Nery García desD. hace 7 años. Mientras que Vilma tiene un cafetín en una institución D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Antes viajaba a las ferias llevando abarrotes y comida, pero dejó D. realizar este negocio porque era muy difícil.

Esperanza, Vilma y Juana necesitan préstamos D. 600 soles cada una, que serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, aceite, platos, papa, fideos, gaseosas, galletas, chocolates, verduras y olla.

Los sueños D. Esperanza, Vilma y Juana son construir su casa D. material noble, tener un negocio mas granD. y que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.

loans.use: Esperanza, Vilma, and Juana, need loans for 600 soles each to buy rice, oil, plates, potatoes, pasta, soft drinks, cookies, chocolate bars, vegetables, and pots. (Esperanza, Vilma y Juana necesitan préstamos de 600 soles cada una, que serán invertidos en la compra de arroz, aceite, platos, papa, fideos, gaseosas, galletas, chocolates, verduras y  olla.)

loans.name: Tebuyoleka A(2028)A Group

texts.en: Rose is 40 years old and divorced with three children of ages 22, 18, and 15. She sells new clothes for a living. She wants to use the extra business profits to expand her business and buy a plot of land for her children. Victo wants to purchase more used clothes for sale. Ruth has a retail shop and wants to use the loan to increase stock. Betty sells herbal medicine while Joyce offers laundry services.

loans.use: To rent a shop for displaying clothes on sale.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María is a single mother, but a very good mother, given that her children have all received the best possible upbringing. A reflection of that is the fact that today, her children are all people that actively contribute to the development of their society. Today María lives alone and is dedicated to work in handmade crafts. Every morning she can be found making her precious necklaces and bags made from typical natural resources from the jungle. However, her labor is currently in danger because the prices of the materials and instruments she needs have increased tremendously. With the goal of reforming and acquiring a larger quantity of raw materials, she turns to you, seeking your help.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

María, es madre soltera pero una muy buena madre puesto que sus hijos han tenido y recibido la mejor educación posible reflejo de este hecho es que hoy son personas que contribuyen con el desarrollo de su sociedad activamente.Hoy María vive sola y se dedica a las labores artesanalas, todas las mañanas podemos encontrarla elaborando sus preciosos collares y carteras con insumos típicos y naturales de la selva.Pero su labor puede estar en peligro porque que los materiales e instrumentos de trabajo han incrementado sus precios enormemente y con el objetivo de renovar y adquirir mayor cantidad de materia prima recurre en búsqueda de tu ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase of tools and raw materials.

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Mrs. Sor S., 33, is a mother of two children, who are students. Mrs. S. sells fruit in a busy market, and she earns around $2 a day. Her husband is a construction worker who builds houses. Usually he earns a profit of about $4 a day. Mrs. S. is requesting a loan to purchase pigs to raise and earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to raise

loans.name: Kimhiv

texts.en: Mrs. Kimhiv N. lives in Popeal Khaer, a poor village in Kandal province. She is 58 and the mother of five children, one of whom is a construction worker, three are students and the youngest is at home. Mrs. Kimhiv N.’s family is very poor since both she and her husband, Vith Lim, are farmers. Last year, Mrs. Kimhiv N. obtained a loan from Acleda Bank to grow rice. This year her plantation has faced drought and insects attacks which resulted in a poor crop. Thus, she now requested a loan to buy insecticides and hire a pump to water her field. (Her husband is on the right in the photo).

loans.use: Mrs. Nuon would like to buy insecticides and hire a pump to water the field.

loans.name: Munavar.

texts.ru:
Munavar N. lives in the Vahdat region. She is 50 years old, married, and has five children. She has been raising animals for more than 8 years. Her husband is temporarily unemployed, so animal husbandry is their large family’s principle source of income. Currently she has one dairy cow, whose milk she sells at the market. Now she would like to buy one more cow so she can make fermented dairy products. In order to do that she decided to take out a loan, to be repaid over 10 months. This will help her to provide for her family; after all, raising five children is not easy. Buying another cow will make her and her family’s lives a little easier.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Ниезова Мунавар жительница раойна Вахдат. Возраст 50 лет, замужем , имеет 5 детей. Мунавар более 8 лет занимается животноводством. Муж клиентки временно не работает.Поэтому животноводство является основным источником дохода их большой семьи. В доме у клиентки есть одна дойная корова,молоко которой она реализует на рынке. В данный момент клиентка хочет купить еще одну корову для производство кисло-молочной продукции.Для чего она решила взять кредит сроком на 10 месяцев.Это поможет ей лучше обеспечить свою сеью , ведь растить пятерых детей не так уж просто. Купив еще одну корову она облегчит жизнь себе и своей семье.

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
Sr. Ismael is 32 years old and married to Sra. Edith Benítez. They have two children, an 8-year old son and a 10-year old daughter.

Ismael has been selling clothing, shoes, and various household items on the street for the last five years.

The loan he is asking for will be used to buy a small truck. At the moment he uses a motorbike which is now too small as he expects his business to grow. He also has a large number of clients to whom he wishes to offer a greater variety of household items so he can retain them as customers.

Sr. Ismael stated that in the future he wants to have a store in the market from which to sell his products.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Ismael tiene 32 años de edad y esta casado con la Sra. Edith Benítez, ambos tienen 2 hijos, uno varón de 8 años y mujer de 10 años.

El cliente es vendedor ambulante, él vende prendas de vestir, calzados, y artículos de mercería, ya lleva en el oficio 5 años de antigüedad.

El préstamo que solicita será destinado para la compra de una camioneta, ya que el Sr. Ismael reparte sus mercaderías en una moto, y este ya le resulta muy chico, atendiendo que cada vez esta creciendo mas su negocio y además tiene una buena cantidad de clientes a quienes desea ofrecer mas variedad de mercaderías para así poder conservar a sus clientes.

El Sr. Manifestó que en el futuro desea tener un local en el mercado para ofrecer sus productos.

loans.use: To purchase a small truck to use in his business.

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
Maria Cristina Boveda D. P. was born in Luque and has been married to Osmar Walter P. for more than twenty years. They are the parents of five children, three of who are adults.

To help her husband with the family income, Maria Cristina has managed a store for more than six years and which she operates with Fundacion since 2002 through loans that help her increase her inventory and improve her income. Maria Cristina has fixed a goal for herself of expanding her commercial stall in order to be able to sell a greater quantity of various merchandise.

Today she is asking for a loan to be able to acquire merchandise for her store such as sugar, meats, dairy products, oil, flour, carbonated drinks and sweets among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

La señora María Cristina B. D. P. nació en Luque y esta casada con Osmar Walter P. desD. hace más D. veinte años. Ellos son padres D. cinco hijos D. los cuales tres son mayores D. edad.

Para ayudar a su marido con el ingreso familiar, María Cristina maneja una despensa desD. hace mas D. seis año y opera con la Fundación desD. el año 2002 a través D. créditos que ayudan a aumentar su inventario y mejorar sus ingresos. María Cristina se ha fijado una menta que desea cumplirla con el tiempo y es la D. ampliar su local comercial D. modo a poder vender una mayor cantidad D. variadas mercaderías.

Hoy ella está solicitando el crédito para poder adquirir mercaderías para su despensa como azúcar, carnes, lácteos, aceite, harina, gaseosas, golosinas, entre otros.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for her store such as sugar, meat, dairy products, oil, flour, carbonated drinks and sweets among other things.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en: S. Firuza is 43 years old. She is married and has three children. Firuza owns a small clothing sales business at an outdoor market in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. She sells clothing for schoolboys and schoolgirls. Firuza is an experienced entrepreneur, and has been running her business for the past 6 years. She tries to maintain a good selection of clothing in her store to attract the attention of people shopping at the market. Firuza’s business is an important source of income for her family. She makes US$ 200 in a typical month, which is a good middle-class income for Tajikistan. At present, however, Firuza needs a loan of US$ 600 to be able to purchase new inventory of clothing for schoolgirls and schoolboys, given the high demand for such clothing during the current season.

loans.use: Purchase of new clothing for schoolboys and schoolgirls for sale

loans.name: Muqaddas

texts.en: Muqaddas Baji is the wife of M. and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi food. She has been living in this city for the last 11 years. She is the mother of four children: two daughters and two sons. Her elder son provides a cable network in the community and out of the community. He has been in this business for the last seven years. Muqaddas Baji's husband drives a donkey cart for hauling. Muqaddas Baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy wires for her son's cable network business.

loans.use: To buy wires for cable network business

loans.name: Khoem

texts.en:
Mrs. Kjoem L., a resident of Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province, is a fruit seller in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she is requesting a loan to buy more fruit in order to meet customer demand.

Khoem is a 52-year-old widow with three children, two of whom are construction workers while the remaining one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more fruit in order to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy equipment to outfit a salon

loans.name: Sara

texts.en: Sara S. is 39 years old. She is married and the loving mother of three wonderful children. Sara keeps her store where she sells different kinds of foodstuffs, which she has been running for the past 6 years. The inventory she has for sale is of very good quality and variety. Gulnora is respectful and patient with all of her customers, which attracts people and brings them back to her store to buy groceries again. Sara is seeking to keep her business strong and has requested a loan of 1200 USD for the term of 15 months to increase the inventory she has for sale. One of her dreams is that her children progress in their studies. We believe this current loan will enhance the potential of her business and help Sara reach all of her aspirations.

loans.use: Purchase more food inventory

loans.name: Ruth Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Ruth Maribel N. A. tiene 33 años, vive en Buenos Aires, distrito de Víctor Larco Herrera, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio secundaria completa, tiene una hija que depende enteramente de ella.
Ruth se dedica a la venta de ropa y plasticos, inicio su negocio con la venta de juguetes por campaña de navidad, con las ganancias que obtuvo logro comprar ropa interior y plásticos para la venta, su negocio lo desarrolla en Paijan.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Las Palmeras”, lo invirtió en la compra de juguetes para campaña navideña.
Con el crédito de 1500 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de ropa y plásticos
Ruth sueña con tener una tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Ruth Maribel N. A. is 33 years old and lives in Buenos Aires, located in the Trujillo province of La Libertad, Perú. She completed secondary school and has a daughter who still dependens solely on her. Ruth dedicates herself to selling clothing and plastic products, having started her business initially selling toys for the holidays. With the earnings she made, she managed to buy undergarments and plastic products to sell. She runs her business in Paijan. With the first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles that she received from her cooperative bank “Las Palmeras”, she invested in the purchase of toys for the holiday season. With the loan of 1,500.00 Peruvian soles, to be repaid in six months, she will invest in the purchase of clothing and plastic products. Ruth dreams of having a grocery store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and plastic products.

loans.name: Sheitu

texts.en:
Married with three children attending school, 26-year-old Sheitu M. lives with her husband in Abofour, a suburb of Offinso in the Ashanti region of Ghana. A resourceful young woman, she loves selling goods, the business through which she makes a living.

Trekking to surrounding villages in the Central part of Ghana to purchase bulk stocks of bananas from farmers, Sheitu has been retailing them in the Abofour market for more than eight years now. Unfortunately, a lack of adequate working capital prevents her from buying enough stock to earn sufficient profit to support her family. Sheitu is therefore requesting this loan to purchase larger supplies of bananas to increase her sales volume.

She believes this loan will enable her to save more income to support her business growth; as well, she wants to use part of the additional profits to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase bananas  in bulk.

loans.name: Kato Allama Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Kato Allama sont toutes mariées. Avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et 5 enfants, elles vivent en majorité dans des  familles traditionnelles polygames dans le village de  Finkolo situé à une cinquantaine de kilomètres de la préfecture de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles menent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres l’achat - vente de la farine de blé, du sel de cuisine, des tissus et  la restauration. Afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle,  elles  ont décidé de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe (prêt solidaire) 
Elles comptent acheter avec ce prêt, 7 sacs et ½  de 50 kilogrammes de farine de blé, 25 sacs de sel de cuisine de 25kg, 15 pièces de tissus et des ingrédients pour la restauration.  Elles s’approvisionnent  au marché de Finkolo. Les marchandises sont vendues au marché de Finkolo et à la maison en détail et au comptant.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 45.000FCFA par mois dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group Kato Allama are all married and average 39 years of age and 5 children. They live for the most part in traditional polygamous families in the village of Finkolo, located about 50 km from Sikasso prefecture (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They do a diversity of work, such as buying and selling flour, salt, cloth, and they do food catering.

To satisfy their customers, the group members decided to collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their fifth group loan (solidarity loan). The members plan to buy seven and a half 50-kg sacks of flour, twenty-five 25-kg sacks of salt, fifteen lengths of cloth, and some ingredients for preparing meals. Supplies are gotten at the Finkolo marketplace. The merchandise is sold retail there too and also at the house (retail cash sales).

The group members each envision realizing an average profit of 45,000 francs CFA per month. A portion of the profits will be use to meet family needs, and the other portion will be invested in the businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various good for commerce and for making meals to sell

loans.name: Savri

texts.en:
Savri is a woman with much courage who strives to provide her three children with food and education, as well as keep them healthy and give them a sense of well-being. She goes to the fields every day, where she grows potatoes, wheat and maize. She was taught farming techniques by her parents as a child, and the nature of her work and her eagerness to get ahead in life motivate her every day. Consequently, her farm products are consistently of high quality. Savri needs your support, through this loan, to invest in high-quality seeds and fertilizer and improve her harvest. This is why she requires a loan of $2,400 for 12 months. Let's support this effort by a mother who wants the best for her children.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; Alexander the Great's rule; and many famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 61 años, es viuda desde hace 7 años, y vive con su hija que es madre soltera. Desde la muerte de su esposo, empezó a dedicarse a la venta de ropa de segundo uso que  lleva a vender por los distintos lugares de su zona y algunos caseríos que se encuentran a tres días de viaje por el río Ucayali (principal río de la ciudad de Pucallpa). Las prendas que Rosa vende, en su mayoría las deja al crédito por lo que regresa cada cierto tiempo a las casas de sus clientes para realizar las respectivas cobranzas. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que hace nuevas amistades, y durante sus ventas mantiene muy amenas conversaciones con sus clientes. Pero lo más importante, es que mediante esta actividad está progresando económicamente, lo que repercute en la mejora de su economía. Desde que empezó a trabajar con MFP, ha accedido a 5 préstamos, y este es el número 6. Del cual, invertirá todo el monto en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería para su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is 61 years old and has been a widow for 7 years. She lives with her daughter who is a single mother.

Since the death of her husband, Rosa has sold secondhand clothing around her area and in a few villages 3 days’ journey away along the Ucayali river (the main river in Pucallpa). Rosa sells most of the clothing on credit, which is why she returns to her customers’ homes from time to time to receive payment.

What she likes about her work is making new friendships and the good conversation she has with her customers. But, more importantly, this work has improved her economic situation.

Since she started working with MFP, she has received 5 loans; this will be number 6. She will use the money to purchase a larger quantity of merchandise for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Venturas José

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, el señor Venturas L. se dedica arduamente a su actividad de transporte de pasajeros de un lugar a otro teniendo su propio triciclo con el cual traslada a sus pasajeros.

EL costo del transporte es depende la distancia y el problema que hoy en día el señor Venturas atraviesa  es que requiere de un crédito para la compra de los repuestos para el triciclo y de esta forma continuar en su actividad para mejoras su nivel de vida y el de su hogar.
texts.en:
In the city of Chinandega, Venturas L. works arduously transporting passengers from one place to another on his cycle rickshaw. The transport fare depends on the distance. Venturas needs credit to purchase replacement parts for his cycle so that he can continue his business and improve his quality of life and his home.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase replacement parts for his cycle rickshaw

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian sells frozen foods like chicken, fish and turkey. She sells her frozen foods in kilos and in cartons. She is 40 years old and married with four children. She hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more frozen foods to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Robiya

texts.ru:
Козибобоева  Робия 1972 года рождения. Замужем имеет 3 детей. Муж является предпренимателем.  Она дома шьет национальную женскую одежду. У нее много клиентов, особенно весной и летом. Все женщины шьют новые платья по моде. 
Также она разводит дома скот. В бизнесе ей помогают муж и отец. (во время мониторинга Робия была на выезде, на фото отец Робии).
Год назад за кредитом обратилась по совету родителей.  Муж помогает  выводить скот на рынок и прикупать другой скот. Робия благодарна  КИВА за поддержку  в развитии бизнеса.
texts.en:
Robiya K. was born in 1972. She is married and has three children. Her husband is an entrepreneur. She works at home, sewing traditional women's clothing. She has many customers, especially in the spring and summer. All the women tailor new dresses in the latest fashion. She also raises livestock. Her husband and father help with the business (Robiya was out of town when monitoring was done, so her father is pictured in the photograph). She came to us for a loan last year, following the advice of her parents. Her husband helps take the livestock to market and choose new animals. Robiya is grateful to KIVA for supporting her business's development.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising Livestock

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth O. sells rubber shoes of various sizes and colors. She is married with 7 children and she is 51 years old. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more rubber shoes to sell. Elizabeth says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more rubber shoes to sell

loans.name: Abduraim

texts.ru: Абдураим Джураев проживат в районе Руми. Возраст 43 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Клиент вместе семьей занимается сельским хозяйстовом. Он в основном выращивает дыню, арбуз и продает их на рынке. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 6 лет. Клиент просит кредит, для покупки семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Abduraim J. lives in the J. Rumy region. He is 43 years old. He is married and has 4 children. The client works in agriculture with his family. He mostly grows cantaloupes and watermelons and sells them at the market. He has been in this business for more than 6 years. The client is asking for a loan in order to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Adegboye

texts.en: Adegboye is 27 years old. He has a tailoring shop where he makes nice clothes. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Sainaya's Group

texts.en: The leader of the group, Sainaya, is sixty. Almost all of the five children brought up by her are now grown-ups. Her two daughters and two sons live separately as they have their own families. Only her little son stays with his parents as he is still a college student. To make a living, her husband farms land and raises livestock. As to Sainaya, she keeps two cows and sells their milk to the locals. Actually, one of her cows was given to her by her father and mother-in-law as a wedding gift. Now this gift lets her make $45 a month. Raising cattle has allowed them to marry two of their sons and even increase the total population. Sainaya has far-going plans. The first obstacle is getting a loan. Once it is overcome, she plans to buy two calves which she is going to fatten up for resale. As she sells them, she intends to invest the money in buying a flat for her daughter in Tokmok city. After fulfilling this plan she will be able to finish building her house, which is now under construction. Here is Sainaya’s team – Rosa, Chynarkan and Kulbubu: Rosa is a widow and is the mother of five children. She manages to keep a cow, a horse and five sheep. She is happy to have married her three daughters, despite her low income. Rosa wants to buy a cow. However, without a loan she won’t be able to do that. Chynarkan, 47, is the mother of five children, most of whom go to college. This is quite burdensome since neither she nor her husband have a good income. They mainly live by keeping cattle. Chynarkan needs a loan to buy a foal which, after feeding for one year, they plan to resell. Kulbubu, 48, is a widow. She has brought up six children, some of whom help her now. She keeps two cows and sells milk which helps her make $20 a month, enough to sustain her for a month. She hopes to get a loan and buy a calf. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy two calves for fattening and resale

loans.name: Minka Group

texts.es:
“La necesidad es una valla que al ser saltada te hace más granD.” es la frase que usó la Sra. Gloria al contar su historia. Cuando la empresa en la que ella trabajaba cerró allá por el año 1991, no le quedó más remedio que buscar otra fuente D. ingresos que asegure la estabilidad económica D. su familia, ya que teniendo un niño pequeño los ingresos D. su esposo no eran los suficientes para cubrir con los gastos.
Abrió un negocio en casa D. su madre, quien la apoyó con esta iniciativa, primero vendía a través D. su ventana. Helados conservados en cajas D. teknopor y hielo seco a falta D. congeladora eran sus primeros productos, luego logró surtirse D. diversos productos y acondicionar la parte lateral D. su domicilio para una bodega. 
La Sra. Gloria se capacitó en pastelería con el sueño D. un día convertir su negocio en una “Panadería & Pastelería Fina” y es que además D. atender en su bodega brinda los servicios D. elaboración D. tortas para todo tipo D. eventos: Quince años, Matrimonios, etc. DonD. también brinda asesoría para la contratación D. bufetes y demás accesorios. Esta es su verdadera pasión y espera algún día hacerla realidad “pero al fin y al cabo es cuestión D. esfuerzo ¿no?” termina la entrevista con una sonrisa D. quien sabe que un sueño con acción se convierte en realidad.
texts.en:
“Need is like a barrier that makes you bigger after you've jumped over it" is the phrase Gloria uses as she tells her story. When the company she worked for closed in 1991, she had no choice but to look for another source of income to proviD. economic stability for her family. With a young child at home, her husband's income was not sufficient to cover their expenses.

Gloria opened a business in the home of her mother, who supported her in this initiative. At first she simply sold items through the window. Ice cream treats were her first products, stored in Styrofoam coolers with dry ice because she had no freezer. Later, she was able to offer a wider range of items, and she converted the siD. area of her house into a small grocery store.

Gloria also received training in pastry making, with the dream of someday turning her business into a "Panadería & Pastelería Fina," a bakery offering high-quality bread, cakes and pastries. Currently, in addition to working in her shop, she offers custom-maD. cakes for all types of events: 15th-birthday celebrations, weddings, etc. She also provides advisory services to help people order buffet food and other needed items. This is her true passion, and she hopes one day to fulfill it, "but in the end, above all, it's a question of effort, right?" she says, concluding the interview with the smile of someone who knows that a dream combined with action can become reality.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASE OF MERCHANDISE: SNACKS, TOILET TISSUE, AND GENERAL GROCERY ITEMS TO STOCK HER STORE

loans.name: Dilshodi

texts.en:
Dilshod is 19 years old. He is a young boy with a great desire to get ahead in life. Dilshod has been running a pharmacy business for two years. He started this business after graduating medical college. Dilshod loves his work. He likes to help people and is ready to consult the patients purchasing the medicines in his store and those who could not find the required goods in his store. For the years of his work Dilshod was dreaming to open his own drug store and saving money for this. He hopes that someday he can realize his dream. Now Dilshod requests $ 500 US Dollars for purchasing more medicines. He promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks everyone supporting him.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing medicines

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen L. is from the village of Galukso. She is 30 years old. Aileen is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Aileen owns & operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making furniture products local community. Aileen has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Aileen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aileen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. Aileen is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional products and furniture tools. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Cecilia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials and furniture tools

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah M. makes and sells palm kernel oil: she buys palm nuts and processes them to get her oil at Elmina near Atabadze. Sarah has no educational background.  She is married and has five children .Her husband is a carpenter. Sarah has been selling palm kernel oil since 2004. She supports in the payment of school fees and upkeep of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more palm kernel to process into oil. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a house.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more palm kernel to process into oil.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a member of LAPO Micro-finance. She sells garri and has been in this business all her life. She buys cassava, grinds and fries it. The end product is called garri. She hopes for the loan amount of N50000 to purchase more cassava for production of garri to sell. With this loan she hopes to increase her stock so as to meet the demands of her customers. Esther wants to be able to provide better for her children's education. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava for production of garri

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia J. is currently in the business of selling bread and tea at her restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more sugar to make more tea to sell. Lucia is 35 years old and is married to a businessman. She has six children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more sugar to make more tea to sell

loans.name: Isis Group

texts.es:
El grupo Isis está integrado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras y muy capaces ellas son Martha, Jenny, Karen y Brenda.  La señora Martha Elizabeth R. S. comercializa ropa de todo tipo y utensilios para el hogar. Ella inicio con este negocio para poder sacar a sus hijos adelante y que contaran con la educación que a ella le falto.
De la misma manera sus compañeras de grupo Jenny Montiel R., Karen Esperanza G. y Brenda del Socorro A. B.  se ganan el pan de cada día vendiendo ropa de manera ambulante. Ellas actualmente necesitan de mayor inversión por la demanda de de sus clientes en esta época del año.
texts.en:
The Isis Group consists of four hardworking, capable women: Martha, Jenny, Karen, and Brenda.

Sra. Martha Elizabeth R. S. sells all types of clothing and household utensils. She started this business so that her children could get ahead and receive the education that she was not able to obtain.

Her fellow group members – Jenny Montiel R., Karen Esperanza G., and Brenda del Socorro A. B. – all make their living by selling clothes as street vendors. They currently need more capital to meet the customer demand during this time of the year.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase more clothing

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
A mother of 8 children ages from 14 to 34 years old who aims to see all her children finish a college degree and be able to help them rise from poverty. Elma L. would always advise her children about the good things that must done to achieve their dreams for their future. She is 53 years old and still striving hard to help her husband support the needs of their family. The live in the village of Brgy Chambery, Manapla, Negros Occidental. 

In order to earn and help her husband, Elma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon to have a capital to put up a new general store in the area adjacent to her house. She has experienced minimal problems like the lack of goods sold due to lack of capital and the income was too small that sometimes capital was used to defray expenses. However, Elma was able to turn the business around. As her loans continued, her business became a big help to her family because she earned a minimum of Php 7,000 every month. Portion of this income was used for an additional capital, save for the children's education and help in their household expenses.

Elma's previous loan of Php 13,000 was utilized as an additional working capital for the general store. The said loan from NWTF-PD was fully paid in full and on-time without any delay. Her present 8th cycle loan of Php 16,000 will be used in her general store and whatever income she earns from it will be used for her family.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project "Dungganon" (a Hiligaynon word that means <u>Honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon" - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for general store

loans.name: Romelio

texts.es: Romelio A. de 44 años de edad, reside en San José Villanueva. Vive junto a su esposa y tres hijos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Romelio como todo hombre de hogar, trabaja arduamente por llevar el sustento diario a su casa y sostener a su familia, él posee un negocio en el cual compra y vende materiales de construcción, así mismo los reparte con los diferentes clientes, lo cual le permite obtener ganancias extras ya que cobra adicional el servicio a domicilio. Romelio solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más  materia de construcción, esto debido a que dentro de sus planes esta el extender su negocio, esto en vista que sus hijos pronto asistirán a la universidad y Rogelio desea poder darles los estudios superiores, todo con el fin de poder brindarles un mejor presente y así mismo un mejor futuro como personas profesionales, los cuales puedan tener una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Romelio A. is 44 years old and resides in San Jose Villanueva. He lives together with his wife and their three young children who are in school. Romelio, like any family man, works hard to maintain his home and support his family. He has a business in which he purchases and sells construction materials. Likewise, he delivers them to his clients, which enables him to obtain extra earnings, since he charges a fee for home delivery. Romelio is requesting a loan to be able to purchase more construction materials, due to his plans to expand his business. This is in preparation for his children attending college soon, and Rogelio desires to be able to provide them with their higher education, all with the objective of giving them a better life and likewise a better future as professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to sell

location.town: San José Villanueva, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Zosimo

texts.es:
Zosimo es socio del Banco Comunal Ccatarisum que significa Levantémonos en quechua.
Zosimo es conviviente, tiene 53 años y 6 hijos, Zosimo es artesano y realiza trabajos de orfebrería de acuerdo a los pedidos que tenga, además vende leña y comida en su casa, actividad que realiza junto a su esposa.
Zosimo necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña, arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Zosimo son ampliar sus negocios, que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Zosimo is a member of the Communal Bank “Ccatarisum”, which means “Let’s rise” in Quechua. Zosimo is 53 years old, lives with his common-law wife, and has 6 children. Zosimo is a craftsman who works with precious metals, creating custom items on order. He also sells firewood and food out of his house, and in this business he works alongside his wife. Zosimo needs a loan of 1000 Peruvian Soles, which he will invest in the purchase of firewood, rice, and sugar. Zosimo's dreams are to expand his businesses and to have his children go to school and have professional careers.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of firewood, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Tobias

texts.en:
Tobias is a 30-year-old married man with one child who attends school. He sells used clothing to residents of Embakasi and employs one person. His other source of income is from managing transport vehicles. Previously he was employed at Roto.

With the loan, Tobias hopes to use KES 28,000 to stock up on used clothing and purchase chains and hinges with KES 2,000. He hopes to open a textile shop in the future and to own a good home.

Tobias describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes, hinges and chains

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Monsieur Mamadou T. est un pêcheur  yoffois de 41 ans. Il  habite plus particulièrement  dans le quartier  de Tonghor  qui est une zone très  proche de la mer et majoritairement habite par des pêcheurs. Il est sociétaire de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC Yoff depuis février 2006. Il est marie et père de 6 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 2 et 15 ans. Après ses études primaires  il a hérité  cette profession de ses parents et exerce l’activité depuis plus de 30 ans. Pour lui l’aspect le plus intéressant  de son occupation c’est la réalisation de bénéfices  considérables qui lui permettent de subvenir a ses besoins personnels et familiaux. Monsieur T. sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs dans le but de réfectionner sa machine et sa pirogue. Ainsi ce crédit pourra lui permettre de mieux rentabiliser son activité  en vue d’une bonne amélioration  de leur cadre de vie social.
texts.en:
Mr. Mamadou T. is a 41-year-old fisherman from Yoff. More specifically, he lives in the district of Tonghor, which is an area very close to the sea and is inhabited primarily by fishermen. He has been a member of the U-IMCEC Yoff credit union since February 2006. He is married and has 6 children, whose ages very between 2 and 15 years. After his primary education, he took on the job of his parents, and has been involved in this activity for more than 30 years. For him, the most attractive aspect of his occupation is the realization of significant profits that allow him to provide for himself and his family. Mr. T. is seeking a loan of 200,000 FCFA with the goal of repairing his equipment and canoe. Thus, this credit will allow him to make his business more profitable, and thereby improve his family's standard of living.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in his business

loans.name: Ileana Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Ileana Del Socorro se dedica a este negocio como es el ofrecer los servicios de belleza de manera ambulante. Ileana es una muy buena cliente de Fundación León 2000 por lo que siempre se ha preocupado en pagar sus cuotas. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio, es madre de 2 hijos por lo que se preocupa por mantenerlos. Ella es una madre responsable pues además de esto les ayuda con sus tareas y a realizar las actividades del hogar. El motivo de su financiamiento es para la compra de materia pinturas de uñas, acetona, palillos, calcomanías decorativas, uñas decorativas y cremas. Su deseo es seguir manteniendo esta actividad.
texts.en:
Ileana Del Socorro provides beauty salons services door-to-door. Ileana is a very good client of Fundación León 2000; she has always rapaid on time. She has been in this line of work for over 15 years; she has two children to support. She is a responsible mother because, in addition to her work, she helps them with their homework and to do houshold chores. She will use the funding to buy manicure supplies like: nail polish, nail polish remover, cuticle sticks, decorative decals, decorative press-on nails and hand creams. Her wish is to keep doing this kind of work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manicure supplies.

loans.name: Efraín Joel

texts.es:
Efrain tiene 27 años de edad, es casado y no tiene hijos. Vive junto a su esposa y a la familia de su hermano en una casa heredada de su padre, en el sector El Paraiso del distrito de Rázuri, situado en la provincia de Ascope de la región La Libertad, a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a bridar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi. Lleva varios años en esta actividad y hace medio año, gracias a  sus ahorros, pudo adquirir un vehículo propio con el cual actualmente viene trabajando y percibiendo más ganancias. El cubre rutas entre la zona de Macabi y Paiján todos los dias, paralelamente se dedica a trabajar eventualmente como peón agrícola y con esta actividad ayuda al sostenimiento de su hogar.

El continuo uso otorgado a su unidad movil ha hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunas fallas en el motor que requieren de urgente reparación para su correcto funcionamiento, por este motivo, Efraín se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en el mantenimiento y reparación de su vehículo.

Efraín es un padre de familia trabajador y responsable que dia a dia da lo mejor de si para sacar a su familia adelante, sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima y lo consideran una persona de confianza.
texts.en:
Efrain is 27, married, and does not have children. He lives with his wife and his brother’s family in a house inherited from his father. They live in the El Paraiso section of the Rázuri district, which is situated in the Ascope province in the La Libertad region. It is two and a half hours from Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. He provides transportation services for cargo and passengers in his “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle). He has been doing this for several years. Thanks to his savings, he was able to buy his own vehicle a year and a half ago. He is currently working with the vehicle, and he is getting more earnings. Everyday he covers the routes between the Macabi and Paiján areas. He also sometimes works as a farm worker, which helps support his household. The continual use of his vehicle has caused it to suffer some problems with the motor. It urgently needs to be repaired to function properly. That is why Efraín has seen the need, for the first time, to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 600 PEN. He will use it for the maintenance and repair of his vehicle. Efraín is a hard-working and responsible family man. He works day to day to improve himself in order to get his family ahead. His neighbors and acquaintances hold him in high esteem and consider him to be a trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance and repair expenses for his mototaxi

location.town: El Paraiso - Razuri - Ascope - La Libertad

loans.name: Dynamique Plus Group

texts.en:
Anne N. K., a 54-year-old married mother of ten children, five of whom attend school, is the leader of a Community bank named “Dynamique Plus”, comprised of 25 members firmly united to receive loans from the MFI (micro-finance institution) HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses.

In a market located in the south-west part of Kinshasa, Anne sells shikwanges, (a kind of bread made of manioc flour) which are Kinshasa’s main food. In business since 1982, Anne has received and fully repaid seven loans from HOPE DRC for business expansion. With the next loan, she will be able to meet customer demand and generate additional profits. One of Anne’s strategies to keep her clients is to inform them in advance of any change that might occur in the business. Her ambition is to become a key shikwanges provider in her area.

loans.use: To purchase 2 50kg/sacks of manioc to increase her inventory

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.en:
S. Olimjon is 24 years old. He is a livestock trader. He buys and sells cattle from different market places and has been in the business for the last eight years. His main customers are butchers and livestock farmers. Olimjon is married and has a little kid. His wife and mother (pictured) are also engaged in his business. With the loan from Kiva, he plans to increase his herd of cattle for trade and, if possible, open up his own butchery. This, he says, will increase his turnover. Olimjon plans to see his children go through higher education and be able to get good jobs, unlike himself.   

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Cajina Group

texts.es:
El grupo Cajina está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas son   Blanca Azucena A. Cajina  quien venden esquimos y bisutería en su casa. Ella con el préstamo compra una caja de esquimo, cajetas de leche, chapas, pulseras y collares.

Sus compañeras de grupo son María Lydia M. Dávila hace chocobananos y reposterías e invertirá en materia prima como harina, huevo, azúcar, mantequilla etc. y Ana Virginia Pérez tiene una pequeña fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en alimentos fritos donde comercializa especialmente enchiladas y tajadas con queso.
texts.en:
The Cajina group is made up of three hard-working and enterprising working people. One of them is Blanca Azucena A. Cajina who sells ice cream and jewelry from her house. With this loan, she will buy an ice cream box, milk bowls, plates, bracelets and necklaces. Her group colleagues are Maria Lydia M. D. who makes chocobananas and pastries and will invest in basic ingredients like flour, eggs, sugar, butter, etc. and Ana Virginia P. who has a small fried food stand, a popular restaurant that consists of fried foods where she especially sells enchiladas and cheese slices.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an ice cream box, milk bowls, plates, bracelets and necklaces.

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en: Elchin H. is a 24-year-old man who sells home products in the store he rents in Bilasuvar city. Elchin is married and has one son. Elchin dreams of building his own shop. He applied for a loan of 1000 AZN, which he will use to increase the number of products he sells.

loans.use: purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Saroeun Bo Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of twelve people who are villagers in Krapeu Ha village in Kandal province. Mrs. Saroeun B. is the village bank president, selected by the other members. Each member will use a small piece of the loan for a different purpose to improve their business. Mrs. Saroeun B. is 51 years old and is a rice and congee (rice porridge) seller in her local village. She is a widow with four children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is a policeman, one helps her in selling rice and congee, and one attends the local public school. She is facing difficulty because her house is broken. So to improve this condition, Mrs. Saroeun B. is asking for a loan to fix her house.

loans.use: To fix her own house

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome P. is 50 years-old and married with four children.  She owns a business planting and harvesting taro for sale.  Salome has many years of experience in this business.  Salome needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to financially support the immediate members of her family.

In 2009, Salome joined Kiva partner SPBD.  This is her second loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Salome's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD:

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii andTonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce J. is currently in the business of selling bread, tomatoes and cooking oil at the market and is requesting a loan to stock onions and Irish potatoes to sell.

Joyce is 30 years old and is married to a soldier. She has two children and her children go to school.

With the extra profits from her loan, Joyce hopes to be able to open a shop.

loans.use: To stock onions and Irish potatoes to sell

loans.name: Juana Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer de 46 años, comerciante desde hace varios años, con ganancias de venta de leña y nacatamales comenzó,  lo que  logro  crecer e invertir en una  pulpería que junto a Afodenic ha venido aumentando de inventario. Obteniendo mejores productos. Ganancias con las cuales ha apoyado a su familia.
Lo que quiere es mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio, para tener espacio para cada segmento.
Lo que comprara con este préstamo es granos básicos, golosinas, lácteos, caja de jabón, papel higiénico, leche de pote, productos enlatados y productos consumibles de cada día.
Ya que la demanda es mucha, y cuando tiene poco productos no logra el objetivo. 
Y tiene que cubrir muchos gastos.
texts.en:
Juana is a 48-year-old woman and has been a businesswoman for several years. It began with her earnings from selling wood and nacatamales, with which she was able to build and invest in a grocery store. Together with Afodenic, she has increased her inventory, obtaining better products. Her earnings from the grocery store have supported her family.

What she wants is to improve the infrastructure of her business to have space for each section. With this loan she will purchase basic grains, sweets, dairy products, boxes of soap, toilet paper, cans of milk, canned goods and other groceries for daily life. Since demand is high, she does not meet her goal when she has few products and she has many expenses to pay.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of basic grains, dairy products, cereals, sweets, and boxes of soap to increase investment in her business.

loans.name: Retamas Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “RETAMAS” ha decidido asociarse para solicitar su primer crédito en el Centro Focal de VILLA EXALTACIÓN, ha conformado una mesa directiva compuesta por Presidenta, Tesorera y Secretaria de Actas. La presidenta, doña  Betzabé se dedica a la venta de tostad;  está casada y es madre de cuatros hijos.

El consumo de “tostado” (parecido a la pipoca) es común y tiene bastante demanda, se puede observar productos como la soya, la quinua, el trigo, granos como el maíz o productos de primera necesidad como el arroz y los fideos. 

La señora Betzabé aprendió este negocio de su madre y tía, compra la mercadería de los mayoristas y se dedica a la venta en diferentes fiestas y los fines de semana.  Actualmente le ayuda su hija a llevar adelante el negocio. 

Ocho mujeres integran la asociación comunal. Tienen negocios diferentes, como: venta de ropa, venta de verduras, tejedora de chompas, venta de comida, venta de manzana, Hilandería, venta de Tostado, venta de mantas.
texts.en:
The Retamas Communal Bank has decided to team up in order to request their first loan. In the Villa Exaltación community center they have formed a governing board comprised of the president, treasurer, and secretary. Betzabé is the president, and she sells “tostado” (roasted nuts and legumes). She is married and has four children. Eating tostado (similar to popcorn) is common, and there is plenty of demand. She has products like soy, quinoa, wheat, grains like corn, or basic needs items like rice and noodles. Betzabé learned this business from her mother and her aunt. She buys the merchandise from wholesalers, and she sells at different celebrations and on the week-ends. Her daughter now helps her get ahead with the business. Eight women belong to the communal bank. They have different business like selling clothes, selling vegetables, weaving sweaters, selling food, selling apples, a spinning mill, selling tostado, and selling blankets.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Corn, quinoa, wheat, noodles, and rice

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline J. is currently in the business of selling locally brewed alcohol and beer at home and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  Jackline is 29 years old and is married to a husband who is an electrician . She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a real bar.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: 030637-Quang Trung, Hoang Thanh Group

texts.en: Loc T. T. (88) is a 53-year-old femaL. living in the town of Hoang Hoa. Loc is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 030637-Quang Trung, Hoang Thanh (030637-Quang Trung, Hoang Thanh). Loc is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Loc raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising cattL. for saL.. Loc has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 1,500,000 Vietnamese Dong (VND) a month from it. In 2005, Loc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Loc has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. She is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 VND, which will also be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be the fourth loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Loc plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. L. T. Lanh (73) is a 53-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her livestock-raising business. 2. C. T. Long (84) is a 46-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her service-based business. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Loc T. T. (88) là 53 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa. Loc là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 030637-Quang Trung, Hoang Thanh (030637-Quang Trung, Hoang Thanh). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán. Loc thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Loc kiếm được khoảng 1,500,000 VND. Vào 2005, Loc đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Loc đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua con giống. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,000,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. L. T. Lanh (73) là 53 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. C. T. Long (84) là 46 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Santiago Sebastian

texts.es: Sebastián tiene 34 años, su actividad económica es la venta de artículos de ferretería hace mas de 16 años que tiene este negocio, lo inicio por su Mama pues él había observado que ella anteriormente se dedicaba al negocio. Así fue como él decide hacerse cargo del negocio, pues le gusta mucho interactuar con sus clientes por lo que ha demostrado ser una persona muy capaz y responsable. Este financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de clavos, martillos entre otras cosas que son necesarias y que sus clientes llegan a comprar a menudo. Sueña con mejorar sus ingresos cada día.
texts.en:
Sebastián, age 34, sells hardware.  He has been in the business for over 16 years.  He watched his mother when she was previously in the business.

That is how he decided to take charge of the business.  He really likes interacting with his customers.  He has shown himself to be a very capable and responsible person.

The loan that he is requesting is to buy nails and hammers, among other things needed by his customers who frequently shop at his business.  He dreams of improving his income every day.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 56-year-old businessman. He raises chicken for eggs and meat. He has been in this business for two years and describes his environment as good. He has a good customer base and he raises cows for additional income. A hardworking father of three, Robert hopes to continue expanding his business to the level of selling chicken and eggs at wholesale. He has requested a loan of Kes. 60,000 to build an additional shed and purchase 150 chicks. Robert is a member of Ngong Vision SHG.

loans.use: To build an additional shed and purchase 150 chicks

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard wants a loan to purchase first hand clothes for reselling at his shop. He lives in the town ship of Kyenjojo, Uganda. He owns a semi-permanent house in which he lives with his wife and seven children. He earns income from selling clothes. He dreams of expanding his clothing business into a wholesale business and educating his children for a better future.

loans.use: To purchase first hand clothes for reselling.

loans.name: Serrah

texts.en: Serrah A. is married and has five dependants. She prepares tea for sale (tea served with fried eggs and bread) at Abura. Serrah uses the income she makes from her sales to assist her husband to take care of the home. She says the loan will help her to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Serrah plans to buy land.

loans.use: To help her to expand her business.

loans.name: Vianey

texts.es:
Vianey F. C., tiene la edad de 29 años, está en unión libre y tiene 2 hijos  que son su mayor prioridad. Ella quiere comprar o invertir en productos para abastecer su salón de belleza de una forma más amplia y productos de buena calidad,  ella cuenta con una amplia experiencia, por lo cual no quiere dejar perder ese pequeño negocio que tanto le ha costado hacer. Con ésta opción  ella pretende mejorar su nivel de  vida y a su vez ir generando la ganancias para poder seguir hacia adelante con su negocio, también ofrecerle a sus clientes todos los productos que sean necesarios y de muy buena calidad. A su vez ella piensa en el futuro de su hijos y poderles dar estudios para que en un futuro sea unos buenos profesionales.
Es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Vianey F. C., age 29, lives with her partner and their 2 children, who are her main priority. 

She wants to invest in products to stock her beauty salon, so that she has more choice and good quality products. She counts on providing a good experience, becaue she would not want to lose her little business after all that she has put into it. With it, she hopes to improve her standard of living and go on generating income, which in turn will enable her to keep improving the business, offering clients all the high quality products they need. At the same time, she is thinking of her children's future and wants to be able to pay for their studies so that they can grow up to be good professional people.

This is her first loan with [field partner] FUDECOSUR. She has not had other loans from state banks before either, but FUDECOSUR has offered er the loan with good terms and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: Productos para un Salon de belleza

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase shorts, shirts and beach balls.

loans.name: Melania

texts.es:
La Sra. Melania tiene una despensa y un kiosko  muy bien surtido en Coronel Oviedo, la misma es Madre y Padre  para tres hijos, la mayor tiene 22 años se llama Yeni Rosana y está siguiendo el tercer año de una carrera universitaria gracias al esfuerzo constante de su mama. 
La Sra. Melania también comenta que en la casa todos se ayudan, ella se levanta temprano y hace variadas clases de comidas rápidas para el Kiosko y su hija Rosana atiende en la despensa.
Esta muy agradecida con la entidad por haber confiado en su persona porque gracias al préstamo que le ha otorgado rápidamente la Fundación ya compro azúcar, harina, aceites, arroz, carne  y están trabajando tranquilamente ahora en su negocio con toda su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Melania has a small well-stocked grocery store and a kiosk in Coronel Oviedo. She acts as mother and father to three children, the oldest is 22 year-old Yeni Rosana who is in her third year of university studies thanks to the constant effort of her mother. Ms. Melania also comments that at home everybody helps each other. She gets up early and makes various kinds of fast food for the kiosk and her daughter Rosana manages the small grocery store. 

She is very grateful to the organization for having confidence in her because thanks to this loan that the Foundation has granted her so quickly, she has already bought sugar, flour, oil, rice, and meat and is now calmly working in her business with her entire family.

loans.use: Buy merchandise such as noodles, oil, rice, meat and more.

loans.name: Bright

texts.en: Bright is 31 years old, married and has three children. He lives in his own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He aspires to educate his children up to university level. For the last ten years he has been selling poultry feed and also rearing chickens. His main business challenge is having enough capital to purchase the feed. Bright's ambition is to own at least 2,000 birds. He is requesting a loan to buy chicken feed.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed

loans.name: Thelma

texts.es:
La señora Thelma del Socorro C. Blanco,  fémina trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien desde que enviudo hace 15 años se dedicó al comercio de productos Avon y Zermat negocio que le ayudo a superar ese momento triste y sacar adelante a sus dos hijos quienes en ese entonces tenían 6 y 4 años.

Ella con el crédito comprara unos encargos que tiene de cosméticos, cremas, tratamientos etc.
texts.en:
