Thelma del Socorro C. Blanco is a hardworking, courageous, and enterprising woman.  After she was widowed 15 years ago, she began a business selling Avon and Zermat cosmetics.  Her business helped her through that sad time and allowed her to support her two children, who were 4 and 6 years old at the time.

With this loan, she will purchase cosmetics, creams, and beauty treatments.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics, creams, and beauty treatments

loans.name: Hedil Roberto

texts.es:
Hedil tiene 35 años de edad, es casado y reside  junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos en el caserío Guaraguaos Alto ubicado en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde hace más de diez  años, él siembra mango, maracuyá, limón y cacao en un pequeño terreno de cultivo, cerca a su casa, el conoce muy bien esta actividad gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre. Con los ingresos que  percibe solventa los gastos económicos de su familia.

Hedil desea adquirir fertilizantes y pesticidas para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de mango, con esta acción el espera obtener una buena cosecha. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Hedil es una persona bastante tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es poder crecer como empresario y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Hedil is 35 years old and is married.  He lives with his wife and their 3 children in the rural Guaraguaos Alto settlement, located in the Tambogrande district.  This is an agricultural area that is located in Piura province in the region of the same name, more than 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

Hedil has been a farmer for more than 10 years.  He cultivates mangoes, maracuyas, lemons and cocoa in a small plot of land near his house.  He is very familiar with this line of work, since his father taught it to him.  With the income he earns he covers the family's expenses.

Hedil wants to acquire fertilizers and pesticides to maintain his mango crops.  In this way he hopes to obtain a good harvest.  To do this, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 Peruvian soles.

Hedil is a person who is quite calm and responsible.  His main desire is to be able to grow as a businessman and to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his crops

loans.name: Fema Grace

texts.en:
Fema Grace A. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 37 years old. Fema Grace is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Fema Grace owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing and shoe products in the local community. Fema Grace has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Fema Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fema Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Fema Grace is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like t-shirts and blouses. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Fema Grace from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like t-shirts and blouses

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama I. is married and has two children. She has received a senior high education. Mariama sells fresh groundnuts, millet, beans and other items at Akaa krom near Abura in Cape Coast. She has been in this trade for 12 years. Her husband is a security man. She adds her income to that of her husband’s in payment of school fees and utility bills. 

Mariama will use the loan to purchase more cereals for resale. Any incremental profit will be reinvested back into her business. She is showing the millet that she sells.

loans.use: Mariama will use the loan to purchase more cereals for resale

loans.name: Tseveldulam

texts.en: Tseveldulam, 48, is married and lives with her husband and a son in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they have owned for the past 15 years. They have a decent standard of living. Tseveldulam began retail trading of meat and meat products in 2000. She used to work as a salesperson until she started operating her own stall. She purchases meat from individuals and sells it at her stall. She has been operating this business continuously for many years. She is a hardworking and polite person. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to purchase meat for her business.

loans.use: to purchase meat

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 37 years old and is married with four children between the ages 1 and 7 years old. Florence earns a living by sewing different styles of clothes. This is her third successful year in this business. Her business is well-organized. She operates her business from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day and she employs one person to help her.

Florence needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy more cloth for sewing. By expanding her business and adding more equipment and workers, Florence hopes to earn more profits, and she will save for her future.

loans.use: to buy more cloth for sewing

loans.name: Veth

texts.en: Veth S., 41, is married and resides in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, in an area known for Angkorean Temples. S. is a massager and a grocery seller, earning an income of about USD 6 per day. Each month, her family must spend USD 75 on food and USD 37 on the other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Gulmira's Group

texts.en:
Gulmira O. is the treasurer of this group. She is 44 years old, and unfortunately she is a widow. She has raised six children, three sons and three daughters. Most of the children are employed, and each month they provide financial support to their mom. The younger children are students, and when they are free from studying they help Gulmira with housework. 

Since 1994 Gulmira has been cultivating agricultural products. Selling some part of the harvest she earns about $88 per month. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase 100 liters of fuel and potato seeds. In the future Gulmira wants to get a good harvest and desires to improve the family's living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fuel.

loans.name: Idilia

texts.es:
Idilia forma parte del Banco comunal “El Progreso” perteneciente a la comuna de Independencia, ciudad de Santiago.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio vendiendo confites y bebidas en un carro que instala en la calle, de lunes a viernes. También vende joyas a domicilio y los días domingos se dedica a vender aceitunas. Los días sábados se dedica  a comprar mercadería para abastecer su negocio con productos de confitería. Su mercadería la compra en la vega central, ubicada en el centro de la ciudad de Santiago, ya que los precios son más convenientes.
Idilia se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 20 años, comenzó vendiendo aceitunas y condimentos.
El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar una nevera, mercadería para abastecer su negocio y un toldo para protegerse de la lluvia, debido al que utiliza se encuentra en mal estado. 
Sus metas son vender sus productos en un local establecido, como un kiosco y para esto necesita un permiso para instalarlo. Además anhela que su negocio prospere, para agregar la venta de artesanía de greda. Sus motivaciones de continuar con el negocio e incluir nuevos productos, son debido a los ingresos que adquiere, ya que estos le permiten cubrir los gastos domésticos. 
Idilia vive junto a su hija, yerno y sus 3 nietos. Sus sueños a nivel personal son acceder a una situación socioeconómica más estable y una vida más confortable. 
Idilia está muy agradecida del crédito brindado por Fondo esperanza, ya que éste le ha permitido invertir en su negocio, lo que le ha generado mayores ganancias. Respecto a las reuniones estas son muy amenas y ha logrado generar vínculos de amistad con las demás integrantes del grupo. Idilia también ha podido incorporar en su negocio los aprendizajes de ventas en las reuniones, ya que registra sus gastos e ingresos y cotiza los precios cuando debe comprar. 
Independencia es una de las 34 comunas que componen la ciudad de Santiago (capital de Chile), ubicada en el sector centro-norte. Surgió a fines del siglo XIX como un sector tradicional de la ciudad. Su eje principal es la Av. Independencia, por la cual pasaba el antiguo Camino del Inca, puerta de entrada por el norte, a la ciudad de Santiago. Dada su amplia población indígena, en Independencia se encuentra el Centro Cultural Indígena de Chile. Cuenta también con importantes construcciones históricas, entre ellas 6 monumentos históricos de Chile.
texts.en:
Idilia is a member of the Communal Bank “El Progresso” which is in the community of Independencia in the city of Santiago. She is a merchant who sells candy and beverages from a street cart, Monday through Friday. Idilia also sells jewelry from her home and on Sundays she sells olives. Saturdays are designated for buying merchandise to stock her candy business. She buys her merchandise at the central market in the city of Santiago since the prices are the most affordable.

Idilia has been in business for 20 years. She started out selling olives and condiments. This loan will be used to buy a cooler, merchandise to restock her business, and an awning for protection from the rain since the one she currently uses is in bad condition.

Her goals include selling her products from an established location, such as a kiosk, but she first needs to obtain a permit. She also hopes that her business will prosper by adding handicrafts made of clay to her inventory. Idilia is motivated to continue with her business and include new products. The income she earns enables her to cover her household expenses. She lives with her daughter, son-in-law, and three grandchildren. Her goals on a personal level are to achieve a more stable socioeconomic situation and to live a more comfortable life.

Idilia is very grateful for the loan provided by Fondo Esperanza because the funds allow her to invest in her business and generate more income. She says the Communal Bank meetings are very pleasant and have enabled her to form friendships with the other group members. Idilia also has incorporated into her business the sales techniques she learned from the meetings. She also tracks her expenses, income, and the quoted prices of her purchases.

Independencia is one of the 34 communities that make of the city of Santiago, the Chilean capital. It is located in the north-central section. Independencia emerged in the late nineteenth century as a traditional section of the city. The main street is Independencia Avenue, which crosses the old Inca Trail, the gateway to the north in the city of Santiago. Given its large indigenous population, Independencia is known as the “Indigenous Cultural Center” of Chile. There are also important historical buildings, including six Chilean landmarks.

loans.use: to purchase a cooler, merchandise for her business, and an awning to protect her food cart from the rain.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 54 years old and married with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past five years, Rosa has run a sari-sari (variety) business in the Philippines. 

Rosa is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell

loans.name: Makhmadrasul

texts.en:
Makhmadrasul, an entrepreneur from Kurgantube, Tajikistan where he lives with his wife and three children, has been in the grocery business for 12 years. He is requesting a loan of 5000 TJS to buy foodstuffs in order to generate additional profits. Very good with finances, Makhmadrasul knows how to manage money and make the right investments. We believe the current loan will allow him to maintain a good product selection and continue to earn an adequate income to support himself and his family.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes its role as a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es: Jhonny de 30 años, es un hombre muy amble y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa María de 29 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Moisés de 10 y Jack de 1 año, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Para Jhonny los largos días de trabajo son parte de su rutina, él se despierta a las 6 de la mañana y junto a su motocarro, sale en busca de clientes que deseen llegar rápido y seguros a su destino. Después de recorrer las calles de la ciudad de Pucallpa y llegadas las 10 de la noche, guarda su motocarro y descansa, sabiendo que al día siguiente le espera otra larga jornada laboral. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus pasajeros y hacerles más ameno el viaje, lleva 15 años en este trabajo y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar todo el día alejado de su familia. Con el tiempo desea poner una tienda para que sea administrada por su esposa. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, nunca ha tenido problemas en su pagos, pues siempre ahorra para pagarlos a tiempo, en su banco comunal es muy querido, pues siempre llega muy puntual. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevos asientos para su motocarro, ya que los que tiene actualmente ya están muy gastados.
texts.en:
Jhonny is 30 years old.  He is a very kind and hard-working man who lives in his own home together with his wife, 29 year-old María, and his two beloved children, 10 year-old Moisés and 1 year-old Jack, who he would like to provide with a better quality of life.

For Jhonny, long work days are part of his routine.  He wakes up at 6 o'clock in the morning and, together with his motorcycle taxi, he goes out in search of customers who would like to arrive quickly and safely at their destinations.  After driving through the streets of the city of Pucallpa all day, at 10 o'clock at night he puts his vehicle away and rests, knowing that another long day of work awaits him the next day.

What Jhonny most enjoys about his work is chatting to his passengers and making their trip more pleasant.  He has been in this business for 15 years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be having to work all day away from his family.  Over time, he would like to set up a store for his wife to run.

This is Jhonny's second loan from MFP and he has never had any problems in making his repayments.  He always saves up so that he can make his repayments on time.  He is a very well-liked member of his community bank who always arrives very punctually.  He will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles he is requesting to buy new seats for his vehicle since the ones he has right now are very worn.

loans.use: to buy seats for his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Ibtihaj

texts.en:
Ibtihaj is a 41-year-old woman who is married and has two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a taxi driver and is photographed next to the car. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee who earns a decent salary. Ibtihaj has taken out a loan of $1,500 from Kiva partner, FATEN, so that her husband uses it to pay for taxi insurance and licensing fee. The loan Ibtihaj took which she will repay over 18 months to avoid exhausting the family financially.
Ibtehaj is a conservative woman, which is why she is not shown in the picture, and her husband appears instead.

loans.use: to cover taxi insurance and licensing fees.

loans.name: Gulnara's Group

texts.en:
Gulnara, 24, is the leader of this group. She grew up in a family of farmers and has been in this environment for her whole lifetime. She is comparatively younger than most of her colleagues in farming and cattle breeding, but her age doesn’t indicate her experience.

Even though Gulnara has two young children, she manages to devote a fair amount of time to developing her herd. The purpose of her loan is to buy additional livestock. Furthermore, she plans to discover new ways and techniques to produce quality farm goods and ensure a steady income for her family. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock.

loans.name: Marco Tulio

texts.es: Marco Tulio, tiene 53 años de edad, es casado y su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y a veces le ayuda con el trabajo de campo, es padre de 8 hijos, de los cuales dos ya son independientes y los otros seis viven junto con ellos en el hogar. Desde muy joven Don Marcos se dedica a trabajar como jornalero y gana muy poco dinero pero siempre aparta un poquito de este para ahorrarlo. Don Marcos a visualizado que puede dedicarse a criar cerdos, ya que de vez en cuando va comprando un cerdo y lo cria hasta que este esta lo suficientemente grande para venderlo, luego de las pocas ganancias que le quedan compra otro cerdo y lo cria y lo vende y así sucesivamente. Don Marcos solicita este prestamo para comprar 22 cerdos e instalar una pequeña granja en el patio de su casa y asi poder dedicarse de lleno a la actividad de cria de cerdos. Su  ventaja principal es que la carne de cerdo se puede vender a un buen precio aunque es un trabajo arduo. Su más grande sueño es ver a sus hijos graduados. Este es su tercer ciclo en FAMA y ha pagado sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Marco Tulio is 53 years old and married.  His wife devotes herself to the household chores, and sometimes she helps him in the field.  He has eight children.  Two of them are independent, and the other six live with them at home.

Ever since he was very young Marco worked as a day laborer.  He does not earn much money, but he always puts aside a little to save.  Marco had the idea that he could raise pigs.  Every now and then he buys a pig and raises it until is it big enough to sell.  Then, with the small earnings that are left, he buys another pig, raises it, sells it, and so on.

Marco is requesting this loan to buy 22 pigs and to set up a small farm on the patio of his house.  That way he will be able to fully commit to raising pigs.  His main advantage is that you can sell pigs for a good price even though it is hard work.

His biggest dream is to see his children graduate.

This is his third cycle with FAMA, and he has made his payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Balkhumor

texts.ru: Балхумор проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст, 48 лет. Замужем. У нее 8 детей. Ее дети работают в Российской Федерации. Сама Балхумор у себя дома открыла магазин. У нее магазин со смешанным ассортиментом. В этой области она работает пять лет. Кредит берт для покупки холодильника.
texts.en: Balkhumor lives in the Khuroson district.  She is 48 years old, married and has eight children.  Her children work in the Russian Federation.  Balkhumor opened a store at home.  Her store has miscellaneous merchandise.  She has been involved in this field for five years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of a refrigerator.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela de 24 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijo en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en el distrito de la Matanza que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Toda esta zona sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

Mariela se dedica a la elaboración y venta de chicha de jora (es una bebida rica elaborada a base de maíz y  muy consumida en el norte del Perú), esta actividad los realiza desde hace un año aproximadamente, ya que es una costumbre que ha pasado de generación en generación. Últimamente se ha incrementado las ventas de la chicha de jora en la zona donde vive, lo que le ha favorecido para poder incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Teniendo la oportunidad de crecer Mariela a solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más harina de maíz para la elaboración de chicha de jora y realizar arreglos en su vivienda, con la finalidad de obtener mayores ganancias con la venta de su producto y de tener mayor seguridad en su vivienda. Con sus ganancias podrá pagar su crédito y brindarle más comodidades y oportunidades a su familia.
texts.en:
24-year-old Mariela lives with her husband and son in their own home, which lacks basic services and is located in the La Matanza district in the administrative division of Piura. The population of this area work with agriculture and livestock.

Mariela manufactures and sells chicha de jora, a tasty beverage made ​​from corn which is widely consumed in the north of Peru. She has been doing this for about a year, and it is a custom that has passed from generation to generation. Lately, her sales of chicha in have increased in her area which has helped boost profits and improve the quality of life for her family.

Taking the opportunity to expand her business, Mariela has requested a loan through Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 soles. This will be used to buy more corn flour for the preparation of chicha and carry out repairs in her home, with the purpose of earning more from her product sales and being more secure at home. With her earnings, Mariela can repay her loan and provide more amenities and opportunities for her family.

loans.use: to purchase corn flour for the continued production of her chicha, and to carry out some repairs in her home

loans.name: Elicio German

texts.es:
Elicio Germán tiene 54 años de edad es casado vive con la esposa y con el hijo de tres años de edad en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Descripción de la Ventanilla  VRC Luchar para triunfar, se encuentra ubicada en el sector la poza, perteneciente a la ciudadela 10 de noviembre  Cantón Ventanas, Los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a diferentes labores tanto Agrícola como comercial.

Elicio tiene una mini tienda se dedica a la venta de productos como los víveres, harinas, bebidas gaseosas, productos para consumo humano. Los productos los compra en Ventanas y los vende en el negocio.

El crédito lo solicita para poder agrandar el negocio para adquirir más productos para poder venderlos, el crédito le ayudará muchísimo para poder cubrir las expectativas que tiene como comerciante.

El Sueño es poder superarse y llegar hacer una buena comerciante.
texts.en:
Elicio Germán is 54 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and 3-year-old son in Ventanas, in Los Ríos province.

The 'Luchar para Triunfar' community bank is located in La Poza sector, in 10 de Noviembre district, in Ventanas canton.  The members of the community bank work in different businesses, both agricultural and commercial.

Elicio has a mini-mart where he sells products such as provisions, flour, soda, products for human consumption.  He buys his products in Ventanas and sells them in his business.

Elicio is requesting this loan to expand his business and acquire more products to sell.  The loan will help him a lot in covering the expenses that he has as a retailer.

Elicio's dream is to do well and become a good salesman.

loans.use: to expand his business and acquire more products

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José de 32 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura,  ganadería y artesanía.

José desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (ovejas y aves de corral), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles  para la compra de más animales y de mejoramiento de su corral, con las ganancias que obtenga por la venta de sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como brindarle una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.  José es una persona que con esfuerzo y trabajo saca a sus hijos adelante junto con su esposa.
texts.en:
José is 32 years old.  He lives with his wife and children in his own house, which has only electricity, located in the Tambogrande district of the department of Piura.  The area is known for agriculture, cattle, and crafts.

José has raised and sold farm animals (sheep and poultry) for several years.  His corral is a suitable and extensive area behind his house.  He feeds them balanced feed so they will reach an optimum growth to be able to sell them in different markets in the area, and so get good profits to pay for his family expenses.

He has requested a loan of 1500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more animals and improve his corral.  With the profits he will make selling his animals, he will be able to cover his loan as well as give his family a better quality of life.

José is a person who, with effort and work, gets his children ahead together with his wife.

loans.use: to buy more animals of different types and to improve his corral.

loans.name: Radesa

texts.en:
Radesa is married with two children. She is 36 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental.

Radesa sells bananas in the community to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month,she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional fertilizers for her farm. 

Radesa has been a member of GDMPC for one year.  In the future, Radesa hope to improve her small business so that she can build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw materials for making shoes.

loans.name: C6318 Abunzubumwe Group

texts.en:
Theoneste is 44 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of three and seven years old. He is the leader of this group which is called "Abunzubumwe" in the local language. Theoneste has four years of experience selling various foods like beans, cassava, and sweet potatoes. In the photo, he is the man in the middle wearing a red shirt.

Theoneste has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by buying more foods like beans, cassava, and sweet potatoes to sell. With profits from this loan, Theoneste would like to satisfy his family's basic needs and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase more foods like bananas and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Asli

texts.en:
Asli is a 41-year-old woman who is single and lives with her parents and brothers. For the past five years, she has run a grocery store where she sells a variety of food products. Her business is the only source of income for her family. Her monthly income is 300 AZN, but this is too low to cover the needs of the family. Her brother helps to run the business and transport merchandise from warehouses.

Asli is requesting a 1,000 AZN loan to purchase more merchandise and increase her sales.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Luz Mariela

texts.es: La señora Luz Mariela a sus 57 años de edad es madre de un hijo de 19 años. La señora Luz Mariela es una gran emprendedora quien en el año 2.006 decide iniciar su propio negocio en un local de su casa, el cual le permitiera salir adelante al haber quedado sola con la obligación de su hijo. La señora Luz Mariela trabaja sola en su tienda, todos los días en una jornada desde las 6:00 a.m. hasta las 9:00 p.m. Esta actividad, la señora Luz Mariela la aprendió de su padre, quien tenía una tienda en la cual ella le ayudaba. La señora Luz Mariela desea comprar surtido para su negocio como arroz, aceite, panela, snakcs, café, papel higiénico, entre otros, que le permitan mejorar su servicio, aumentar sus ventas y así la calidad de vida de su familia. A futuro la señora Luz Mariela desea tener un supermercado en el cual pueda generar muchos empleos directos.
texts.en:
Luz Mariela is 57 years old and is the mother of a 19 year old child. Luz Mariela is a great entrepreneur who in 2006 decided to open her own home based business which permitted her to get ahead as she has been left alone to raise her child.

Luz Mariela works alone in her store, every day from 6:00AM until 9:00PM. She learned this business from her father who had a store in which she helped him.

Luz Mariela wants to buy supplies for her business such as rice, oil, panela [a sweetener that tastes similar to brown sugar, and is usually in a solid block], snacks, coffee, toilet paper and other items, that allow her to improve her service, expand her sales and thus improve the quality of her family life.

In the future Luz Mariela wants to have a mini-market in which she can create many direct jobs.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 27-year-old divorced woman from Al Salt, Al Balqa, Jordan.

Alaa has a souvenir shop. She started her business years ago from her home. Then, with her hard work, she was able to expand it into a shop near her house.  

Alaa is requesting a loan of 1000 JOD to purchase goods for the shop (souvenirs, accessories, etc.).

Alaa is looking to improve her shop by adding more space and employing other family members in it.

loans.use: to purchase goods for the shop (souvenirs, accessories, etc.)

loans.name: Wendin-Yide

texts.fr:
Mme WENDIN-YIDE  est  mariée  et mère d’un(01) enfant. Il  a 03ans. Il fait la maternelle. Elle a 01 personne  en charge.

Elle vend  des mèches  depuis 03mois. Elle s’approvisionne  à Lomé et à Abidjan. Ses clients sont  les femmes et les filles.

Elle veut  s’acheter 01 carton de mèche outré et ½ carton de tissage.

 Mme remet  ses bénéfices dans son fonds de roulement. Comme  ambition, elle rêve d’avoir une grande boutique de mèches.
texts.en:
Mrs. WENDIN-YIDE is married and the mother of one child.  He is three years old.  He attends nursery school.  She has one person in her care.

She has been selling hair pieces for three months. She gets her supplies in Lomé and in Abidjan.  Her clients are women and girls. 

She want to buy one case of hair extensions and a half case of hair weavings. 

Mrs. WENDIN-YIDE puts her earnings back into her business.  She dreams of opening a large hair salon one day.

loans.use: to buy one case of hair extensions and a half case of hair weavings.

loans.name: Nary

texts.en: Nary, 60, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers who grow rice and raise fish to sell. One of her children is a construction worker. Selling fish is the main source of income to support the family financially. Therefore, Nary has requested a loan of 400 USD to purchase more fish to sell in order to earn extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to build a new house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en: Chizi is a 42-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. Her husband Fadhili is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. Chizi has operated a firewood selling business for the past 10 years. She is also a food vendor selling potatoes, mangoes and bananas. Her potential clients are local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business. With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase more bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her living standard.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the stock.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.en:
Kossi D., aged 50, is married to two wives and father of six children. Trained as an auto body painter, he is presently working at that trade but with great difficulty due to lack of financial resources. His great worry is how to come by a new compressor pump to replace his old one that makes him lose a lot of customers.

He is asking for a loan of $1000 for the purchase of a new compressor pump which will permit him to regain his clientele and save on labor time.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, KIVA volunteer

Agé de 50 ans, monsieur D. Kossi est marié à deux femmes et père de six (06) enfants. Il a reçu une formation de Peintre auto, métier qu’il exerce en ce moment avec beaucoup de difficultés parce que les moyens financiers lui font défauts. Il n’a qu’un souci, l’achat d’une nouvelle pompe compresseur afin de changer rapidement la vielle qui lui fait perdre beaucoup de clients.

Il sollicite à cet effet un financement de $1000 pour acheter une nouvelle pompe compresseur lui permettant de gagner en clientèle et en temps.

loans.use: purchase of a new compressor pump (acheter une nouvelle pompe compresseur)

loans.name: Viviana

texts.en:
Viviana has a business selling crabs, in bundles and in jars. Viviana has experience in this business because it is a family owned business of 9 years. Her parents helped her brothers with the business. Viviana has managed the business following the death of her mother and because her clients call on her. Viviana works 4 days a week and attends to her clients from 7:00 AM to 20:00PM, delivering her products to the various restaurants that request them.

Viviana is applying for a loan to buy more crabs, meet and satisfy the demand of new clients, and to increase her business.

Viviana is 28 years old and has five children of which four are students. Her husband works as a taxi driver and helps her with the delivery of the merchandise to the various selling sites within and outside of her area. Viviana has also told us that as her business grows so does her income, allowing her to give her family a better quality of life in terms of nutrition and education.

Translated from Spanish by Martha Martinez, Kiva Volunteer.

Viviana tienen negocio de venta de cangrejos por atados y en tarrina. Viviana tiene experiencia en este negocio porque viene de familia desde hace 9 años. Sus padres les dieron el sustento a sus hermanos de este negocio. Viviana toma la dirección del negocio debido a que su mama falleció y sus clientes la buscaban. Viviana labora 4 días a la semana su atención al cliente es de 7:00 AM a 20:00 PM entregando sus productos a los diferentes restaurantes a quienes ellos proveen.

Viviana solicita préstamo para comprar mas cangrejos y poder cumplir con la demanda de nuevos clientes y así poder satisfacerlos e incrementar su negocio.

Viviana tiene 28 años 5 hijos de los cuales 4 estudian. Su esposo labora como taxista apoyándola siempre en el traslado de su mercadería a los diferentes puntos de ventas que tiene en el sector y fuera del sector. Viviana también nos dice que con el incremento de su negocio sus ganancias crecen y con ello podrá dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida en alimentación y educación.

loans.use:
Invest in crabs/  
Invertir en cangrejos

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.es:
Mr. Apolinar is the owner of a fruit stand. He is married and the father of 3 school-age children. He and his wife have been selling fruits and vegetables for over 5 years, and he is requesting this loan to construct a wall to provide better security for his location, and also to make some minor repairs to the roof, since on rainy days he has lost some of his merchandise due to leaks. He told us that this loan will help him offer a better quality of life to his family.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

El Sr. apolinar es dueño de un local de venta de frutas, es casado y padre de 3 hijos en edad escolar, junto a su esposa vende frutas y verduras desde hace más de cinco años y está solicitando el crédito para construir un muro y darle mayor seguridad a su local, además para hacerle unas reparaciones menores al techo ya que en los días de lluvia se la ha hechado a perder parte de su mercadería debido a las goteras. Nos comentó también que parte del dinero lo invertirá en el pago a sus proveedores. Espera que el crédito le ayude a brindarle un mejor nivel de vida a sus familiares.

loans.use: The loan will be used to enclose and make other repairs to his location, and to pay his suppliers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase her stock of cereal

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch T., age 28, sells grocery products from her home to the people in her community, earning around $16.00 in revenue. Her grocery business sells bulk items like sacks of rice which increase her revenue but not necessarily her profits. Her husband works at a carpentry shop, earning about $3 per day in income. The do not have children, but her dependent mother lives with them. In order to expand the variety of the products she sells so as to better meet her customers’ demands, she would like to request a loan of $700 to expand her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery inventory

loans.name: Amparo

texts.es:
Amparo is an enthusiast: her charisma helps to sell the immense variety of toys, gifts, and decorations she has for all occasions. For example, on Mothers' Day, she sells roses and card gifts; when they celebrate Halloween, she sells home decorations and costumes and masks for children. Now, she is preparing for Christmas to sell ornaments in a couple of weeks. For the moment, she continues to travel around to sell toys and trinkets from a mobile stand. She has a pressing need to rent a small tricycle so she can move her Christmas products around as well as some capital to buy novelty items to gain some substantial profits. This will allow her to invest in another business activity in the future and improve her dear family's standard of living. Let's make this woman's request possible since her business is successful.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Amparo, es muy entusiasta, el carisma que tiene la ayuda mucho al momento de comercializar la inmensa variedad de juguetes y adornos que posee para diversas temporadas y ocasiones. Por ejemplo en el día de las madres vende rosas y tarjetas para regalar, cuando celebran haloween adornos para decorar la casa y algunos disfraces y máscaras para los niños. Ahora para navidad se está preparando para en un par de semanas iniciar la venta de artículos de decoración, por el momento continúa vendiendo juguetes de manera ambulante.Su apremiante necesidad es obtener un pequeño triciclo en alquiler para movilizar los objetos navideños y así mismo una inyección de capital para adquirir mayor cantidad de novedosos artículos para alcanzar sustanciales ganancias que le permitan su futura inversión en otra actividad comercial con el propósito de incrementar el nivel de vida de su querida familia.Posibilitemos su petición para que su actividad comercial sea exitosa.

loans.use: To rent a small tricycle and capital to buy more various Christmas items

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
Leonarda is 59 years old and lives with her husband Sindulfo Mongers, who 10 years ago suffered a stroke which left him semi-paralyzed.

Leonarda started this business with the help of her husband and the contribution of her salary as a teacher. The grocery store is 20 years old. Leonarda is a retired teacher and she reinvests the income she receives into the business.

She has an established clientele and her grocery store is well known in the city. She needs a loan to invest in remodeling and fixing up her business locale.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Leonarda tiene 59 años, vive con su esposo Sindulfo Monges quien hace 10 años sufrió derrame cerebral, dejándolo semi paralizado.

Leonarda, se inició en el negocio con la ayuda de su marido y el aporte de su sueldo como profesora. La despensa cuenta con 20 años de antigüedad, ella en la actualidad es Docente Jubilada y los ingresos que percibe los reinvierte en el negocio.

Actualmente cuenta con clientela formada y su despensa es bien conocida en la ciudad. Necesita del crédito ya que piensa invertir en la refacción de su local comercial.

loans.use: fixing up commercial locale (refacción del local comercial.)

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca’s husband is a merchant, however the business does not provide steady income as sales can be high or low at any given time. Noticing that local vendors seemed to do well at it, Francisca began to sell used clothing. Little by little, she began to be noticed at the market. Currently, she has clients that seek her out to buy her merchandise.

Regardless, Francisca does not currently have enough merchandise to offer her customers. For this reason, she asks for a loan of $375USD to be repaid over a period of five months. With these funds, Francisca would be able to buy more seasonal used clothing for her customers. With your support, Francisca will be able to help her family get ahead financially.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El esposo de Francisca es comerciante, y con un negocio no es constante la entrada de dinero. Puesto que en unas ocasiones venden mucho y en otras no. Fue por eso que Francisca decidió ponerse a vender ropa usada, puesto que se daba cuenta que otras personas que vendían este tipo de productos les iba muy bien. Poco a poco se fue dando a conocer en el mercadito. Actualmente ya tiene clientas que la buscan para comprarle sus productos.

Sin embargo actualmente Francisca no cuenta con mercancía suficiente para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Francisca podrá comprar una paca de ropa usada de la temporada para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Francisca podrá sacar adelante a su familia con las ganancias.

loans.use: Purchase used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Percy

texts.es:
Percy is the father of three daughters, whom he adores. To support them, he works as an artisan, which isn't terrible for him either since he enjoys his work and has an enthusiasm for it because of the capacity for creativity required in his job. However, his enjoyable work, which is also his primary source of income, may see itself hit a hard patch because of the difficulty in attaining some prime ingredients and other production materials. This is why he is asking for a loan, so that he can acquire these materials and continue making his creative artesian crafts and not have to slow down his labor because of the lack of materials. Percy hopes that your noble heart will help him to continue in his life as an artisan.

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Percy, es padre de tres hijas que son su adoración; por ellas se dedica a la artesanía actividad que no le es difícil debido a que le gusta mucho y se desenvuelve con entusiasmo por la enorme capacidad de creatividad que se necesita para sus diversos trabajos manuales, sin embargo su agradable labor y principal fuente de ingreso puede verse interrumpida por su difícil acceso a las diversas semillas y materiales de producción.Es por ello que solicita a usted un préstamo para adquirir sus materiales y seguir elaborando sus creativos productos artesanales y así no interrumpir su actividad económica .Percy espera que su noble corazón lo pueda ayudar a seguir su vida como artesano.

loans.use: Injection of capital for more investments

loans.name: Qamar Din

texts.en: Qamar Din lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is single and lives with his family. He has a retail shop where he works part time. He has a large number of clients and so he is requesting an individual loan to buy extra goods like rice, oil, baskets, shampoo and sweets to enlarge his shop. He wants to make a good monthly income to help his family and make a better future for himself.

loans.use: To buy extra goods such as rice, oil, baskets, shampoo and sweets for his grocery store.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi N. lives in a single family with her husband and two children in Dhalko, Kathmandu. Dhalko is one of the busy cities of the Kathmandu district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in small businesses.

Mrs N. opened her tailoring shop four years ago. She took six months of training for tailoring work. She prefers to make ladies dress like blouses, Kurta-Sulwar, and so on. She also makes school uniforms for boys and girls.

Due to a lack of funds she cannot expand her business so she is requesting a loan of Rs 10000.00 to buy raw material for her work.

Mrs N.’s husband's name is Chudan N. and he works in a hardware store on salary basis. Her son is studying in BBS and daughter is studying in grade 10. Her great wish is to live as the middle class family.

loans.use: To buy raw material for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Sergey

texts.en:
Sergey runs a small business selling car parts at the “avto-rhinok” or auto market in Berdyansk, Ukraine. The auto market is made up of many individual entrepreneurs who sell all sorts of auto related products, from windshield washer fluid and oil, to seat covers, spare parts, and tires. Sergey has a very favorable location at the market for his business. He has been in business for over 15 years and has developed a reputation for honesty. Married with one son, Sergey’s business provides a good income for his family.

Sergey has requested a short term loan to purchase additional inventory, which will help him to continue operating a successful enterprise.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander F. offers transportation services in Ivano-Frankivsk in the Western Ukraine. He has a beautiful wife and three adorable children. Alexander has been working in this sphere of trade for eight years. He has benefited a lot from Nadiya Ukraine financial services. Today Alexander’s daily income is about $40.

Alexander would like to receive a loan of 3500 Grivnas to cover some maintenance costs and to repair the running gear of his vehicle. He is always trying to find ways to reduce costs and increase his profits.

One of Alexander’s main goals is to provide for his family of five. He’s the only breadwinner in the family as his wife is pregnant with their fourth child. We believe Alexander’s perfect credit history with Nadiya Ukraine and focused approach as a businessman will secure prompt loan repayment of the current loan to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela belongs to Banco Comunal Andrés Santa Cruz de Chuachua in the Zepita district, Chucuito province, Puno region, Peru. She is 30 years old, is married and has a son to support. She went to school until her third year of high school. She prepares quinua and cañihua juice, starting work at 3:30 in the morning and working until 9:00 p.m. from Monday to Saturday selling her products at the Desaguadero district terminal or to motorists. With previous loans, she has increased her capital. With this 500 nuevo sol loan, which she will repay in four months, Graciela will buy three sacks of sugar and two sacks of cornstarch for preparing juice. She is happy with her business and is already increasing her capital and income. Four years ago, Graciela got started with her business thanks to her friend Modesta, who taught her how to prepare juices, and Manuela Ramos, who gave her credit. Her dreams are to have a grocery store in Desaguadero and see her son become a police officer.

Translated from Spanish by Ian Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

Graciela pertenece al Banco Comunal Andrés Santa Cruz de Chuachua del distrito de Zepita, Provincia Chucuito – Juli y Región de Puno. Tiene 30 años de edad, casada y tiene un hijo que depende de ella, su estudió fue hasta tercero de secundaria. Ella se dedica al preparado de jugo de quinua y cañihua, para preparar se levanta a las 3:30 a.m. y descansa a las 9:00 p.m., esto vende en el distrito de Desaguadero en el Terminal zonal o paradero de los carros de lunes a sábado. Con los anteriores créditos logró incrementar su capital. Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará 3 sacos de azúcar y 2 bolsas de maicena para el preparado de jugos. Ella esta contenta con su negocio, ya que está incrementando su capital y ingresos económicos. Graciela, hace cuatro años se dedica a este negocio, gracias a que su amiga Modesta le enseñó a preparar jugos y además agradece a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo con el crédito. Su mayor sueño es poner una tienda de abarrotes en Desaguadero y su hijo sea policía.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of sugar and cornstarch

loans.name: Bartolina

texts.es:
La Sra. Bartolina tiene 54 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales solo una es menor de edad y esta en la secundaria, los tres mayores son independientes y profesionales.

La Sra. Morocha como es conocida por todos sus familiares y amigos se dedica a la venta de diferentes productos de alimentos y golosinas dentro de un Colegio de la comunidad, ofrece el desayuno y la merienda en nutritivos menús para los estudiantes de la etapa secundaria del colegio, este trabajo lo viene realizando hace 6 años.

Se inicio primeramente con la venta ambulante fuera del colegio y como cada día sus clientes fueron aumentando la directora del colegio le ofreció estar responsable de la cantina dentro de la misma cobrándole una suma de alquiler por el local, desde entonces su negocio ha crecido no solo en tamaño sino también en servicios ya que la sra. Bartolina anexo un pequeño comedor para los profesores que debían trabajar doble turno.

Esta feliz con su trabajo, por que el entusiasmo de estar rodeada de gente joven con mucha energía y vitalidad le da fuerzas para seguir brindando lo mejor de ella.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías tales como: golosinas, gaseosas, hamburguesas, panchos, helados, jugos, galletitas y otros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bartolina is 54 years old; she is married and has 4 children. Only one of them is a minor and is in high school while the three older ones are independent and professionals. Mrs. Morocha, as she is known by all her family members and friends, sells edible products and candy at a school in her community. She offers healthy menus of breakfast and snacks for high school students. She has been in this line of work for 6 years.

She initially started her sales on foot outside of the school, and since each day her clientele grew in size, the school principal offered her to be responsible for the snack bar inside of the facilities and charges her a fee for the space. Since then, her business has grown not only in size, but also in the amount of services since Mrs. Bartolina has annexed a small dining area for the teachers who have to work double shifts.

She is very happy with her work because she finds the enthusiasm of being surrounded by young people with lots of energy and vitality gives her strength to continue giving it her all.

She is asking for a loan to purchase items such as candy, sodas, hamburgers, 'panchos', ice cream, juice, cookies and more.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase items such as candy, sodas, hamburgers, 'panchos', ice cream, juice, cookies and more

loans.name: Frida's Tuamke Group

texts.en:
Frida is 29 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 9, 8 and 6 years old. She has been a bites and fish seller since June 2008. Every day, she works from 4am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Frida is now looking for a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with shop ownership, charcoal sales, phone vouchers, and food sales.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Tasleem's Group

texts.en:
Tasleem baji is the wife of A. M. and lives in a small area named Bund Road, of City Lahore, Pakistan. She owes a brick room and has been living in it for the last 21 years. She is the mother of three sons. Her elder son works in a private bank. The next to him works in a factory. Her younger son is free and doesn’t do anything. Tasleem baji’s husband is a government servant. Tasleem baji herself has a clothing selling business. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to expand her business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Razia baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Safia baji wants a loan to buy more cigarettes for her cigarette shop. Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy a buttonhole machine for making shirts.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Majidah

texts.en:
Majidah is a 57-year-old widow who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon, with her three children. She has owned her grocery store for eleven years. She is requesting a loan of $1000 to increase her capital. 

Majidah is unique in her line of work because she only buys good quality products, especially cleaning and shampoo products. She also sells food, candies and beverages. She decided to take the loan to diversify her merchandise. Her customers are friends, neighbors and some passers-by. She said that it is not always very easy to keep a client, which is why she is doing her best to keep them by diversifying her merchandise.
 
Majidah decided to start her business to support her family after her husband stopped working for personal reasons. She hopes that, in the future, she will be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Majidah needs the loan to increase her capital

loans.name: Becky

texts.en: Becky D. makes a living selling smoked fish. Demand for her products is high. She has been in this business for a long time. She is 44 years old and married with five children. She needs a loan to buy more smoked fish to sell. She says thank you to everyone who makes this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more smoked fish for resale

loans.name: Edwin Bernabe

texts.es:
Bernabé vive en la calle San Antonio de la ciudad de El Alto,

Trabaja  junto a su esposa, en su taller ubicado en su domicilio, como confeccionista de maletines y mochillas las cuales los distribuye al por mayor.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de materia prima (tela, esponja y otros por cantidad).
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le permite otorgarle el crédito
texts.en:
Bernabé lives on San Antonio road in the city of El Alto. He works with his wife, in his home-based workshop, making briefcases and backpacks which he distributes in bulk. He will use the loan to buy raw materials such as fabric, sponge, and so on in bulk. This is his first loan with Impro: our evaluation found that he qualifies for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Issiah

texts.en:
Issiah A. sells mobile phone cards and agriculture tools and implements at Nyankumasi near Cape Coast. Issiah has received junior high education. He is married and has 4 dependents. His wife is a petty trader.

Issiah has been selling mobile phone cards and agriculture tools and implements since 2001. He is responsible for paying the children's school fees, rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. His loan will be used as additional capital to enable him to increase the sale of mobile phone cards, agricultural tools, and implements to meet the increase in demand by his customers. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to reinvest for the expansion of his business in mobile phone cards and agricultural tools.

Beside him in the photograph are the mobile phone cards packed in the box for sale.

loans.use: additional capital to increase the sale of phone cards, etc.

loans.name: Elizerbeth

texts.en:
Elizerbeth K. is currently in the business of selling onions and has applied for a loan in order to expand her business.  Elizerbeth is 32 years old and married; her husband is a security guard. They have two children who go to school. Elizerbeth With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which targets returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To pay school fees for two children

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en:
Rahima M. is married with two children. She started her business out of economic pressure six years ago, as her husband’s salary wasn’t enough to cover the family’s expenses. She began to investigate the types of work she could do, and one of her friends recommended that she sell children’s clothing. She decided to try it. Little by little, she brought in more clients, and her income increased as she sold more clothing. Rahima is applying for a loan of $700 USD to purchase merchandise to fill existing client orders, which she is offering to repay in 5 months.

She hopes that you will collaborate with her. She and her family thank you for supporting them and helping them move ahead.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to fill client orders

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es socia del Bancomunal  Las Surcanitas.
Elizabeth es conviviente tiene 40 años, cuatro hijos de 20, 17,15 y 11 años, los tres últimos están en la escuela estatal, y el mayor está estudiando estudios en un instituto.
Elizabeth vende en el mercado sábado y domingo, en un triciclo tazones plástico, jarras y otros, en la semana ella vende golosinas  tiene un  puesto, cada día sus hijas le ayudan en las ventas de golosinas..   
Elizabeth necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles, para la compra de bisutería  que va a vender en una feria.
Desde que está en finca, ha podido lograr muchas cosas, antes vendía golosinas, ahora tiene más capital para invertir, su economía ha mejorado.  
El sueño de Elizabeth es tener una tienda grande, tipo minimarket.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the “Las Surcanitas” comunal bank. Elizabeth lives with the father of her children and she is 40 years old. She has four children, who are 20, 17, 15, and 11 years old. The younger three are studying at the state school and the oldest one is studying in an institute. Elizabeth sells plastic bowls and vases in the Saturday and Sunday market from a tricycle. During the week she sells sweets from a market stall. Each day, her daughters help her to sell the sweets. Elizabeth needs a loan of 2600 PEN to buy costume jewelry that she will sell at a fair. Since she has been with FINCA, she has been able to achieve many things. Before, she sold sweets. Now that she has more capital to invest, her economic situation has improved. Elizabeth’s dream is to have mini-market type store.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Elizabeth needs a loan of 2600 PEN to buy costume jewelry that she will sell at a fair.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou D. confectionne des pagnes pour les revendre à Diourbel, une petite ville rurale située 150 kilomètres de Dakar.  Les pagnes fait un parti très important de la culture Sénégalaise, et les femmes Sénégalaises sont toujours bien habillées.  Alors, le commerce de Madame D. marche bien.  Elle a fait ce commerce depuis 6 ans, et elle a déjà reçu un premier prêt de 50,000 CFA ($100) auprès de l’IMCEC qu’elle a bien remboursé.  Maintenant elle sollicite ce deuxième crédit pour acheter les pagnes et autres matériels pour son entreprise.  Madame D. est mariée avec des enfants qu’elle soutient avec ses revenus.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatou D. makes pagne clothing for resale in Diourbel, a rural town located 150 km from Dakar. Pagnes are a very important part of the culture in Senegal, and Senegalese women are always well dressed. So Ms. D.’s business is doing well. She has been in this business for six years, and she has had an initial loan of 50,000 francs CFA from IMCEC that she repaid. Now she’s requesting this second loan to buy pagnes and other supplies for her enterprise. Ms. D. is married and has children who she supports with her revenues.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 52 years old and married with four children. She sells foodstuffs. 

Veronica hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She promises to pay back her loan promptly and she says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.ru: Иброхим мужчина  в возрасте 43 лет , отец троих детей. Он проживает в районе Уткансой, вблизи горных окраинах. В своём районе он работает врачом в центре здоровья своего посёлка. Иброхим  имеет большой вес в своём районе, его все уважают. Он по специальности врач терапевт, но из-за не хватки его заработной платы на жизнь, он занимается  откормом и продажей скота. С этого бизнеса он имеет хороший доход. Поэтому для увеличения своего скота он хочет получить кредит.
texts.en:
Ibrohim is a 43 year old man, the father of three children. He lives in the Utkansoi district, near the outskirts of the mountains. He works in the district as a doctor at his town's health center. He has great leverage in the district; everyone respects him. He is a doctor (general practitioner) by training, but because his salary is inadequate to live on he also raises and sells livestock. The business earns a good income. He would like to take out a loan to obtain more animals.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling livestock

loans.name: Askar

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Сатторов Аскар -мужчина 1977 года рождения,женатб имеет двоих детей.Около шести лет Аскар вместе со своей женой торгует на колхозном рынке Джаббор-Расуловского района продуктами питания.Два раза в неделю он приезжает в город Худжанд за товаром. Самыми ходовыми товарами в настоящий момент являются сахар-песок и макаронные изделия.Так как начался сезон фруктов все хозяйки заготавливаются на зиму кампотами и вареньем.Кроме того идёт сезон полевых работ и многие жители переезжают на свои земельные участки.Чтобы каждый раз не ездить на рынок они запасаются продуктами питания,в том числе макаронами.Поэтому на полученный займ Аскар решил закупить сахар-песок и макароны.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Askar S. is a man who was born in 1977, is married and has two children. For about six years Askar with his wife have been selling food on the farmer market in the Djaboor-Rasulov region. He travels to the town of Khujand for the goods twice a week. The goods that sell well at this time is sugar and pastas. The season for fruits has begun and the women are getting ready and stocking up for the winter for jams and compotes. Besides that it is the season when farmers work on the land and many residents have relocated to their farms. They stock up with food such as pasta so that they don't have to travel to the markets too often. This is why Askar decided to use the loan to buy sugar and pasta.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy six bags of sugar and three bags of pasta

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
Khem R., 28, is a married woman and the mother of one lovely young child who is of school age. She currently works sewing clothes in the garment industry and gets a specific salary of $90 a month to support her own family’s food needs. 

Khem R. is married to Mr. Soeung Neang, 31 years old, who works driving a motorbike taxi. He has been using an existing motor for a long time to provide taxi service. Lately, he can’t attract client because their motor is too old and breaks down frequently. Therefore, Khem R. would like a loan to replace it. Note: Khem R.'s husband is picture, because she was not available at that time.

loans.use: To replace an old motorbike

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Six years ago Amelia C., now age 50, was unemployed and single and supported by her two adult children. She decided she wanted to turn her life around and took a sewing class in order to start her own business making curtains and bedding. Amelia took out her first loan to buy a sewing machine and fabric to start her business.

Now, 6 years later, she is a shining example of how much a little opportunity can go. She frequently travels to surrounding towns to sell her well-crafted curtains and bedding which are in high demand. Now she is requesting a loan to buy another sewing machine so she can hire another employee and increase production to meet the high demand. Right now she makes all of her products from her house, but she has a dream of one day of having her own store with multiple employees helping her sew. 

Amelia is now an independent woman and instead of depending on her children, she is able to provide for them. She has experienced a new sense of self-confidence and empowerment and she is excited to continue to grow her business. By supporting this loan, you can help Amelia come one step closer to achieving her dreams!

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Rosario Group

texts.es: El grupo “Rosario” esta bajo la presidencia de la señora Elizabeth y se encuentra conformada por 12 miembros que ya van cursando juntos su tercer siclo en los cuales han demostraron responsabilidad, honestidad unión y mucha solidaridad, son gente con ganas de trabajar y salir adelante. La mayoría de las socias se dedica al comercio de abarrotes, venta de carne de pollo, dulces y artefactos eléctricos el resto de los socios se dedica a la confección de prendas deportivas y a la elaboración de tejidos en telares artesanales. La competencia en el mercado de venta de productos es alta pero las socias saben como salir adelante alejándose del mercado central debido a la competencia, entre las socias que se dedican a la confesión de ropa y tejidos artesanales tienen clientela debido a la calidad de sus productos que se diferencian del resto gracias a sus diseños y calidad. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición de mercadería, insumos y materia prima para aumentar sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos que son el sustento de sus hogares.
texts.en:
The “Rosario” Group is led by Sra. Elizabeth, the president, and is comprised of 12 members who are working together on their third loan cycle. They have demonstrated responsibility, honesty, cooperation, and camaraderie. The members are eager to work in order to get ahead. The majority of them have retail businesses that sell groceries, chicken, candy, and electrical appliances. The remaining members manufacture sportswear and hand-woven articles.

Competition is quite high, so the members are aware that they must conduct their business away from the central market in order to succeed. The members who produce clothing and handicrafts have distinguished their products from other vendors because of their design and quality, and their customers have noticed.

The loans issued to the group will be used to acquire merchandise, supplies, and materials so that the members can increase their sales and earn more income to support their households.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Kossiwa E. est une femme âgée de 31, marié et mère de 2 enfants. Elle vit  à Adéta une ville située à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Elle voudrait acheter un congélateur en vue d’accroitre sa production de jus de citron ; banane ; ananas ; bissape  etc… et d’eau. Avec ses bénéfices elle voudrait construire petit à petit une maison.

loans.use: Achat de congélateur

loans.name: Stanely's Group

texts.en: M. Stanely is the leader of his lending group in Bushenyi. He is a married man with 4 children aged 18 – 6 years, as he cares for 1 orphan. He is a business man with a retail shop that sells general merchandise in Kabusaho trading centre for 9 years which he transformed from selling yellow bananas. His main challenge is transporting his products from the main town to the village where his shop is making him earn 200,000/= as profits a month. Stanely has a dream of shifting his shop to Bushenyi main town where he will be able to make more sales and more money as a result. He also wants to see all his children educated to the University level by increasing his profitability. He needs a loan to be able to buy more stock for increased turn over. He is really a hard working man.

loans.use: Buying more retail stock for increased profitability.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda H. is from the village of Mansabay Bajo. She is 45 years old. Merlinda is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Merlinda owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Merlinda has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Merlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. Merlinda is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Merlinda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca C. H. D. V. D. 47 años D. edad resiD. en el occidente del país en el departamento D. Ahuachapán,  junto a su esposo. Francisca tuvo la iniciativa D. montar un negocio en su casa para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar y es así como hace Francisca, ahora ella  posee su negocio una tienda, con cinco años D. dar servicio a sus files clientes, el crédito que hoy ella solicita es para surtir su negocio D. mayor cantidad D. productos.
texts.en:
Francisca C. H. D. V. is 47 years old and lives in the west of the country, in the department of Ahuachapan with her husband.
