Francisca had the idea to begin a business from home in order to help her husband with the household costs, and this is what she did. Now she has a store, and she has been serving her loyal clientele for five years. The credit that she is asking for today is to stock her business with a greater number of products.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her business with a greater number of products/surtir su negocio de mayor cantidad de productos

loans.name: Jeovany Daniel

texts.es: El joven  Jeovany Jarquín tiene 27 años de edad, casado, tiene dos hijos sus esposa trabaja le ayuda con los gastos del pago de agua, luz y lo que haga falta, reside en el barrio Healeah en la capital de Managua sus metas es construir su vivienda, Hombre trabajador, buen padre que lo importante y primordial es la seguridad y protección de su familia, trabaja en la aria de mensajería en una empresa de diseño, desde hace seis meses, anteriormente trabajaba como guardia de seguridad, con un salario muy bajo que solo le permitía comprar la alimentación de su familia como dificultades ha encontrado la inestabilidad laboral. Con el préstamo en Afodenic comprara materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, bloques para la construcción de su casa ya que es muy humilde hecha de zinc y tabla pero los materiales están viejos ya y necesita comenzar hacer el arranque de concreto para firmeza de las paredes ya que desea darle a su familia una casa digna en donde se pueda dormir un poco mejor con seguridad. Da las gracias a la institución por hacer posible su sueño de todo padre de dar un techo a sus hijos y que  por falta económica abecés no se logra lo esperado.
texts.en:
Jeovany Jarquín is 27 years old, married, and has two children. His wife works and does whatever she can to help pay for water and electricity. They live in the Hialeah neighborhood of the capital city of Managua. Jeovany’s goals include building a house. He is a hardworking man and a good father who wants to provide security and protection for his family. Currently he works as a messenger for a design firm and has been at this job for six month. He previously worked as a security guard, but his salary alone was not enough to feed his family. Jeovany has had difficulties in the past finding stable employment.

With this loan from AFODENIC, he will buy construction materials such as cement, iron, and concrete blocks so that he can build his house. The modest structure his family currently lives in is made of zinc and wooden planks. The existing materials are old, so he needs to tear them down so that he can build reinforced walls that will give his family a decent home where they can sleep a bit more securely. Jeovany thanks the Institution for making possible the dream of any father to provide his children with a roof over their heads and basic necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to begin construction of his house

loans.name: Tirus Murage

texts.en:
Tirus is 44 years old and married with five children. His main source of income is from a portrait (wall-hanging) sales business, which he has been operating for eight years. Tirus used to hawk a variety of items (pegs, basins, mirrors, portraits, etc.) and discovered that portraits sold the best. From this knowledge, he decided to operate exclusively in the sale of portraits. He now earns a profit of about 10,000 Kenyan shillings a month from this.

With this loan from KADET, a Kiva partner, Tirus is expanding his source of income. He is opening a small general shop to sell items like soap, gum, maize, rice, salt, candy, bread, soda, cooking fat and eggs. The location of this shop is on the Kiambu-Ndumberi highway and his customers are neighbors in the area. 

Tirus' dream is to educate his children through the high school level and to continue to grow his business. 

About KADET: 

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To open a small general shop as a secondary business to sell items like soap, gum, rice, maize, salt, bread, etc.

loans.name: Myagmar

texts.en:
Myagmar G. is 55 years old and lives with his wife and two youngest children in Uvs province, one of Mongolia's western provinces. His two oldest sons are 19 and 22 years old and are both university students in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His two youngest daughters go to local secondary schools in Uvs province.

Myagmar retails bags of coals to locals, especially during the cold season when families purchase a lot coal to keep their homes warm. He mostly purchases coal from local mines and resells it to local small businesses and families. As he has been selling coal since 2003, many small business owners and families always purchase their coal from him. He has been a reliable and good supplier of coal for their families and their small businesses.

Although he is already 55 years old, Myagmar is still capable of carrying bags of coal and is happy with his business. He requests a loan to purchase more coal for reselling. 


About XacBank:
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.
 To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.
 To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase more coal to sell

loans.name: Kirowooza Group, Mukono

texts.en: M. Annet is a hard-working and determined lady with a retail shop in Kirowooza that she has been operating for 5 years. She is able to make 200,000/= as profits from her sales and she hopes that with increased stock, she can do more. Her profits help her to save, allowing her to pay school fees for her 4 children while taking care of her parents. She attracts her customers using her good customer care skills. Annet needs a loan to help restock her shop with more goods. She hopes to save more from the increased profits from this loan, and she hopes her family will continue to be in good health.

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop with more goods.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina O., 57, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Leonicio O., she and her husband manage their own variety store. 

Josefina has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow four times in CCT’s Cooperative.  The reason she was consistent in paying her dues was that she used almost all the money she borrowed as capital for her business.  Because of this, she now earns a net income PHP 3,400 per month.  

Now with your help, she would like to apply for PHP 10,000 loan. This amount will be mostly used to buy more stock for her store, like assorted snacks, sachets, shampoos, laundry powder, candies and chocolates.

She dreams that one day she will have her own grocery store and that their lives will be more comfortable. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy stock for her store like assorted snacks, sachets, shampoos, laundry powder, candies and chocolates

loans.name: Trabajando Juntas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Trabajando Juntas” esta representado por la señora Ines Janett y conformada por 10 miembros muy unidos y entusiastas de salir adelante en sus negocios. Cada una de ellas tienen diferentes actividades como la costurera de prendas de vestir al por mayor, venta de repuestos de automóviles, Transporte Público de pasajeros, impresión de textos, venta de tarjetas y chips, atención en internet, venta de cosméticos por catálogo, venta y colocación de pisos de madera, atención en almacén y la venta de comida. La competencia en el rubro comercial es alta pero todos saben como salir adelante con sus negocios ya que de ello depende el sustento de sus familias. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición de mercadería, insumos y herramientas de trabajo así como para la ampliación de sus locales comerciales y reparación de sus vehículos de trabajo. A pesar de ser su primer ciclo las socias ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos comunales trabajando con créditos en instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital con la cual están agradecidos por su apoyo y confianza.  .
texts.en:
The “Working Together” Group is represented by Mrs. Ines Janett and made up of 10 very united members who are very enthusiastic about getting ahead in their businesses. Each has different activities, including wholesale dress making, selling replacement parts for cars, public transport of passengers, text printing, selling cards and chips, internet services, catalog sales of cosmetics, sale and installation of wood floors, operating a general store, and selling meals. Commercial competition is high but they all know how to advance their businesses, and that the wellbeing of their families depends on it. The purpose of this loan is to acquire merchandise, supplies, and working tools, as well as to expand their stores or repair their work vehicles. Even though this is their first loan cycle, the members can already count on experience in group finance with institutions like Fundación Agricapital, and they are grateful for its help and confidence.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MERCHANDISE AND SUPPLIES, AND TO EXPAND OR REPAIR THEIR STORES AND VEHICLES

loans.name: Kem

texts.en:
At least fifty percent of Cambodian people earn a living by fishing in and around the Tunle Sap River. One of these people, Mr. Kem K., 45, earns his daily revenue by fishing. Presently he has a partner in his wife, who stays at home to plant a few vegetables to make a living. They have five children who are teenagers who are no longer in school but are employed.

Kem K. applies for a loan for his wife to buy more farming supplies for her business.

loans.use: To buy more farming supplies for his wife's business

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Claudio, tiene 45 años y es casado. El socio Claudio forma parte del banco comunal “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” de la Asociación Arariwa. El socio Claudio se dedica a la compra de ganado y venta de carne, el nos cuenta que compra ganado en la ciudad de Huancarari a sus vecinos y después lleva carne a la ciudad de Cosñipata (Es uno de los distritos de Paucartambo). Ya son diez años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Claudio  es un padre trabajador que requiere el préstamo de los 1900 soles, que invertirá en comprar más ganado como tres ovejas y también va comprar papa, chuño, habas y trigo.  
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. 

(El distrito peruano de Huancarani es uno de los 6 distritos de la Provincia de Paucartambo, ubicada en el Departamento de Cusco, perteneciente a la Región Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Claudio is 45-years old and married. He belongs to the "Once de Mayo-Huancarani" community bank, which is a part of Asociacion Arariwa. Claudio buys livestock in the town of Huncarani and then sells the meat in Cosnipata (one of the districts of Paucartambo). This has been his job for 10 years and he has done very well thanks to his strong work ethic. Claudio is a hard-working father who is requesting a loan of 1900 soles which he will use to purchase additional livestock (including three sheep) as well as potatoes, dried potatoes, beans, and wheat. He is extemely thankful for this loan opportunity and he commits himself to pay back the loan on schedule. (The district of Huancarani is one of the 6 districts of the Paucartambo province, located in the department of Cuzco, within the region of Cuzco, Peru).

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase livestock, potatoes, beans, and wheat

loans.name: Elsa  Maria

texts.es: Doña Elsa Maria, habita el municipio de Nueva Guinea en la Colonia Talolinga junto a su familia compuesta por su marido y cuatro hijos, sandra de 16 años, va iniciar estudios universitario, Derling de 15 año, estudia segundaria, Dervin Yarel estudia primer año de segundaria y Yarelis Danieska de 2 año, sus hijos mayores le ayudan con el cuido de la finca cuando salen de clase, solicita a AFODENIC su primer crédito para compra de vaca parida, para fortalecer su inventario ganadero, y mejorar la alimentación de sus niño obteniendo mayores ingreso para su familia,   esta señora es una mujer trabajadora en las actividades del campo, se destaca como una mujer lider en la colonia, le gusta trabajar y le tiene mucho amor a todas sus actividades que se desarrolla en su finca, en con unión con su familia, su anhelo es tener mejor ganado de producción de leche para lograr incrementar sus ingresos y brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Elsa Marie lives in Colonia Talolinga in the Nueva Guinea municipality. She lives with her family, which is comprised of her husband and their four children. Sandra, age 16, is going to start her university studies. Derling, age 15, goes to high school. Derven Yarel is in his first year of high school. The youngest is two year old Yarelis. The older children help take care of the farm when they leave class. She is asking Afodenic for her first loan to buy a dairy cow in order to strengthen their livestock inventory. This will also improve the children’s nutrition and get greater income for the family. This lady works hard in the fields, and she stands out as a woman who is a leader in the neighborhood. She likes to work, and she really loves all of the activities that she does together with her family on the farm. Her desire is to have more milk producing livestock to increase their earnings and offer her family better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Yoshoda

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoshoda N. is a 26-year-old married woman who lives in Tangal, Lalitpur. She lives with her husband and their one daughter. Her husband, Mr. Gagan N., is a marketing officer, and her daughter is in pre-primary school.

Mrs. N. opened a grocery store a year ago to improve her family's standard of living. In her grocery store, she sells various types of groceries, including maize, rice, and snacks. Currently, Mrs. N. is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 NPR ($150) to invest in her grocery store. Specifically, she would like to purchase additional groceries for resale purposes.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional inventory

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice sells and supplies drinks for various ceremonies like birthdays, weddings, burial ceremonies and more. She has been in business for the past six years and, with this trade, she assists her husband in taking care of the children.

Beatrice has been borrowing from LAPO micro-finance for the past three years and she is a faithful client. She orders her goods once every two weeks in large quantity at a discount. She is requesting a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more drinks to sell which will enable her meet her customers’ demands while increasing her profit.

Beatrice is 48 years old and has four children. She says thank you and promise to pay back her loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Rokia

texts.fr:
Rokia Traoré est âgée de 24 ans, célibataire et mère d’un enfant.  Elle  vit chez son père dans une famille traditionnelle au  quartier Pelengana Nord de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant abandonné  l’école en classe de 9ème  année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien) par suite de redoublements de classes, ainsi elle s’intéressa au commerce de condiments alimentaires  qu’elle mène au marché château de la ville de Ségou  depuis maintenant 3 ans. 
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour faire face à la demande clientèle, elle  fait recours à   Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est à son 1er  prêt individuel  et compte l’utiliser   pour acheter 300kg d’oignons et divers autres colis de condiments. Elle s’approvisionne dans la zone office du Niger (Dougabougou, Séribala etc.). Madame Rokia Traoré vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée généralement  de femmes. 
Elle envisage de  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 60 000 FCFA, ce dernier lui permet de subvenir à ses propres besoins du fait qu’elle est célibataire et mère d’un enfant et d’aider son père dans la prise en charge de certaines dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Rokia Traoré, 24, is single and the mother of one child. She lives in her father's traditional household in the Pelengana Nord area of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having left school in the early grades of primary school (Malian education system) because she had had to repeat several grades, she became interested in selling condiments, which she has been doing in the Château market of the town of Ségou for three years now. Wishing to increase her working capital to satisfy her clientele, she came to Soro Yiriwaso. She is on her first individual loan and intends to use the money to buy 300 kg of onions and various other packets of condiments. She buys her inventory in the Office du Niger zone (Dougabougou, Séribala etc.) Madame Rokia Traoré sells for cash or credit to a clientele mostly made up of women. She hopes to make a monthly profit of 60,000 F CFA which will allow her to support herself since she is single and the mother of a child and to help her father cover certain family expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy onions and other condiments

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela A. is from the village of Lower Dicayas. She is 51 years old. Carmela is married and has 3 children; two of them are adult-age and the remaining one is school age. To make a living, Carmela owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Carmela has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Carmela joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Carmela is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Carmela from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital for her store

loans.name: Gulmirza

texts.en: Gulmirza A. is a 47-year-old man who sells cattle in the small village of Saatli. He started his business when he was 20, thanks to the experience that his father provided for him. Gulmirza is married and has three children. He applied for an 800 Azerbaijani manat (AZN) loan to purchase one cow and fodder.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and fodder

loans.name: Baigalmaa

texts.en:
Baigalmaa V. is 49 years old and lives with her husband and 21-year-old daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in an apartment which the family was able to buy owing to their business profits. Her husband currently works for a company as a driver.

Baigalmaa operates a hair salon in the rented basement of an apartment in Ulaanbaatar where she employs three hairdressers and a massager. She started the hair salon in 2006 and her business has progressed in a short time with many clients. She has been working as a hairdresser for more than 16 years. She works very hard and is a clever woman. For the future, Baigalmaa hopes to change her workplace. She is requesting a 4,000,000 MNT loan to purchase vacuum windows and some kitchen furniture for her apartment.

loans.use: To purchase vacuum windows and furniture

loans.name: Sakhlar

texts.en: Sakhlar B. is a 53-year-old pension trader who has 10 years' experience in food sales. He is married and has four children. He started his business because he lost his job and wasn’t able to cover the basic needs of his dearest children. Sakhlar's monthly income is about 400 AZN. He is an experienced businessman and he wishes to open a new shop. To achieve his dream, he needs more money and for this purpose he has applied for a loan of 900 AZN. He needs this loan to purchase more merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Basooka Kwavula Group

texts.en: N. Jesica is 45 years old, happily married and the mother of 10 children, 7 of whom attend school. For the last 10 years she and her family have subsisted on profits from her pharmacy in Wakitaila-Jinja. She took over the shop from her parents. Prior to that she was operating a retail enterprise. The reason behind her longevity, she says, boils down to her resilience and a focused line of thought. She makes a profit from her other business -- animal husbandry. In a week her profits add up to 200,000 shillings and with this loan, she wants to buy more consignments of drugs for her pharmacy and also use part of the proceeds to pay her workers.

loans.use: to purchase new consignments of drugs for her pharmacy

loans.name: Rosa Alicia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER - CUSCO”; La socia vive en el distrito D. Huanchac en la provincia  y  departamento D. Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Rosa; ella tiene 60 años D. edad y es natural D. Abancay, la socia tiene 4 hijos, ella se dedica a trabajar D. forma independiente desD. su hogar, La socia modificó un espacio que da a la calle en sus casa y lo convirtió en un acogedor cafetín, ella apoya aún a sus hijos con los nietos pero a su vez desea seguir en actividad para no aburrirse en casa metida, ella es un mujer con una fuerza sumamente increíble, la socia prepara unos deliciosos postres y junto a ellos acompaña con chocolates, cafés, leches frescas y trotas. La socia solicita el préstamo para mejorar su cafetín y comprar insumos para su negocio.

La socia valora y agradece el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad D. vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “NUEVO AMANECER – CUSCO” (New Dawn – Cusco) communal bank. She lives in the Huanchac district in Cusco province and department. Rosa is 60 years old and is originally from Abancay. She has 4 children. She works independently from her home, where she modified a space in her home that opens to the street and she converted it to a small café. She still supports her children with her grandchildren but at the same time wishes to continue with her café so as not to become bored at home. She is a woman of incredible strength. She prepares delicious desserts and also chocolates, coffees, fresh beverages and snacks. Rosa seeks a loan to improve her café and buy supplies for her business. She is infinitely grateful for the loan as it enables her to grow her business and improve her quality of life. She promises to make her payments in the stipulated timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve her café and buy supplies for her business

loans.name: Hope To God Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are the members of the “Hope To God” group from Waterloo, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch.

The members are petty-business women who have come to SMT, also a Kiva partner, in order to seek a loan of SLL 1,800,000 for the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve their living conditions.

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Kadiatu C. who was born in a place called Magbele about forty years ago. She is married to a farmer and has six children of whom one is in secondary school and the rest are no longer attending school.

For seven years now, Kadiatu has been selling fertilizers, ginger, pepper and rice. With her SLL 1,000,000 share of this loan, she will expand her business by buying more fertilizers, ginger, pepper and rice to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers, ginger, pepper and rice to add to her current stock

loans.name: Arayik

texts.en:
Arayik S. was born in 1973. He lives with his mother in Vanashen village, in the Ararat area. He has secondary school education and now works at a gas-filling station in Ararat city.

At the same time, Arayik and his mother engage in animal husbandry. On their farm they have calves, sheep, pigs and chickens. Thanks to the income from farming Arayik supports his family and develops his farm. He seeks a $3,000 loan to buy eight or ten calves and fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: To buy eight or ten calves and fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: Emerla

texts.en:
Emerla M. is from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 51 and married and with six adult children. To make a living, Emerla runs a sari-sari (variety) shop selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Emerla has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Emerla joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the first loan taken out by Emerla from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & as working capital

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy.
Juana es casada, tiene 8 hijos de los cuales 5 estudian, Juana tiene una tienda en su pueblo de Atacocha, Distrito de Santiago de Pischa, en donde vende verduras, abarrotes en general, carnes, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo, Juana además compra tara, cochinilla y cereales.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles para la compra de gaseosas, cervezas y golosinas.
Los sueños de Juana son construir su casa de material noble en la ciudad de Ayacucho y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Tarpuy Communal Bank. She is married and has eight children, of whom five are in school. Juana has a store located in the town of Atacocha in the District of Santiago de Pischa where she sells vegetables, groceries, and meat. She manages her business with the help of her husband. In addition, Juana sells tara (a plant used in making dye), cochineal (an insect that produces red dye), and grain.

Juana needs a loan of 2000 PEN in order to buy sodas, beer, and candy. She dreams of building a house of solid materials in the city of Ayacucho and seeing her children become professionals.

loans.use: Purchase sodas, beer, and candy

loans.name: Mariela Colombia

texts.es:
Mariela Colombia  A. G. tiene 31 anos. Es casada vive con el compañero y un hijo, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijo. 
 
 Mariela es una socia de la ventanilla rural La Esperanza, que está ubicada a 25 kilometres del Cantón de Ventanas. Es una comunidad que se dedica al comercio en mayoría este grupo se reúne cada mes en el sector del barrio San Vicente.

Mariela  trabaja en el comercio de venta de ropa, zapatos y perfumes, realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para ampliar su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es ponerse un  local, tener casa propia y poner un local en Salinas.
Le gusta bailar.
texts.en:
Mariela Colombia  A. G. is 31 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and one of her sons.  They live in the Ventanas region of the Los Ríos province.   They have two children.

Mariela is a member of the rural district La Esperanza which is located 25 kilometers from Ventanas.  It is a community where most people are involved in business.  This group meets every month in the San Vicente sector.

Mariela works selling clothing, shoes and perfumes.  She makes her purchases in Guayaquil and sells the goods out of her home.

She is soliciting a loan in order to buy merchandise to expand her business.  The loan will also give her the financial boost to supply her basic necessities.  Her dream is to own a small store in Salinas and have her own home.  

She loves to dance.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to expand her business.

loans.name: Ambai Salau

texts.en:
Ambai Salau, aged 30, is a livestock trader. He is married to Mariah, 32, who is a farmer, and together they have two daughters aged 14 and 2. He lives at Enkaroni village in Kajiado, and sells his livestock at Dagorreti and Kitengela markets within Nairobi. He also sells his livestock to the Kenya Meat Commission for better profits.

Ambai has been running his livestock trading business for 2 years and his monthly profit is Kshs 28,000. He was introduced to KADET by the loan officer in charge of Kitengela office, which is near his Kajiado residence. His area of residence has a very busy market, so Ambai’s livestock are bought at good prices, and he uses the profits to take care of his family and educate his older daughter.

After getting this loan, Ambai intends to use Kshs 20,000 to buy cows, Kshs 10,000 to buy goats, and  Kshs 10,000 to buy sheep for trading, and if the loan boosts the business he intends to buy a piece of land and build his own business premises where he can keep his livestock safely.

Ambai is young, ambitious and hardworking and dreams of becoming a big supplier of livestock to Kenya Meat Commission.

loans.use: To buy cows, goats and sheep.

loans.name: Justina Ekua Bosuaa

texts.en: Justina Ekua Bosuaa B. is a hairdresser at Elmina. She also sells gari, sugar and groundnuts that have been bagged in smaller quantities. Justina has no educational background. She is asking to use the loan to expand her business. She hopes to reinvest the new profit back into her business.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: leather, soles

loans.name: Emmanuel S.

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Emmanuel S. K.. He is single and has one child, age five. He has four additional dependents who live with him because they assist with his business and he helps to educate them. 

In 2003, Emmanuel established his assorted drinks business because he wanted to support himself and his family. Working seven days a week and fourteen hours a day, he earns about $163 every month. He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL in order to expand his business and allow him to maximize his profit. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 375,000 SLL. 

In the future, Emmanuel plans to educate his child and other dependents to the university level and build a larger shop. He is serious and determined and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to add more assorted drinks to his kiosk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Spare parts for his mill

loans.name: Dolivet

texts.es: Dolivet, de 38 años, vive con su esposo Pedro y sus dos pequeños hijos en su casa que es propia.Durante el día trabaja en casa de su vecina cuidando niños,  y por la tarde se dedica a la venta de salchipollos que son platillos preparados al instante (compuestos de papas y trozos de pollos fritos), también comercializa  gaseosas para acompañar las comidas y obtiene buenas ganancias, ya que trabaja hasta altas horas de la noche. Mientras  Dolivet  cuida a los niños durante el día  su hermana la apoya en el negocio de venta de comida, pues el negocio esta ubicado en la puerta del domicilio de su madre, y es un espacio muy apropiado para este fin, donde  circula cantidad de  personas. Es así que por las tardes atiende en la venta de comidas hasta las doce de la noche, durante  todos los días y para mejorar su negocio esta  pensando en instalar una juguería, para captar mayores ganancias.Es el 18avo préstamo que tiene con MFP, por lo que se ha comprometido nuevamente en ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, pues considera que este  crédito le será muy útil para el progreso de su negocio.Dolivet tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de cantidad de  maderas  y calaminas para cercar su negocio y cambiar el toldo que cubre la puerta, de esta manera espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus comensales.
texts.en:
Dolivet, 38 years old, lives with her husband, Pedro, and her two young children in her own home.  During the day, she works in her neighbor's house taking care of their children,a dn in the afternoon, she works selling "salchipollos," which are pre-prepared instant meals made of potatoes and pieces of fried chicken.  She also sells soft drinks to go with the food, and as she often works in the shop until midnight, she manages to earn a decent wage from this work. While Dolivet takes care of the children during the day, her sister helps her with her business, as it is located in the doorway of their mother's home.  It is a perfect space for this type of establishment, where many people can mingle together. 

In order to improve her business, Dolivet is thinking of installing a juicer to gain more profit.  This is her 18th loan with MFP, for which she is agan committed to being punctual with her repayment schedule.  She believes that this loan will be very useful in the progress of her business. Dolivet has plans to invest the capital requested in the purchase of different types of wood and roofing materials to enclose the business property; she also wishes to change the awning that covers the door, and in this way, she hopes to offer better service to her customers.

loans.use: Purchase of materials to improve small business facilities

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
El señor Hernan V. S. tiene 28 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos pequeños 2 gemelos muy pequeños y una hija que esta estudiando en la escuela de su zona. El señor Hernan y su familia  vive en la zona de la Vilomilla ubicado en la localidad de Sipe-Sipe a 22 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, zona muy agrícola.
 
El sr. Hernan se dedica a la construcción, de viviendas por la zona, y su esposa se encarga del cuidado del ganado vacuno con el que cuentan, ambas actividades le generan ingresos que les han ayuda a sustentarse hasta el momento. Solo cuentan con 3 cabezas de ganado vacuno de donde apenas producen 15 litros de leche diarios y estos los comercializan en la zona, la esposa de Hernan no puede hacer muchas actividades pues sus bebes gemelos aun tienen un par de meses y no debe dejarlos solos.

El Sr. Hernan tiene mucha demanda de clientes en la construcción y refacción de viviendas, pero no cuenta con todos los equipos para poder realizar un trabajo mas efectivo, el se alquila una maquina mezcladora, y esto le ha generado mucho costo, y no ha podido ahorrar mucho, por este motivo, se visto en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para poder obtener una maquina mezcladora y con el tiempo  poder ahorrar para gastos familiares.
El sr. Hernan desea dar un futuro mejor a sus hijos y con el tiempo mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda para que su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Hernan V. S. is 28 years old and has three small children (two very young twins and a daughter who attends the local school). Mr. Hernan and his family live in the Vilomilla zone in the locality of Sipe-Sipe, which is 22 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba. It is a very agricultural area.
 
Mr. Hernan works building houses and his wife is in charge of their dairy cows. Both activities generate income that has helped them to sustain their family up to this point. They only have three dairy cows, which produce 15 liters of milk each day. They sell the milk in their local area. Hernan's wife can't do a lot because their twins are only a couple months old so she shouldn't leave them alone.

Mr. Hernan has a lot of demand from his customers for house construction and renovation, but he does not have all the equipment necessary to work most effectively. He rents a mixing machine, which has been very costly, and therefore he hasn't been able to save much. He realized it is necessary to request a loan so he can obtain his own mixing machine. This way, he will able to be save money for his family over time. Mr. Hernan hopes to offer his children a better future and, with time, to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction equipment (a mixing machine)

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is a married woman who lives in Bago City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: Sari-sari (general)store, rice retailer and sugar cane businesses. Her husband Ramonito, who is 57 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are 27 to 32 years old. Natividad joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Natividad has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 6000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8000, improving the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 18th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 8000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock for her Sari-sari Store so that she can continue to save up for future house repairs and improve her family's living conditions. Natividad is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase additional stock for her general store

loans.name: Silvestre

texts.en:
Silvestre A. is from the village of San Miguel, Gingoog City. He is 31 years old. Silvestre is separated from his spouse and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Silvestre owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing "motorela" or "habal-habal" (motorcycle taxi) services to local community members. Silvestre has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Silvestre joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Silvestre has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. Silvestre is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Silvestre from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service

location.town: San Miguel, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Hagar

texts.en: Hagar M. makes a living selling fish and a type of locally-made soap in the town of Korfofordo, which is located near the larger town of Jukwa. She was educated through junior high school and is the mother of one child. Her husband makes a living repairing refrigerators. Hagar devotes her income to paying for the education of her child. Demand for the soap is increasing, and that is why she is applying for a loan to buy more of the ingredients she needs to make soap. She would also like to begin selling other types of soap to her customers.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients she needs to make more soap.

loans.name: Faissatou

texts.en:
Faissatou is 43 years old and lives in the Sémé-Podji district with her husband Deen and their two children. Both of their children are schooled.
For the past 8 years Faissatou has sold condiments and spices from her stall in the Abattoir district of Cotonou. This is her third loan with ALIDE following successful past repayments, and will allow her to purchase stock in bulk from Tokpa, Benin's largest market. Her aim is to increase her credit limit through successful repayments.

loans.use: to purchase spices and condiments in bulk

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en:
This is Saidu C., age 45. Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this small-scale entrepreneur, who has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 3,000,000.00 in order to invest in his businesses. 

Saidu C. sells used clothes such as shirts, trousers, and skirts. He has been engaged in his business for the past 24 years in the township of Kabala, located in northern Sierra Leone. He and his wife have two children. He was born in Kambia town but now lives and works in Kabala. 

Saidu has requested this loan in order to buy bales of used clothes to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes to add to his business

loans.name: Phong

texts.en:
Phong S., 40, is married and resides in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known for the most populated city in the country. 

Phong S. sells coffee and rents parts of her house to workers at the factory, earning an income of about US $5 per day. Her husband is a civil servant, earning an income of US $5 per day. Each month, the family has to spend US $112 on food and US $45 on the other necessary expenses. 

Phong S. is requesting a loan of US $1,000 to purchase construction materials to build more rooms for rent. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build more rooms for rent.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey R. (pictured with her loom) and her husband, Mr. Meun Mak, live across the Mekong River, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have one son and two daughters. All of them are in school. 

Srey has been a silk weaver for more thirty years, while her husband has been a construction worker for more than two years. She hopes to continue her weaving business, so she is asking for another loan of $800 to purchase silk materials. She will use a part of the loan to buy a cow to raise.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for her weaving business and buy a cow to raise.

loans.name: Teodelinda

texts.es:
Teodelinda D. 55 años D. edad, vive en casa propia con su esposo, hija y nieta, que cuenta con todos los servicios, está ubicada en la parte urbana del distrito D. Chepén, el cual se encuentra a dos horas del departamento D. la Libertad y a una hora D. Chiclayo.  Este distrito se caracteriza por ser una zona agrícola y turismo

Teodelinda se dedica  a la venta D. verduras en un puesto en el mercado del distrito donD. vive, lo realiza  por las calles del distrito en donD. vive. Los productos que ofrece estan en muy buen estado (maduros y limpios) por eso las personas D. esta zona le compran por la confianza  que brinda sus productos y es una manera D. cubrir sus  necesidades diarias. 

El préstamo que solicitó a Edpyme Alternativa fue D. 1000 nuevos soles, el cual lo va utilizar  para comprar más verduras y otros alimentos para que ofertarlos  a sus clientes y así pueda tener más ingresos  y poder solventar sus gastos y necesidades D. su casa.  Teodelinda es una mujer responsable y trabajadora que lo que más desea es poder tener un negocio granD. donD. pueda ofrecer todo tipo D. productos para satisfacer las necesidades D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
Teodelinda, 55, lives in her own home with her husband, daughter and granddaughter. Their house, which has all of the basic services, is located in the urban part of the district of Chepén, which is two hours from the department of La Libertad and one hour from Chiclayo. This district is known for agriculture and tourism.

Teodelinda sells vegetables at a stall in the district market, and also in the streets of the district where she lives. The products that she offers are in good condition (ripe and clean) and that's why people in this zone buy from her - the trust that they have in her products. In this way she covers her daily needs.

The loan that she requested from Edpyme Alternativa was for 1000 nuevo soles, which she is going to use to buy more vegetables and other food to offer her customers and thereby have more income and cover the costs and needs of her home. Teodelinda is a responsible and hardworking woman who wants to be able to have a big business where she can offer all kinds of products to satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy larger quantities of vegetables and other products to stock her store.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.en: Evangelina is 40 years old, married and has two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who earns a living by running a weaving business in the Philippines. She is applying for a loan for PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy new materials to use in her work. Evangelina has been in this line of work for three years and would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Kisakye Development Group

texts.en: 33-year-old Cissy has been in a retail business the last seven years in Lugazi. The mother of two says she began this business with her own savings. Farming was her first business. At her shop, she sells a variety of general merchandise retail items such as sugar, salt, cooking oil, soap, etc. Cissy says being determined, focused and diligent have been her calling cards. Weekly this retail business generates her about $82 as sales revenue.  Cissy says she is to use this loan to purchase more retail commodities such as sugar, salt, soap, plastics, maize flour, etc. to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities like sugar, salt, plastics, maize flour, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Narciso De Jesús

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Masaya, reside don  Narciso de Jesús, quien labora para la institución de Enacal desde hace seis años, como Fontanero, es casado con tres hijos menores es por ellos que trabaja  arduamente para darle las condiciones necesarias.
Unas de las necesidades que está atravesando la familia de don Narciso es la condición del techo de su vivienda ya que estamos en temporada de invierno y el techo de su casas ya no le sirve, es por eso que  se acerco a las oficina de Ceprodel  para solicitarnos un crédito para poder realizar compras como Zinc y perlin  y así por medio de este mejoramiento le dará mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y su esposa.
texts.en:
Narciso de Jesús lives in the city of Masaya.  He has worked as a plumber for Enacal for six years.  He is married and has three dependent children for whom he works hard in order to provide them with what they need.

One of the needs that Narciso's family currently has is the need to improve the condition of the roof of their house since we are in the winter season now and their roof is no good.  For this reason, he approached Ceprodel's offices to request a loan so that he could buy sheets or corrugated metal and beams in order to make this improvement which will improve his wife and children's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sheets of corrugated metal and beams

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase lotions, lipstick, eyeliner, moisturizer, foundation, deodorants, artificial nails, and hair dyes.

loans.name: Ada

texts.en:
Ada, a 48-year-old married mother of six children, three of whom are in school, works very hard to provide for her family. Ada has run a sari-sari store in the Philippines for eight years, selling a variety of items such as sugar, milk, canned goods, spices, etc. She is requesting a PHP 26000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

In the future, Ada would like to save enough to money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large number of perfumes.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es: Dionisia e socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik, ella vende desayunos en una carreta y su esposo vende también desayunos en otro punto, ella esta en Finca hace 10 años y empezó con una carreta simple, ahora el préstamo que tendrá  será para poder invertir en su negocio, ella se siente muy bien en Finca, gracias al apoyo que le han dado Dionisia pudo mejorar su calidad de vida, con mucho esfuerzo se compró un carro y su terreno. Lo que mas le gusta son las capacitaciones aprendió como ahorrar, la puntualidad y como invertir  en su negocio.
texts.en:
Dionisia is a member of the Llapanchik community bank. She sells breakfasts from a cart and her husband also sells breakfasts from another spot. Dionisia has been with Finca for ten years. She began her business with a simple cart and now her loan will be used to re-invest in her business. 

Dionisia is very happy with Finca. Thanks to their support she has been able to improve her quality of life, and after a lot of effort she has managed to buy herself a car and some land. What Dionisia likes best about Finca are their training workshops which have taught her how to save, the importance of punctuality and how to invest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase products for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy oil, corn, condiments, chicken, pork rinds, cheese and beverages.

loans.name: Blanca Liliana

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene un hijo de 14 años, vive con su familia en San Gabriel que se encuentra en el Carchi al norte de Ecuador. Se describe como una madre que quiere lo mejor para su hijo, brindarle todo su apoyo y asegurar el futuro de su familia.

Blanca trabaja sola en la crianza de animales (chanchos). Trabaja con Fodemi por un tiempo de 5 años, el crédito que solicita actualmente es para mejorar los corrales, comprar alimentación para sus animales y para la compra de 2 crías de chancho lo cual mejoraría el crecimiento de sus animales, aumentaría sus ventas y sus ingresos.

Su sueño es incrementar el número de animales y entrar al negocio de comidas rápidas.
texts.en:
Blanca is thirty-years-old, married, and has a fourteen-year-old son. She lives with her family in San Gabriel which is in Carchi in the north of Ecuador. She describes herself as a mother who wants the best for her son, to give him all her support, and assure the future of her family.

Blanca works by herself raising animals (pigs). She has been with Fodemi for five years. The loan she is seeking is to improve the pens, buy feed for her animals, and to buy two more litters of pigs. The animals would grow better and she would increase her sales and income.

Blanca's dream is to have more animals and get into the fast food business.

loans.use: grow the infrastructure of her pens, buy feed for the animals, and get two more litters of pigs.

loans.name: Takku Ligguey 6 Group

texts.fr: Ce groupement a pour activité principale le commerce dans une localité située a quelque kilomètre d'une ville proche de la capitale du Sénégal. Ndeye qui est La présidente a pour activité principale le commerce. Elle a hérité ce métier de ses parents parce qu'elle les accompagnait dans leur lieu de commerce. Elle s'active dans le commerce depuis plus de 30 ans. Ce crédit est destiné a l'achat de marchandises comme des habits prêt à porté et des fruits (mangues, mandarines, bananes, pommes) qu'elle va revendre au marché. Et lui permettra d'augmenter son  fonds de roulement en renforçant son stock de marchandises. Ce crédit lui permet d’être autonome financièrement. Avec ce prêt elle compte faire évoluer son commerce dans la région.
texts.en:
This group's main business activity is trading in an area located a few kilometers from a city near the capital of Senegal. The president inherited this profession from her parents because she would go with them to their selling place. She has been a trader for the past 30 years. This loan will be used to buy merchandise such as ready-made clothes and fruits (mangoes, mandarins, bananas, apples), which she will resell in the market.  

This loan will allow her to increase her working capital. This loan will allow her to be financially independent. With this loan, she intends to develop her trade in the region.

loans.use: to purchase stock for resale, such as fruit and ready-made clothes

loans.name: Elda

texts.en: Elda is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. Elda has a shop that sells bananas and coconuts for copras. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy bananas and coconuts. Elda has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Elda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and coconuts for copras

loans.name: Darwin

texts.en:
Darwin is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Darwin has a pigpen and sells mature & grown pigs. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Darwin is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: buy feed for his pigs

loans.name: Mulembe Group

texts.en:
Margret takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to ensure food security for her family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Margret had an excellent maize yield harvesting 17 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Margret was only able to harvest 7 bags of maize on 1 acre of land. With income from maize sales, Margret will educate her children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

Margret is the facilitator of the Mulembe group. She and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Mulembe group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Margret and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Weyomisha Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Weyomisha SHG Group in Western Kenya! Christine is the facilitator of the Weyomisha SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Christine takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and One Acre Fund has the best prices. In the recent 2011 season, Christine had a very good maize yield, harvesting 16 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Christine was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Christine and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Christine will educate her children and build a house.

In 2012, the members of Weyomisha SHG group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ángel

texts.es: Ángel, de 58 años, es una hombre bueno y amable, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene cinco hijos de los cuales cuatro ya son mayores e independientes, solo el último tiene 20 años y vive con él. Además de su hijo comparte su vida con su pareja y su nieto a quienes a diario brinda lo mejor en su casa que pudo obtener con mucho esfuerzo. El trabajo de Ángel consiste en la construcción de viviendas, pero su especialidad es el de construir galpones de pollos, corrales de cerdos y granjas, además de la construcción, también se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral, esta actividad lo realiza a lado de su esposa. Mientras que el de la construcción lo hace a lado de algunos obreros que contrata, lleva trabajando con este negocio por 14 años y espera poder seguir haciéndolo por mas tiempo. Le gusta mucho trabajar en esta actividad ya que gana bien, le permite tener tiempo para algunas otras actividades y le da la estabilidad que necesita para tener una vida tranquila, invierte en personal y algunos materiales y gana un promedio de 35% de su inversión, tiene como objetivos el de ampliar sus galpones y así criar sus aves en mayor cantidad. Este será el crédito número 7 con MFP, por tanto está muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su negocio, además está muy comprometido en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará pollitos para iniciar con la crianza, además de mejorar sus galpones y comprar alimentos balanceados, además de esto también comprará materiales y herramientas para poder segur haciendo su trabajo.
texts.en:
Ángel is 58 years old and a good, friendly man. He lives with his common-law wife, with whom he has five children. Four of their children are grown and independent. Only the youngest, who is 20 years old, lives with Ángel. Besides his son, Ángel shares his life with his wife and grandson, who he tries very hard to give the best he can.

Ángel's job is home construction, but his specialty is building chicken coops, pig pens and other farm enclosures. Besides construction, he also raises poultry, an activity he does alongside his wife. When he is doing construction, he works alongside some workers that he contracts. He has been running his business for 14 years and hopes to be able to continue doing it for a long time more. He enjoys his work a great deal because it earns good money,  allows him to have time for other activities, and gives him the stability he needs to have a tranquil life. He invests in personnel and some materials, and earns an average 35% on his investment.

His goal is to expand his coops and to raise more birds. This will be his seventh credit with MFP and he is very happy to know that he will have this financial support, as it makes him feel confident that he will be able to advance his business. He is also very committed to repaying his loan, as he has done with the prior loans he took out. With the amount requested, 2,500 nuevos soles, he will buy chicks to start raising, will improve his coops, and will purchase a balanced diet for his birds. He will also buy materials and tools to be able to continue his construction business.

loans.use: to buy chicks, materials to improve his chicken coop, and tools for his construction business

loans.name: Gulzara

texts.ru: Гульзаре  24 года, вдова. Потеряв мужа в прошлом году во время трагических событий на юге страны, Гульзара одна воспитывает двух детей – двух и трех лет от роду. В поисках источника финансирования для своей семьи, в настоящее время Гульзара , при поддержке своего отца, начинает свой бизнес в разведении скота. Использовав стартовую сумму в 30,000 сом (KGS), Гульзара смогла получить прибыль в этом месяце  в сумме 2,000 сом (KGS) от продажи молока.  Также, Гульзара занимается выпечкой кондитерских изделий, таких как булочки, печенье у себя дома, что также служит небольшим доходом  в бюджет ее семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульзара обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме  100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку баранов и дойной коровы. В будущем, Гульзара планирует развить свое хозяйство, чтобы иметь возможность обучить своих детей.
texts.en:
Gulzara is 24, and a widow. After losing her husband during the tragic events in the southern part of the country last year, Gulzara has been raising two children — two and three years old, respectively — by herself. Seeking a way to provide for her family, Gulzara, with the support of her father, is starting her own business raising livestock. Utilizing a starting capital of 30,000 som (KGS), Gulzara has managed to earn a profit of 2,000 som (KGS) this month from selling milk. In addition, Gulzara is selling baked goods, such as pastries and cookies, that she makes at home. This also adds a little income to the family budget. 

Hoping to further grow her business, Gulzara has asked Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep and dairy cows. In the future, Gulzara plans to expand her business so that she is able to get her children an education.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Azra Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Azra bibi is 36 years old. She is a married woman who lives with her family -- a husband and six children who are 17, 15, 14, 12, 10 and 6 years old. 

Azra is very ambitious lady; she owns and operates a bangles sales business. She has contacts in different jewelry shops of the market. She also sells her bangles to her community clients and generates a good profit on it. Her collection of colorful bangles attracts many customers to her. Bangles are an ornament which every woman likes and loves to wear. 

Her husband is professionally a milkman. He has a buffalo at his home from which he gets milk to sell to different milk shops. He is also a very hardworking person.  

Azra has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her own business. With this loan, she will purchase more variety of bangles like steel, beaded and glittered bangles for selling. She is very hopeful that the added variety to her collection will help increase her sales and generate better profits. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Azra bibi.

loans.use: To buy bangles for reselling.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a married man. He has a son who is 12 years old. He describes himself as generous. He operates a business providing motorcycle transportation. He has been involved in this business for one year. His business is located within a busy market. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of fuel. He will use the 15,000 KES loan to add to his savings and buy another motorbike. Robert's business goal is to own four more motorbikes within five years.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a married woman with three children. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Annah operates a food-making business of beans and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbors. She wants to use the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking  oil, sugar, and beans.

loans.name: Sena Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SENA est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans le même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Léa (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 41 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Léa est mariée à un certain Barthélemy. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certain scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Léa vit ensemble avec son conjoint et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Léa vend des friperies depuis six ans. Léa s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Léa  ensemble avec les membres du groupe de SENA sollicite pour la deuxième fois un crédit auprès de  ALIDé. Le crédit précédent a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des friperies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the stock.

loans.name: Kanlé

texts.en:
Kanlé T. was born in Aného in 1972. She is married and the mother of four. Making caramel sauce, locally called «LIHA», is now her main work. A very devoted woman, she is now the head of household. From her business, she derives an income that provides for her family, who depends on her entirely. She gets up very early in the morning to make a fire, toasts the sugar, and produces the sauce that she sells a lot of, especially when the weather is hot. And this has earned her the nickname of «AFRICA MALTA». The orders for her caramel sauce now surpass what she can offer, and she does not have the financial resources needed to meet the demand.

Ms. T. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy sacks of sugar and a freezer for making ice cubes. The loan will thus help to increase her production capacity. The income gained will allow her to improve the living conditions of her family and to acquire a degree of financial independence.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née à Aného en 1972, Madame T. Kanlé est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. La production du jus de caramel communément appelé « LIHA », reste son activité principale. De cette activité, sort un bénéfice avec lequel Madame T. Kanlé subvient aux besoins de sa famille qui est à sa seule charge. Très dévouée, elle reste le chef de la famille. Elle se réveille très tôt pour faire le feu, griller le sucre et produit son jus qu’elle vend bien surtout en période de chaleur. Cela lui donna le surnom de « AFRICA MALTA ». Les demandes dépassent désormais l’offre et elle n’est pas en mesure de les couvrir faute de moyens.

Elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour acheter des sacs de sucre, un congélateur pour faire du glaçon et augmenter sa capacité de production. Les revenus une fois accrus, permettront à Madame T. Kanlé d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et d’acquérir une autonomie financière.

loans.use: To buy sugar and a freezer for making ice cubes

loans.name: Edison

texts.en:
Edison has 8 years of experience in his cabinetry workshop. He learned his trade working for another person. Later, his father recognized his personal qualities and helped him buy his own tools. Still later, he began to manufacture his own products, with which he has done very well. He currently has other cabinet-makers working for him. His work begins at 8 am and continues till 6 pm. He works every day except Sunday.

Edison is applying for the loan so that he can invest in the chemicals he uses in his business, such as lacquer, paint, diluent, and glue. With another part of the loan, he will invest in wood with which to make his products. His products are in high demand right now.

Edison is 34 years old and married. He has 2 children, both in school. With the fruits of his labor, he has been able to buy a site to house his workshop and is building his house of cement. His wife helps in any way she can in the business, also. He wishes to increase his capital so that he can produce more products and, as a result, increase his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Edison tiene una experiencia de 8 años en su taller de ebanisteria. Oficio que lo aprendió trabajando para otra persona. Luego de esto su padre vio en el sus cualidades y lo ayuda para que se compre sus propias maquinas. Luego de esto comienza a elaborar sus propios productos con los que le ha ido muy bien. Al momento cuenta con personas a su cargo dándoles trabajo. Su labor comienza a las 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. Trabaja todos los días de la semana excepto los días domingos.

Edison desea el crédito para poder invertir en químicos para su negocio como lo es laca, pintura, diluyente, pegamento y otra parte invertir algo en madera para seguir elaborando sus productos. Al momento tiene una buena demanda de su negocio.

Edison tiene 34 años, es casado. Tiene 2 hijos los que estudian. Fruto de su trabajo ha logrado comprar un solar en donde tiene su taller y esta construyendo su casita de cemento. Su esposa también le ayuda en lo que puede con el negocio. Su deseo es incrementar su capital de trabajo para producir mas productos y por ende obtener mayor ganancia.

loans.use: Invest in chemicals for the manufacture of his products

loans.name: Ros

texts.en: Mrs. Ros S. N. is 30 years old, and the mother of 1 child. She lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is self-employed as a garment worker and makes around $1.5 each day, while her husband is both a motor-taxi driver and a farmer, and usually makes around $5/day in revenue. In order to maximize her rice crops and the  variety of vegetables, this couple currently needs a plot of land, allowing them to strengthen cultivation and increase profit.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land to grow rice crop and a variety of vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock of cereal

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok S., age 56, works with her husband in their rice paddy growing rice and vegetables, earning around $3 per day in income together. They have eight children, two who are employed in an undisclosed job, two who are married, three who are students, and one who would like to be a hairdresser.

Mrs. Sok S. would like to request a loan of $1200 in order to purchase the supplies needed to open a hair salon. This would allow her daughter to be self-sufficient and also bring additional income into the family to support her siblings’ education. Mrs. Sok S. is pictured with her daughter in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and equiptment needed to open a hair salon

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Here in their small bicycle repair shop, in a district far outside of Puno, we find Mrs. Esther C. C. and her entrepreneurial husband, Santos. This hardworking couple has dedicated themselves to this noble service for more than six years. Thanks to the good service that they provide their shop is gaining a regular clientele. In addition to the repair shop the family raises cattle and alpacas which provide important revenues through the marketing of calves.

The desire of Esther and her self sacrificing husband is to expand their repair shop and to sell spare parts for motorcycles and cars. In order to make their plans more concrete they are requesting a loan. This money they will use to provide for the security and well-being of their three young children who are the couples motivation to work and struggle forward each day.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

En uno de los distritos más lejanos de la ciudad de Puno, encontramos a Doña Esther y su emprendedor esposo, Santos, en su pequeño taller de reparación de bicicletas. Esta laboriosa pareja desempeña esta noble labor desde hace siete años, trabajo que gracias al buen servicio que presta está obteniendo asiduos clientes; adicionalmente esta familia se dedica a la crianza de animales (vacas y alpacas), que les otorga ingresos económicos muy importantes al comercializar sus pequeños terneritos. El deseo de Doña Esther y su abnegado esposo es ampliar su taller y vender repuestos de motos y carros. Para concretar sus planes solicitan un préstamo, dinero que les permitirá cumplir con sus objetivos y a través de el obtener mayores beneficios económicos para brindarle seguridad y bienestar a sus tres menores hijos, quienes son la razón por la que se esfuerzan y trabajan a diario.

loans.use: Purchase of spare motorcyle and car parts which will be sold in their small repair shop.

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es:
Mrs. T. used to be an employee of the business called Zona Franca but because her income was so low and the shift so long she decided to invest her cash in purchasing spices such as raisins, plums, cinnamon, and caramel.

She believes the financing from Ceprodel has been important in the development of her business with its unconditional support and through the financing she has been able to buy merchandise at wholesale prices, offering a better price to her customers and actually finding a small locale where she can sell her merchandise.

One of her goals is to better the condition of her locale, change the roof because it is actually made of plastic, and better the quality of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. T. anteriormente era una empleada activa de la empresa Zona Franca pero por lo bajo en sus ingresos y las largas jornadas de trabajo decide invertir su liquidación en la compra de especies tales como: pasas, ciruela, canela, y dulce.

Considera que el aporte financiero de CEPRODEL ha sido fundamental en el desarrollo de su negocio quien la apoya incondicionalmente y que través de los financiamiento le permiten la compra de mercadería al contado, ofrece un mejor precio a sus clientes y actualmente cuenta con un pequeño local en donde ofrece su mercadería.

Una de sus metas es mejorar las condiciones de su local, cambiar el techo ya que actualmente es de plástico y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Two years ago Pedro’s father passed away. Despite the pain of losing his father, Pedro immediately began to sell cosmetics by catalogue. He did this to pay for his studies, which his father had paid before. Little by little and with the help of some female friends, Pedro began to understand this branch of the cosmetics market.

Currently Pedro has various female clients, clients from his university, and his small city. Still, although Pedro has numerous clients requesting products, he currently lacks the inventory to supply to them. For this reason Pedro is requesting a credit of $375. This loan he agrees to repay within 6 months. With the loan he will purchase the requested products for sale to his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Hace dos años que el papá D. Pedro desgraciadamente falleció y a pesar del dolor D. perder a su padre, comenzó a vender cosméticos por catálogo para poder seguir costeando sus estudios. Puesto que su papá era quien le pagaba los estudios. Poco a poco y con la ayuda D. sus amigas, comenzó a conocer esta rama D. los cosméticos.

Actualmente, tiene varias clientas y clientes D. su universidad y D. su colonia. Sin embargo actualmente no cuenta con la mercancía que le están solicitando es por eso que Pedro está pidiendo un crédito D. US $375 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo D. 6 meses y con este dinero Pedro podrá comprar los productos que le están solicitando.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetic items for resale.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana has always been a business woman and very enterprising; since adolescence she worked in clothing sales. Her daughter Cinthia was born 12 years ago while she was engaged. Unfortunately things did not go well in that relationship and after many disappointments she decided to end the relationship. At that time, with a goal of being able to offer the best to her daughter, she decided to open a little grocery store. This shop has turned out to be profitable and very useful for her neighbors as well because thanks to the variety of merchandise she can cater to and please everyone. After 10 years of dedicating herself entirely to her daughter, she decided to give herself a second opportunity and now has two children at her side, which provide her a double motive to continue making efforts in life.
