Susana has in mind expanding her little grocery store and increasing the amount of merchandise and clothing she has available. It is for this reason that she asks for your help and is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Kenney Molloy, Kiva volunteer

Susana, siempre fue una mujer de negocios y muy emprendedora, desde adolescente se dedicó a la comercialización de prendas de vestir; fruto de su primer compromiso nació Cinthia, niña de 12 años de edad, desafortunadamente las cosas en su relación no le resultaron muy bien, después de muchas desilusiones decidió separarse de su pareja, desde entonces con el fin de ofrecerle lo mejor a su hija decidió abrir una tiendita de abarrotes, esta bodeguita le fue resultando rentable y muy útil a sus vecinos porque gracias a la variedad de su mercadería puede complacer y satisfacer a todos.Luego de 10 años de haberse dedicado íntegramente a su hija decidió darse una segunda oportunidad, actualmente ya con 2 retoños a su lado tiene doble motivo para seguir esforzándose en la vida; Susana tiene pensado ampliar su bodeguita de abarrotes y aumentar la cantidad de mercadería de prendas de vestir que oferta también en un espacio de este lugar, con ese propósito solicita tu ayuda y te hace la petición de un préstamo.

loans.use: Increase her working capital to purchase a greater quantity of products.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy O. is 41 years old. She lives in Benin City.  She is married with 6 children. She sells yams. Joy is requesting a loan of $525 to buy more yams for sale. She learned this business from her friend and has been in this business since 1988. She has been with LAPO for the past 5years. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more yams for sale

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.ru:
Ilhom H. lives in the Rudaki region. He is 36 years old, married, and has 3 children. He has specialized education. By training, he is an elementary school teacher. He works in school #19 in the Rudaki region and teaches machine shop class. In addition, he has his own shop where he repairs household electronics. At the moment, Ilhom wants to purchase a welder, which will help him to attract new customers. That is why he is asking for a $450 loan. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Хамиджанов Илхом житель района Рудаки.Возраст 36 лет, женат , имеет 3 детей. Образование средне-профессиональное. По специальности учитель начальных классов.Работает в средней школе №19 района Рудаки, преподает уроки труда .Кроме того имеет свою мастерскую по ремонту бытовой техники . Сейчас Илхом хочет купить сварочный аппарат ,что поможет ему привлечь новых клиентов.Для этого ему необходимо получить кредит в размере 450 $. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев

loans.use: To purchase a welder

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more cereals to sell and double her income.

loans.name: Juan Villalta

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Juan Villalta, I am 46 years old and I am married. My wife and I have lived in this community for 25 years.
When I go out to do occasional jobs, my wife helps me to tend our store. 
We have a solar energy plant to provide electricity to the store, and ours is the only store in the area that carries ice and refrigerated products. 
At this time, I am requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise to keep up with my customers' demands and needs. I have to travel outside our community to purchase merchandise, and it is necessary to buy several-days worth of supplies to stock up the store.

 Translated by Maria B., Kiva volunteer   

hola mi nombre es Juan Villalta, tengo 46 años de edad, estoy casado, no tengo hijos y tenemos 25 años de vivir en nuestra comunidad. tengo la ayuda de mi esposa para la atencion de nuestros clientes cuando a veces yo salgo a realizar otros trabajos, en nuestro negocio tenemos instalado una planta de energia solar la cual nos provee la energia electrica y esto nos ayuda ya que nuestro negocio es el unico que vende hielo y prodructos refrigerados, pero en estos momentos necesito comprar mas mercaderia para cumplir con todas las necesidades de mis clientes, ya que tengo que viajar fuera de mi comunidad para ir a comprar las cosas del negocio y no se puede salir a comprar cada 3 dias, sino que hay que comprar para abastecer el negocio para varios dias.

loans.use: purchase of sauces, sodas, churros, toilet paper, beans, rice, bread, salt, tortillas, corn and wheat flour, candy, batteries, sardines, cookies, coffee, razors, pasta, lard, margarine, cold meats, ice.

loans.name: Lucilo

texts.es:
Mr. Lucilio L. is 26 years old, is single and lives with his parents in their home locabied in the city of Fernando de la Mora.

He has been the driver for his Taxi for 6 years but he first started out as a driver for someone else. In 2005 he purchased his own vehicle and acquired his own permit so that he could work for himself.

Lucilio is requesting a loan for the repair of the key mechanism, body and flooring of his car to improve the state of his Taxi and to provide better comfort to his passengers.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

El sr. Lucilio L. tiene 26 años , es soltero y vive con sus padres en su dimicilio ubicado en la Ciudad de Fernando de la Mora. El mismo es conductor de Taxi desde hace 6 años donde empezó trabajando para otra persona pero en el año 2005 compró un vehículo propio y derecho a la parada donde estaba para poder trabajar en forma independiente. El sr. Lucilio solicita el crédito para la reparación de la chapería, pintura y el tapizado de su automovil para poder tener en mejores codiciones su taxi y ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus pasajeros

loans.use: Repairs to the key mechanism and body of his vehicle (a taxi).

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Antonio Candía Romero está casado con la Sra. Amada Ramona Núñez, tienen 2 hijos (un varón y una nena) los dos adolescentes, el señor Antonio tiene un comedor en el Taller de la Municipalidad ya hace 15 años. Antonio le provee desayuno, almuerzo y merienda a 200 funcionarios municipales que habitualmente trabajan en ese lugar. Sin embargo, necesitan este préstamo para la compra de vacas faenadas que el señor Antonio se va a traer de la ciudad de Caazapá.

Además de la compra de frutas frescas y verduras que lo hacen diariamente, debe pagar al municipio un impuesto por la utilización del predio del comedor. Ellos son felices con este negocio que les permite estar más cerca de sus hijos que trabajan con ellos. Este será su primer préstamo con la Fundación.
texts.en:
Mr. Antonio Candía Romero is married to Mrs. Amada Ramona Núñez. They have two children, a boy and a girl, both adolescents. For 15 years, Mr. Antonio has had a cafeteria in the Municipal Repair Shop. Antonio provides breakfast, lunch, and afternoon snack to the 200 municipal workers who regularly work there. Nevertheless, they need this loan to purchase beef that Mr. Antonio is going to bring from the city of Caazapá.

In addition to the daily purchase of fresh fruits and vegetables, he has to pay a tax to the municipality for the use of the space for the cafeteria. They are happy with this business that allows them to be closer to their children, who work alongside them. This will be their first loan with the Foundation.


Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of meat, rice, sugar, oil, milk, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. sells oil and gari at Duakro near Elmina. Mary has a Junior High level education. She is married and has two children. Mary has been selling oil and gari since 1999. She is responsible for feeding her family and paying the utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more coconut oil and gari. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: To buy coconut oil and gari

loans.name: Muazamo

texts.ru: Тураева Муазамо  жительница района Шахринау.Возраст 20 лет, замужем.Образование среднее.Клиентка занимается куплей продажей овощей.Она торгует на рынке района Шахринау.Иммет опыт в бизнесе более 3 лет. Бизнес является основным источником дохода ее семьи. Так как муж клиентки временно не работает. На полученный кредит Муазамо хочет закупить товар.Планирует погасить кредит в течении  12 месяцев
texts.en:
Muazamo T. lives in the Shahrinau region of Tajikistan. She is 20 years old, has a high school degree and is married. Muasamo makes her living selling vegetables at the regional market. She has three years of experience in this business and it is the main source of income for her family, since her husband is temporarily out of work. Muazamo is planning to use this loan to finance the purchase of a large batch of produce. She is wants to pay back this loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Kaniz Fatima Munir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Kaniz Fatima baji is 36 years old and a wife of M. A. who owns a video game shop. Children come to his shop to play video games. Kaniz baji has six children: three sons and three daughters. Her elder son runs a canteen where he sells home cooked food (chick peas and rice dish). The others are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Kaniz baji prepares food for her son’s canteen on daily basis. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy another video game for her husband’s shop. 

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Allah Rakhi baji requests a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Bashiran baji requests a loan to buy bangles to resell. Mumtaz baji and Lal baji each request a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy stock for a video game shop

loans.name: Assem

texts.en:
Assem is a 26-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon. He has been a taxi driver for almost two years. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase another car. This is the first time that Assem has requested a loan.

Assem is special because he starts his day early in the morning. With his business, he earns more or less 1000 US dollars per month. When he first started his business, he had difficulties buying a license plate for his taxi. In the future, he plans to buy another taxi.

loans.use: Assem needs the loan to purchase another car.

loans.name: Channthol

texts.en:
Mrs. Channthol B. is a villager in Ba Thay village in Kampong Cham province. She owns a small restaurant where she sells Chinese noodles to the villagers and passers-by. Her husband, Mr. Som Yen, is a motorbike taxi driver. He now faces an obstacle because he does not have much money to repair his motorbike. Additionally, since Mrs. Channthol B.’s business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to fix her husband's motorbike. She would use any remainder of the money to buy more chairs, plates, and glasses for her business.

Mrs. Channthol B. is the 48-year-old mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is also in the picture.

loans.use: to fix her husband's motorbike

loans.name: Benkadi  (L’ Entente). Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi de l’association Dembagnouma est constitué de cinq femmes toutes mariées vivant dans des foyers en majorité polygames dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de Koutiala, région de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles cohabitent ensemble depuis très longtemps et ont en moyenne 30 ans et 3 enfants. Elles mènent  comme activité principale la vente d’ arachide et sa transformation en pâte. En plus, elles font également la vente d’habits pour enfant. Elles ont de l’expérience dans la transformation de l’arachide et le commerce d’habits.
Dans le souci d’augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso.Le groupe Benkadi est à son premier prêt solidaire(prêt de groupe).
 Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour achéter des sacs d’arachide et des habits pour enfants  qui seront  revendus  au marché ou de porte en porte. Elles vendent généralement au comptant et en détail à une clientèle constituée de toutes les catégories sociales.
Ainsi avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent réaliser en moyenne 55 000 F CFA de bénéfice chacune au cours de ce cycle. Ce bénéfice sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt et faire face aux charges courantes de la famille.
 Dans l’avenir, le groupe compte obtenir  un prêt élévé pour pouvoir diversifier les activités.
texts.en:
This Benkadi group belonging to the Dembagnouma association is made up of 5 married women who live in mostly polygamous families in the Hamdallaye district of the town of Koutiala, Sikasso region (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They have been living together for a very long time and have an average age of 30 with, on average, 3 children. Their main business is selling peanuts and transforming them into peanut butter. Besides that, they also sell outfits for children. They have experience in producing peanut butter and in selling clothing.

With the intention of expanding their businesses, the members decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. The Benkadi group is on their very first solidarity loan (group loan). This loan will be used to buy sacks of peanuts and clothing for children that will be re-sold at the market or door-to-door. They generally sell for cash and retail, to a clientele composed of all sorts of people.

With this loan, they each expect to make on average 55,000 F CFA in profit during the loan cycle. This profit will be used to reimburse the loan and help support their families. In future, the group hopes to obtain a bigger loan so that they can diversify their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of peanuts and clothing for children

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru: Фарход Абдижалилов 1978 года рождения, женат имеет 4 детей. Восемь лет назад он начал  перепродавать скот на рынке, раньше этим бизнесом занимался его отец, потом передал Фарходу, так как он женился, надо было прокармливать семью. Кроме этого он  водитель - дальнего рейса, он возит в своей грузовой машине камни и другие тяжелые грузы. Потому что от откорма и продажи скота бывает доход только через 3 месяца, а в остальное время одни расходы. Он получил кредит  в Микронвест от КИВА и прикупил 2 коровы и корм .
texts.en:
Farhod A. was born in 1978. He is married and has 4 children. Eight years ago, after getting married, Farhod took over his father's business of selling cattle. In addition, Farhod is a truck driver. To earn a living, Farhod transports stones and other heavy cargo over long distances, because cattle farming is only profitable 3 months a year. This loan Farhod will use to purchase 2 cows and food for them.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 23-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon. Ahmad has owned a butcher shop since 2006. He requested a loan of $1,200 from Al Majmoua in order to expand his business by opening a restaurant. This is the first time that Ahmad has requested a loan.

Ahmad is special in his work because he sells a good, clean quality of meat. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Ahmad first started his business, he had difficulty purchasing the necessary machines and tools for his work. He decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on opening his restaurant.

loans.use: To expand his business by opening a restaurant

loans.name: Francis

texts.es:
Francis  es socia del Bancomunal  Las Surcanitas.
Francis es conviviente tiene 36 años, tiene tres hijos de 15, 5, y 4 años que están en la escuela estatal.
Francis empezó en este negocio hace  años, un pariente necesitaba un ayudante para su local de cerrajería  y él se encontraba sin trabajo acepto, con los años aprendió, ahora el es un maestro cerrajero, tiene gente su cargo quien le enseña  y trabaja para él. Actualmente el tiene un local de cerrajería con su amigo.
Desde que está en Finca, ha podido juntar un capital para invertir y cumplir con sus clientes, aprendió ahorrar por que antes no lo hacía. 
Francis  necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de barras de fierro, para la  confección de puertas y ventanas. 
El sueño de Francis es terminar de construir su casa y darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Francis is a member of the Bancomunal Las Surcanitas.

Francis lives with his partner. He is 36 years old and has three children, ages 15, 5, and 4, who go to public school. Francis began this career several years ago, when a relative needed an assistant for his local locksmith shop, and Francis, who was unemployed, accepted. He learned a lot over the years and is now a master locksmith, with people working under him and reporting to him. Currently he runs a local locksmith shop with a friend.

Since joining Finca, he has been able to raise money to invest and meet his customers' needs. He learned to save money, which he never did before.

Francis needs a loan of 1000 soles to purchase iron bars to make doors and windows.

Francis' dream is to finish constructing his house and provide the best for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Francis needs a loan of 1000 soles to purchase iron bars to make doors and windows

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: Doña Maria Eugenia, reside en el barrio Martin Luther King en la ciudad de Managua, tiene 33 años de edad, su esposo es promotor de crédito, con tres hermosos hijos que están estudiando, ella tiene un cafetín en un mercado de la capital, se llama mercado oriental, y es uno de lo mas visitados por los Nicaragüenses por su variedad de productos y bajos precios, inicio con la experiencia que adquirió de su mama, y ahorros propio compro el cafetín, lleva trece años administrándolo. Con este crédito quiere invertir en construcción pues desea terminar de construir un cuarto para sus hijos para que estén en mejor condición, uno de sus mejores deseos es poder terminar su casa, da las gracias Afodenic por el beneficio  y el apoyo. A futuro espera tener nuevos segmento de mercado y poder dar estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria Eugenia lives in the Martin Luther King neighborhood of Managua. She is 33 years old, with three beautiful children who are in school. Her husband is a loan officer. She owns a coffee shop in the capital's Mercado Oriental, one of the most visited by Nicaraguans for its variety and low prices. She began with the experience she had learned from her mother and bought the shop with her own savings. She has spent three years running her business. With this loan she hopes to build a room for her children; one of her greatest wishes is to be able to finish her house. She thanks Afodenic for their benefits and support. In the future she hopes to have a new market segment and be able to provide for her children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to finish a room for her children

loans.name: Santusa

texts.es:
Santusa es agricultora, trabaja las tierras de su esposo y tiene dos hijos a los cuales los mantiene con la venta de verduras; su esposo es albañil y ellos viven en la casa de su cuñada que queda en la comunidad de Palomar, región Rió abajo de la ciudad de La Paz.  


El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera, ya que en este tiempo es que baja  de precio el ganado. 
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Santusa is a farmer. She works her husband’s land. She has two children. She supports them by selling vegetables. Her husband is a brick layer. They live in her sister in law’s house in the Palomar community, Río region, below the city of La Paz. The loan is to buy a dairy cow. Livestock prices have now gone down. This is her first loan with Impro. An evaluation shows that she qualifies for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia G., 53 years old, is from the village of Sibula. Bonifacia is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Bonifacia owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Bonifacia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2004, Bonifacia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Bonifacia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC.

Bonifacia is requesting a new loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and gain working capital. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Bonifacia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and gain working capital

loans.name: Tembiapora Group

texts.en:
The Committee Tembiapora (which means “good work” in Guaraní) has worked with the Fundación Paraguaya for three years and has 17 participants. Its leader, Mrs. Beatriz B., owns a small convenience store that she started six months ago with the help of her husband. She sells candy, juices, sodas and cold foods, makes a steady income and hopes to expand her small business. Her commitment to success is shared by the other members of her loan group:
1	Beatriz B. --	Food sales 
2	Pabla P. --	General store 
3	Teodora G. --	Dressmaker 
4	Irma P. --	Hair salon 
5	Cinthia S. --	Teacher 
6	Jorgelina G. --	Cleaning product sales 
7	 Andrea B. --	Domestic employee 
8	Rosa V. --	Interior Decorator 
9	Elida C. --	Clothing sales 
10	Mirian M. --	Dressmaker 
11	Guillermina M. --	Clothing sales 
12	Georgina F. --	Cook 
13	Verena B. --	Cleaning product sales 
14	Silvia A. --	Hair salon 
15	Silvia M. --	Cosmetic sales 
16	Atanacia B. --	Food sales 
17	Maximiana B. --	Food sales

loans.use: The buy more merchandise and raw materials.

loans.name: Faizan Zahoor Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Khalida bjai wants a loan to buy goats for her animal-selling business.

Kaniz begum baji and Naziran baji each want a loan to buy seasonal fruit for their fruit-selling businesses.

Faizan baji is the group leader of the aforementioned ladies. She has belonged to a city named Vehari, Pakistan, for the past twelve years and operates a clothes-sewing business. Her husband’s name is Z. A. and he is an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor-vehicle) driver. He drives a rented auto-rickshaw because he has no other skill to serve his family. Faizan baji wants to buy an auto-rickshaw for her husband so that he enjoys his work and pays more attention to it.

Faizan baji is the one sewing clothes in the photo.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw for her husband

loans.name: Atsu

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur achète des motos qu’il exploite pour des activités de taxi motos. Il veut acheter une autre moto pour l’exploiter pour les activités de taxi moto, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter une moto. 
Etant célibataire, c’est avec le revenu de cette activité qu’il subvient à ses charges.
texts.en:
This man buys motorcycles to operate a business of moto-taxi. He wants to buy another motorcycle to use in his moto-taxi business. He is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy a motorcycle.

Being single, the income from this activity provides for his expenses.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle to use as taxi, moto-taxi.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Préstamo anterior: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=102616&_tpos=f&_tpg=h
Sabina  es socia del Bancomunal Virgen D. las Mercedes.
Sabina, tiene su bodega-bazar,  lamentablemente pasó por una gran dificultad, salió  a visitar a un pariente cerrando su tienda y cuando regresó a su casa lamentablemente le habían robado vaciándole toda su tienda,  cuando ella llegó solo vio sus mostradores(vitrinas) vacíos, se llevaron los sacos D. arroz azúcar, dulces, casi toda su mercadería. 
Sabina necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles, para la compra D. abarrotes, aceite arroz, azúcar, fideos. Pues desea continuar con su negocio
El préstamo siempre le ayuda, en este caso será para surtir su bodega
El sueño D. Sabina es  levantar su tienda nuevamente.
texts.en:
Sabina is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen D. las Mercedes”. She operates a grocery store/bazaar. Unfortunately, she went through great difficulty. She closed her store so that she could leave town to visit a relative. When she returned, she discovered that her store had been burglarized. The only things that remained were her display cases. The thieves took sacks of rice, sugar, candy, and almost all of her remaining merchandise. Sabina needs a loan of 2000 soles in order to buy grocery items such as oil, rice, sugar and noodles. She hopes to continue her business. Her loans have always been a great help, and in this case, it will enable her to stock her store. Sabina hopes to raise her business to a new level. Click HERE to view Sabina's previous loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grocery items such as oil, rice, sugar and noodles

loans.name: Diabou

texts.fr: Diabou D. est une femme de 57 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants. Depuis 6 ans elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Saré Yéroyel dont elle fait partie des dirigeantes. Elle exerce un petit commerce de d'arachide, de thé et de sucre. Elle a une bonne expérience de son activé pour l'avoir menée depuis plus de 5 ans. Ses bénéfices lui servent à se prendre en charge et à appuyer son mari dans les besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Diabou D. is a 58-year-old woman.  She is married and the mother of eight.  For six years, she has been a member of Banc Villageois de Saré Yéroyel, where she's in management.  She operates a small business selling peanuts, tea, and sugar.  She has good experience in her business for having run it for over five years.  Her profits go to supporting herself and her husband for meeting family needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her working capital

loans.name: Ameth

texts.en:
Ameth is  a member of the Ganglonga borrower group in Kinayanambo, Iringa. She is 38 Year old woman. She is married and a mother of 2 children. Her children  are 14 and 3  years old.

Ameth has owned a Grocery  business for 3 years, She works 10 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 50,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Ameth`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more Drinks like beer, sods.

With the  additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Ameth hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more Drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Progresando Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Progresando se encuentra en la comunidad de Caja, distrito de Caja,  Provincia de Acobamba, Departamento de Huancavelica.
Esta comunidad se encuentra ubicada a 4 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, la cual se caracteriza por su agricultura y ganadería.

Una de sus socias es Faustina, es casada y tiene 04 hijos. Faustina se dedica a la venta de comida y abarrotes, ayudada por su esposo e hijos. Faustina solicita un préstamo para poder invertirlo en su negocio, comprando mercadería. Faustina, tiene como meta mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, por ello se ha propuesto ahorrar.

Marisa es casada. Marisa tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, donde vende productos de primera necesidad. Marisa comparte la administración de su negocio con su esposo e hijos. Marisa, requiere de un préstamo para  la implementación de su negocio, así como para la compra de mercadería. Marisa, tiene por meta, que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: El Bancomunal Progresando solicita un préstamo de 6,400 soles para que sus 13 socias inviertan en sus negocios

loans.name: Simona

texts.es: Simona tiene 50 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales solamente dos dependen de ella. Su esposo tiene 44 años. Simona se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida, tiene su puesto de venta ubicado en el mercado central. Se dedica a esta actividad hace mucho tiempo atrás. Generalmente elabora platos paceños. El nivel de competencia es alto, ya que existen varias personas que se dedican a esta actividad, pero la demanda también es alta, y el lugar donde está ubicado su negocio le favorece bastante. El destino del crédito fue para compra de un horno industrial. Es el cuarto crédito al que accede Simona, presento un comportamiento bueno en los anteriores créditos. No presenta antecedentes negativos en el sistema financiero ni en nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Simona is 50 years old, married and has three children, only two of which are still dependents. Her husband is 44. Simona makes a living making and selling food. She has a sales post located in the central market and has been dedicated to this activity for a long time. Usually she makes typical regional meals. The level of competition is high because there is a number of people who make a living in this activity, but the demand is also quite high, and the location of her business helps her out a lot. She plans to use the loan to purchase an industrial oven. This is the fourth loan Simona has been granted, and she has been good with her previous loans. She has a clean credit history with this and any other microfinance instutiton.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an industrial oven

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.en:
Maria Angela J. B. (pictured with her brother) is a 30-year-old single mother. She has two children, 6 and 15, and both are in private school.  She works from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. selling produce (bananas, cucumbers, tomatoes and onions) and CDs from her home. For 10 years, Ms. J. has run this store from her home with help from her brother and mother.  

In order to increase sales, Ms. J. would like to move to a higher-traffic area. She is requesting a loan in order to rent a stall on the corner of the main road. Ms. J. hopes that a new locale will allow her to increase her monthly income. She thanks you for supporting her business so that her family may prosper!

loans.use: To rent a stall

loans.name: Anabelita

texts.en:
Anabelita A. is from the village of Tiaman Bonifacio Misamis Occ. She is 49 years old. Anabelita is widowed and has four adult children. To make a living, Anabelita owns & operates a restaurant serving a variety of foods to the customers in the local community. Anabelita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Anabelita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anabelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Anabelita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Anabelita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Twere Nyame Yie Ampa Group

texts.en: Mabel, who stands at right in the photograph, is 42 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. The fishing business is the major occupation of the people. She trades in second-hand clothes. Mabel is the leader of a trust bank group called Rely on God. The members of the group are mainly into fishing business and other commercial activities. The group requests for a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Urangerel

texts.en: Urangerel B. is 35 years old and lives with her husband and three teenage children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her three sons are 10, 14 and 15 years old. All the boys go to a local secondary school. Urangerel sells basic food products in a small stall that she rents at the Burd shopping market, one of the large outdoor markets in Ulaanbaatar. Her husband also helps in her business whenever she needs a hand. Besides helping her, her husband works as a taxi driver. Urangerel sells various bakery products including cakes, cookies, etc.  She hopes to expand her business by adding more variety of baked goods in her list of products. She requests a loan to purchase more bakery products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more bakery products

loans.name: Martha De La Concepción

texts.es:
La señora Martha Gonzales es una persona muy trabajadora que tiene su propio negocio de pulpería habiéndolo iniciado desde hace cuatro años y hoy en día se ha ido desarrollando porque ella ha invertido en dicha pulpería. 
Ella es madre de tres hijos pero ya no viven con ella por lo que le toca a ella mima velar por el bienestar de su negocio. Por ello es que solicita un crédito para la compra de los productos para la pulpería entre los que se encuentran galletas, golosinas, papel higiénico y también para la compra de ropa para niños y niñas con el fin de comercializarlas en su pulpería.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha Gonzalez is a very hard working person and has her own convenience store and has had it for 4 years, it has grown because she has invested a lot in it.

She is a mother to 3 children but they no longer live with her, and it is up to her to take care of her business. She needs a loan to buy products for her store such as cookies, candy, toilet paper, and also to buy children’s clothing to sell them in her convenience store.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandize for her convenience store.

loans.name: Alie A.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured are teachers from a primary school in Masomgbo village, one of the villages surrounding Makeni City. This school was established in 1950 to train children of the Masomgbo community, and villages close to it, as future leaders. Over the years, the school has produced a great number of lecturers, teachers, and other professionals in different walks of life. Currently, the school has 488 pupils and a staff of 13 teachers.

This is the second loan these teachers are accessing from Kiva through SMT. School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not be able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Fifty-seven-year-old Alie A. S. (left) is the headmaster at the school and has been a teacher for 36 years. He was born in Masomgbo village, and is married with ten children; some of his children are in primary school, some in secondary school, and others are in college. Alie will use his loan to pay his children's school fees. (Attached on the photo is a snapshot of 2 staff members who were not present for the group photo.)

loans.use: Pay school fees and other school-related charges for his children

loans.name: Angelica Isabel

texts.es: Angelica tiene 20 años es soltera, estudio hasta el 5o grado y lleva 5 años dedicada a la produccion de calzado junto con su madre y sus hermanos. Ahora ha acudido a ASDIR para solicitar un credito para poder comprar dos herramientas para la fabricacion de zapato. Con esta actividad ella y su familia han logrado estabilizarse economicamente.
texts.en:
Angelica is 20 years old and single. She went to school until the fifth grade. She has been making footwear with her mother and her siblings for five years. She has now come to ASDIR to request a loan to be able to buy two tools for making shoes. She and her family have been able to stabilize themselves economically through this activity.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools for making shoes

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Doña Maria Teresa es habitante de la colonia Puerto Principe de Nueva Guinea, es casada con el productor Wilfredo Cruz, tiene 6 hijos, los cuales le ayudan al trabajo que desarrolla en las actividades del campo estableciendo cultivos de raices y tuberculos, ordeño y el cuido del hato ganadero, donde obtiene sus ingresos económico, su finca presenta buenas condiciones técnica.  Esta solicitando su 2do credito para compra de terneros para cuidarlos y desarrollarlos, es decir engordarlos para que obtengan un buen peso que al venderlos le permita obtener buenas ganancias que le ayuden a mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. Doña Teresa es una mujer emprendedora en su que hacer de la finca, honesta y de buenas costumbres, sus deseo en el futuro es de incrementar su inventario ganadero, asì tener mejores condiciones para sus hijos, pues es la herencia que podra darles cuando les falte.
texts.en:
Doña Maria Teresa is a resident of the Puerto Principe subdivision of Nueva Guinea. She is married to Wilfredo Cruz, who is an agricultural producer. They have six children who help with the farm activities such as cultivating their root and tuber crops, and nursing and taking care of their cattle herd. Her farm has suitable conditions which help them generate income.

She is requesting her second loan to buy calves to care for and raise. The calves will be fattened to achieve a good weight for resale, which will help them obtain good earnings and help improve the family’s living conditions. Doña Teresa is an enterprising woman who has established her farm through honest work and great discipline. Her wish for the future is to increase her herd so that she can provide her children with better conditions and leave them an inheritance so that they lack nothing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Monsieur  Ibrahima D. est un jeune garçon  ambitieux de 24 ans qui vit à Ouakam et est membre de la caisse depuis quelques années. Il a déjà bénéficié  d’un prêt antérieur  au sein de l’institution. Il a une activité très diversifiée  de commerce car il vend en même  temps des vaisselles, des matelas, des lits, des armoires et des produits de quincaillerie. Il a une expérience  de 10 ans dans  le commerce. Et c’est par le biais de son père qu’il exerce aujourd’hui cette activité. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs dans le but d’acheter des lits et armoires destines a la vente. Les prêts  l’aident a acquérir  d’autres biens.
texts.en:
Mr. Ibrahima D. is a 24-year old young man who lives in Ouakam. He has been a member of the credit association for a few years. He has already received previous loans from the institution. He has a very diversified retail activity. He sells dishes, mattresses, beds, cupboards, and hardware items. He has a ten-year experience in the business. He learned the business he is practicing today through his father. He is requesting a loan of 500, 000 Francs [XOF] ] in order to buy beds and cupboards for resale. The loans help him acquire other items.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengtening capital

loans.name: Omolade

texts.en: To earn a living in Ogbomosho, Omolade sells colorful sarongs and items made of lace. Her customers are mostly young ladies and married women. She hopes to own a boutique in the future, but for now has applied for a loan for N80,000 to buy more sarongs and lace items to sell at her current location. She is 34 years old, married and has four children. She takes great joy in the fact that they are excelling in school. Omolade and her husband, who also works hard, extend their sincerest thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more sarongs and lace items to sell

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 32 years old and married with one child who is three years old. He grows vegetables and cereals on his farm to earn a living. He has been in the business for thirteen years and has three employees.

Moses saves his money on a weekly basis with his group in Faulu Kenya which enables him to access loans which the group guarantees. He has previously taken out two loans from Faulu Kenya of Kes 60,000 which he used to expand his business and which he successfully repaid.

Moses hopes to grow his business to large-scale farming and improve his living standards in the future. He has requested a loan of Kes 40,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy farm inputs and seedlings.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and seedlings

loans.name: Corazon's Group

texts.en:
Corazon B. is from the village of Taguilon. She is 45 years old. Corazon is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is B.'s Group.

Corazon is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Corazon owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Corazon has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP average a month for these activities.

In 2007, Corazon joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Corazon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Corazon from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria S. prepares cassava dough and bags of water for sale at Takoradi. She is married and has four children. She has no educational background. Victoria uses her income to help her husband provide food, clothing and shelter for the family. Victoria will use the loan to purchase more cassava to prepare cassava dough for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Victoria plans to support her home.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava

loans.name: Budumbuli East Development Group, Jinja

texts.en:
38-year-old K. Glades is a sturdy, evergreen and down-to-earth married woman. For a decade now she has been plying a roaring trade in her restaurant business in Bugembe, Jinja. The fact that she has been doing great business all this while goes without saying. Of paramount importance to her in establishing a firm niche in the minds of her customers and on the market has been the embracing of good customer care skills. This in many respects worked in her favor.

Glades began with a pancake-selling business before she nurtured the whole idea of setting up this restaurant business. To manifest that she and her family can live within the means provided by this business, all her five children are attending good schools and she has bought a commercial taxi.

In the course of time, Glades has reached a satisfactory profit-maximizing point in her business. In a week, she makes profits to the tune of 120,000 shillings and she is anticipating even better prospects with the acquisition of this loan. She also ekes out supplementary profits from her taxi business. The purchase of substantial amounts of foodstuffs for her restaurant is what is in the offing for her.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs for her restaurant business

loans.name: Citali Group

texts.es:
ESTE  GRUPO SOLIDARIO SE LLAMA CITLALI Y SIGNIFICA LUCERO ESTA UBICADO EN LA COMUNIDAD DE HUEYAPAN, MORELOS, MEXICO, ESTA FORMADO POR 6 INTEGRANTES QUE SE CONOCEN Y SON VECINO LOS INVITO LA SRA. EMELIA  Y ESTUBIERON DE ACUERDO EN SOLICITAR EL CREDITO NO. 1 CON FUNDACION REALIDAD.

EL REPRESENTANTE DEL GRUPO ES LA SEÑORA ADELA B. R., TIENE 40 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTUDIO HASTA EL 3º. GRADO DE SUCUNDARIA Y TIENE 4 HIJOS, 3 HOMBRES Y 1 MUJER, CESAR TIENE 19 AÑOS, SOLEDAD 14 AÑOS, FRANCISCO 12 Y ALEXIS TIENE 6 AÑOS. ELLA SE DEDICA A LA COMPRA VENTA DE BLUSAS Y SERVILLETAS, SU CREDITO LO QUIERE PARA COMPRAR BLUSAS Y SERVILLETA, INICIO ESTE NEGOCIO HACE 6 AÑOS POR NECECIDADES ECONOMICAS Y PARA QUE SUS NIÑOS FUERAN A LA ESCUELA, SU TIO LE HACE LAS BLUSAS TEJIDAS A GANCHO DE ESTAMBRE Y LAS SERVILLETA, VENDE LA MERCANCIA EN SU COMUNIDAD DE HUEYAPAN LAS VA OFRECIENDO DE CASA EN CASA Y SI LAS TERMINA, SU HIJA LE AYUDA A COBRARLES A LOS CLIENTES QUE LE QUEDAN A DEBER. EL NEGOCIO HA AYUDADO A SU FAMILIA EN LA ALIMENTACION Y GASTOS DE LA ESCUELA DE SUS HIJOS, CON LAS GANACIAS COMPRA MAS BLUSAS Y SERVILLETAS. ELLA DESEA HACER SU COCINA YA QUE TIENE UNA PROVISIONAL SOLO CON UN TECHO ESPERA LOGRARLO VENDINDO MAS BLUSAS Y SERVILLETAS. 
EN SU COMUNIDAD DE HUEYAPAN EL CLIMA ES FRESCO, HAY MUCHAS FRUTAS PERAS, CAPULINES, DURAZNOS, CIRUELA, HAY MUCHA VEGETACION, ÁRBOLES, PINOS Y FLORES MUY BONITAS, TAMBIEN HAY MUCHOS ANIMALES BORREGOS, CHIVOS, ETC. 
LA SRA. ADELA B. R. LES DA LAS GRACIAS A KIVA Y A FUNDACION REALIDAD POR ABERME PRESTADO Y CONFIARON EN MI, ESPERO NO QUEDAR MAL.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Citali" (meaning "Bright Star") and is located in the community of Hueyapan, Morelos, Mexico. The group is made up of six members who know one another and are neighbors. Ms. Emelia invited them to get together and they agreed to request their first loan from Fundacion Realidad. The representative of this group is Ms. Adela B. R.. She is 40 years old and educated through the third year of secondary school. She has four children (three boys and one girl). Cesar is 19, Soledad is 14, Francisco is 12, and Alexis is 6 years old. Adela sells shirts and napkins. She is requesting this loan to buy shirts and napkins. She started this business six years ago out of economic necessity and in order to send her children to school. Her uncle makes crocheted tops and napkins from yarn. She sells the merchandise in her community of Hueyapan by going from house to house offering her goods. Her daughter helps her to collect payment from customers who owe her money. The business has helped to feed her family and to pay her children's school expenses. With her earnings, she buys more tops and napkins. She would like to improve her kitchen, as she currently has only a provisional kitchen with just a roof. She hopes to achieve this by selling more shirts and napkins. In her community of Hueyapan, the climate is cool and there are many fruits, such as pears, chokecherries, peaches, and plums. There is a lot of vegetation like trees, pine trees, and very beautiful flowers. There are also many animals, like lambs, goats, etc. Ms. Adela B. R. thanks Kiva and Fundacion Realidad for lending to her and for having confidence in her. She hopes she will not let you down.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy blouses and napkins
